"Huh? That much?"
"If I bring it, Hong Ye-seong will make me a weapon. I desperately need an S-grade weapon."
"Oh... right. Your weapon broke, didn't it?"
"Yeah. And the system ranking update is coming soon. After getting the magic stone to Hong Ye-seong, I'll commission my custom S-grade weapon and beat Gyu-Gyu in the ranking update. It's the perfect plan."
Gyu-Gyu was the ranker just above her. Like everyone else, she had her grand ambitions visiting this hangover soup restaurant. Cha Eui-jae vowed to punch Hong Ye-seong someday if he ever met him. For reference, Hong Ye-seong still posted about his longing for magic stones daily on InHeart.
Bae Won-woo nodded with a dubious expression.
"Well, that makes sense. But why are you looking for Sa-young?"
"Because that crazy guy blocked all the info sources!"
Bang! Honeybee slammed her fist down. Fortunately, before her hand hit the table, Bae Won-woo swiftly intercepted it with his palm. Seeing Bae Won-woo save the table, Cha Eui-jae gave him a thumbs-up from behind the counter.
'Damn, tanks protect property these days too.'
Cha Eui-jae added an extra meaty bone to Bae Won-woo's stew. Honeybee, still fuming, calmed down a bit.
"Did the table break?"
"No, I saved it."
"Thanks. Anyway, until a few days ago, information was circulating."
Honeybee's long-winded explanation boiled down to this: A sudden magic stone listing and deletion by EZ on Tomato Market. Normally, this would be a mere curiosity, but Hong Ye-seong's promise of a custom weapon skyrocketed its importance.
A custom weapon from Hong Ye-seong! A priceless item worth hundreds of millions. Hunters eager for quick riches swarmed to track EZ, and Honeybee, having recently lost her precious weapon, joined the hunt anonymously. Together, they formed a tracking team, sharing and analyzing every scrap of information.
Honeybee tugged at her golden hair in frustration.
"We enhanced the magic stone photo, looking for reflections, analyzed the phone model, and even compared the background newspaper to identify the publication. We dissected that photo down to the nano level, chasing every lead."
'...That far?'
Listening quietly, Cha Eui-jae broke out in a cold sweat. The technological advancement and hunters' obsession were terrifying. Even Bae Won-woo looked a bit overwhelmed.
"...That far?"
He echoed Cha Eui-jae's thoughts. Honeybee groaned, collapsing onto the table. Bae Won-woo swiftly caught her head before it hit, saving the table once again. Cha Eui-jae decided to give Bae Won-woo a free bowl of rice.
"But suddenly, all talk stopped a few days ago. It's not like everyone went into a dungeon! The tracking team went silent. So I asked if something happened."
"Yeah."
"They said they were quitting the chase. Those passionate guys!"
"Wow."
"So I kept digging. Turns out, they got contacted by the Pado Guild's legal team. Told to drop the EZ chase."
"What? Our guild?"
Bae Won-woo looked genuinely shocked. Honeybee, disheveled, muttered gloomily.
"That's all they said. Like they'd been gagged. But it wasn't you, so it's got to be Lee Sa-young."
"That's... probably true."
"And he doesn't meet people much... so I can't ask him directly."
Cha Eui-jae wanted to gather more information from their conversation, but any longer and the stew would boil over. He carried out two hot bowls of hangover soup, rice, kimchi, radish kimchi, and chopped cheongyang pepper on a tray.
Just then, Honeybee was slumped over, and Bae Won-woo was staring blankly.
"Your hangover soup is here."
"Oh! Thank you... wait, we didn't order rice."
Bae Won-woo looked at Cha Eui-jae with a blank face. Cha Eui-jae responded nonchalantly.
"It's on the house."
Bae Won-woo's blank expression turned into one of gratitude and amazement. Honeybee quickly lifted her head. Cha Eui-jae coolly returned to the kitchen.
The restaurant grew quiet again. A small service brought back peace and information. Easy. Cha Eui-jae finished the dishes and handled Bae Won-woo and Honeybee's additional orders smoothly.
A bit later, Bae Won-woo waved from the counter.
"Hey, part-timer! Check, please!"
"Sure. That's ninety thousand won."
After processing the payment and handing back the card, Honeybee suddenly produced a rolled-up item.
"What's this?"
"Unroll it."
Carefully, Cha Eui-jae unfolded it to reveal Honeybee's poster with a big signature on one corner. It would be a prized possession for her fans. Cha Eui-jae's expression momentarily turned odd.
'Why are you giving me this?'
And where did she get it from all of a sudden? She didn't have it when she made her grand entrance. Smiling smugly, she cleared her throat.
"I saw others had autographed posters on the wall?"
"Oh, yes."
"It's a gift. Put mine up too."
Cha Eui-jae almost stared at Honeybee dumbfounded but remembered he wasn't supposed to show his feelings. So he smiled widely.

chapters.title: Chapter 26: Butterfly Effect
chapters.content:
Chapter 26: Butterfly Effect
"It's a gift. Put mine up too."
"..."
"Well, this kind of fan service is basic. It's not because I was grateful for the rice."
Honeybee brushed her shimmering hair back. She looked ecstatic to meet her fan, anyone could see it.
If a quick-witted person had been nearby, they would have teased her for acting so out of character, but fortunately or unfortunately, the only one with her was the clueless Bae Won-woo. He was genuinely impressed.
"Oh~ are you a fan of Honeybee, part-timer?"
"...Excuse me?"
"Hey, come by more often. He says he's a fan."
Shut up.
"Well, I'm really busy, but I might come by again."
Please, never come back.
Honeybee and Bae Won-woo left the shop together. Cha Eui-jae stared blankly at the ceiling, holding the signed poster under his arm.
'I could get rich just selling signatures.'
However, since Cha Eui-jae's Tomato Market account was suspended, Honeybee's signed poster would end up next to Jung Bin's signature. That afternoon, when Park Ha-eun got home from school, she noticed the Honeybee poster and immediately ran up to it.
"Uncle, what's this?"
"It's a Honeybee poster."
"The real Honeybee?"
Somehow, her voice seemed to get louder. Cha Eui-jae, who had been putting away the groceries, looked at Park Ha-eun with a puzzled expression. She was practically glued to the wall, almost rubbing her cheek against the poster.
"Did Honeybee come by today?"
Her voice was almost a scream now.
"Yeah. She even signed it right there."
"I, I."
Park Ha-eun, close to rubbing her cheek against the poster, began to tear up.
"Huh?"
"Uncle, I..."
"Why, what's wrong?"
"I want to see Honeybee!"
'Damn it.'
He had cursed her not to come back, but now he had to cancel that curse within a few hours.
***
"Sa-young, did you skip a meal again?!"
Thud, thud, thud. With heavy footsteps, the Vice-Guild Leader Bae Won-woo burst into the Guild Leader's office. Lee Sa-young frowned slightly but it wasn't visible because of his blindfold.
He was lying on the sofa in the Guild Leader's office, firmly equipped with a black blindfold and earplugs. Bae Won-woo approached and started nagging out of habit.
"People live on food, you know. You seem to be eating well lately, why are you skipping meals again?"
It wasn't the first time Lee Sa-young had a small appetite. Bae Won-woo clicked his tongue and brought a tablet to stand in front of him. He didn't care if Lee Sa-young had earplugs on or not.
After all, for Lee Sa-young, earplugs were just a tool to slightly reduce noise. That's what it means to be an S-grade awakened.
"The Awakened Management Bureau sent an official letter. They're requesting cooperation as they'll activate the emergency response system on the day of the ranking announcement."
"..."
Lee Sa-young responded by wiggling his foot.
"Okay."
Bae Won-woo flipped the screen.
"The dungeon at Jongno 3-ga will be handled by our team. The advance team will clear it first, and then researchers will enter for resource investigation."
Wiggle.
"And Seowon Guild is asking for a visit sometime."
Wiggle.
"That's the urgent stuff... Oh, and I'm thinking of doing a commercial."
"..."
Whoever had filled his head with such ideas, it wasn't worth responding to, so Lee Sa-young stopped wiggling. But Bae Won-woo kept talking.
"The part-timer at the soup restaurant is a fan of Honeybee. I thought he wasn't interested in hunters at all, but I guess you can't ignore public exposure."
"...What?"
Lee Sa-young slowly lifted one side of his blindfold.
"Say that again."
"What? That you can't ignore public exposure?"
"No, before that."
"I'm doing a commercial?"
"You... are you doing this on purpose?"
"No, what did I do?"
"You mentioned the part-timer."
"Oh, the part-timer? Said he was a fan of Honeybee."
"...What?"
There was only one part-timer Bae Won-woo could be referring to. The part-timer at the soup restaurant.
"Honeybee even signed a poster for him. I should learn from such fan service."
Bae Won-woo started enthusiastically talking about the proper attitude of hunters. Lee Sa-young, still holding the blindfold he had half-lifted, fell into thought. Come to think of it, Cha Eui-jae treated him and Jung Bin differently. And now, he was a fan of Honeybee?
Common traits of Jung Bin and Honeybee...
'Commercial stars.'
Ha, Lee Sa-young let out a dry laugh. It seemed like Cha Eui-jae had a peculiar taste for high-profile individuals.
Roughly throwing off his blindfold, he gestured to Bae Won-woo, who had been babbling about his rosy future as a top-ranking hunter after shooting a commercial.
"Stop fantasizing and call the head of promotions."
"Wow, Sa-young. Are you really letting me shoot a commercial?"
"Quickly."
***
With the evening rush over, Cha Eui-jae was organizing the account book at the counter of the soup restaurant. Today's count was easy since there weren't many unfortunate hunters who threw money and stormed out.
Just then, two text messages arrived on Cha Eui-jae's phone.
Sa-young: CBS
Sa-young: Turn it on
What could this guy, who hadn't contacted him or visited the shop in a while, want? Lee Sa-young had asked him to turn on CBS, but there was no need to change the channel. It was already on, having just finished the popular weekend drama. Cha Eui-jae glanced at the TV.
—Change your color. CyC.
This guy couldn't have contacted him just to watch Honeybee's commercial. What was the next program? Cha Eui-jae was trying to recall the schedule.
The dye company logo disappeared, and now there was a beautiful single house with a large yard. A happy family was watching a retriever run around the yard, laughing. Ha ha ha, ho ho ho, woof woof.
And then, appearing against that background...
A gas mask.
'...Gas mask?'
The pen Cha Eui-jae was using to record the amount on the ledger stopped mid-air. He couldn't help but gape at the screen.
Clink—
This was the sound of a hunter dropping his glass while watching TV by the water dispenser.
Hunters are sensitive to loud noises. Instinctively turning towards the source of the noise, they first saw the hunter who had dropped the glass, then his dumbfounded face, and naturally followed his gaze.
And they saw 'it'.
"Crazy..."
One hunter dropped the spoon he was holding. Another spit out water like an actor in a drama spitting out orange juice. One even made the sign of the cross and started praying. The entire soup restaurant was thrown into shock and horror.
The writing next to the gas mask-wearing figure in front of the family read:
[Pado Guild Leader Lee Sa-young]
The gas mask-wearing figure in a neat suit stretched out his left hand. With his right hand, he made a V sign with his index and middle fingers, overlaying it on his left palm. Although both hands were in black gloves, making it hard to see.
A low, mechanical voice spoke.
—For inquiries about awakening registration, call the Awakened Bureau hotline 777. For unregistered reports and awakened crime reports, call 555.
—The Korea Awakened Management Bureau is always by your side.
Ha ha ha, ho ho ho, 555.
The happy family and the gas mask figure waved their hands side to side. As the screen darkened, the music faded out with it. Silence filled the air. A professional voice actor quickly recited a disclaimer like a rap.
—Failure to report an awakening without special reasons within a month will result in a fine of up to 100 million won. Please visit the nearest Awakened Registration Center for an awakening checkup. Public Service Advertisement Council.
Everyone in the restaurant was speechless for a long time. Even after the ad ended, no one spoke first. It was like they were under a collective silence spell.
It wasn't until the next program began that the hunters started exhaling roughly. One even pulled out a potion and chugged it in one go.
"Wow..."
"Huff. Huff. Crazy. What did I just see?"
"I felt like I was hit by a confusion debuff."
"Me too."
"Is this real?"
"I think my mental strength just dropped."
"Lee Sa-young is nuts. Now he's attacking our minds too."
"I need to go buy some mental strength-boosting gear."
"Does this mean we'll see that ad every time we watch TV?"
"I'm starting digital detox from today..."
"Shield Guy-nim."
All eyes in shock turned to one person. Sitting like a mountain, quietly eating soup, was the Shield Guy. Indeed, his presence alone drew everyone's attention, fitting of Korea's top tank. A hunter sitting at the same table cautiously asked.
"What... is that?"
Shield Guy, Bae Won-woo, replied gloomily.
"A public service announcement."
"Excuse me?"
"Reminding awakened individuals to register... something like that."
'Was that what it was about?'
Listening to their conversation, Cha Eui-jae nearly dropped his pen again. It wasn't a threat that the gas mask guy would come and kill you if you didn't register?
"Why did Lee Sa-young suddenly shoot a PSA? He always refused all commercial offers."
That question wasn't unique to that hunter. Everyone started sharing their own theories.
"Isn't the annual ranking announcement coming up soon? Maybe he did it to secure first place."
"He'd be first place even without doing something like this."
"Did Jung Bin get some dirt on him?"
"No way."
"Well..."
Bae Won-woo's lips moved as if he wanted to say something but he ended up just burying his face back into his soup bowl.
The man of loyalty, the guy among guys, Bae Won-woo couldn't bring himself to say it.
That Lee Sa-young had personally contacted the Korea Broadcast Advertising Corporation, practically forcing them to let him do a public service announcement. The government employees, who had been delighted to hear that the famously ad-averse Lee Sa-young had reached out, and the promotion team, who had been thrilled that their guild leader was finally going to be in a commercial, were all left speechless at the result.
"If this airs, it's the end of Pado Guild."
"..."
"If this was going to happen, he should have never done a commercial in the first place! Why did he do this?"
The promotion team leader wept, clinging to Bae Won-woo. But Bae Won-woo was utterly powerless.
Instead of explaining, he chose silence. He took a big spoonful of the soup and put it into his mouth. The spicy chili pepper made his eyes water. Sniffling, Bae Won-woo wiped his nose with a nostalgic look.
'Sa-young, I kept my loyalty...'
Cha Eui-jae, who had been staring blankly at the TV screen, snapped out of it when his phone buzzed with a message.
Sa-young: Did you see?
A brazen message had arrived. He was so dumbfounded he didn't know how to reply.
Sa-young: I heard
Sa-young: you like people who do commercials.
Sa-young: ^^
"What the hell is he talking about, this crazy guy..."
Cha Eui-jae... resolved that, if he ever found out who spread the false rumor, he would kill them.

chapters.title: Chapter 27: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
chapters.content:
Chapter 27: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
11:48 PM, Awakened Management Bureau Field Response Team 1 Office. The spacious office was brightly lit despite the late hour.
"Team Leader, would you like a snack?"
"Ah, yes. Just bring me an energy bar, please."
Diligent public servant Jung Bin had volunteered for duty tonight. It wasn't that there was overtime work or urgent tasks, but it was a customary practice at this time of the year.
—We're almost there. In just 12 minutes, we'll be able to see the new rankings! I'm really curious about how the system has calculated the rankings.
Today was the day all hunters eagerly awaited— the ranking update day. With one hand in his pocket and a paper cup in the other, Jung Bin bit down a couple of times on the edge of the cup.
Once a year, the system assigns rankings to all the awakened based on their abilities and achievements. New hunters and veteran hunters alike awaited the ranking update day. The new ranking served as proof of their abilities and influenced their chances of joining new guilds or getting new advertisements.
However, there were often cases where hunters who didn't get their desired rankings caused disturbances, so the Awakened Management Bureau was on high alert during this period. The two anchors on the screen pointed at the data.
—While the exact calculation method of the system's ranking is not disclosed, it is understood that it considers not only the hunter's grade but also their activities throughout the year.
—That's why an A-grade awakened can be ranked higher than an S-grade. There have been many hunters who emerged like comets and showed remarkable activities over the past year. This year's rankings could see significant changes.
—Nevertheless, experts predict that there will be no major changes within the top 20. Let's look at the expected rankings.
1. Lee Sa-young (S)
2. Matthew – Mok Tae-oh (S)
3. Jung Bin (S)
4. Gyu-gyu – Ban Gyu-min (S)
5. Honeybee – Yoo Chae-hyun (A)
6. Doctor – Nam Woo-jin (A)
7. I Am An Artisan – Hong Ye-seong (S)
8. Ham Seok-jeong (A)
9. Song Jo-heon (S)
10. Shield Guy – Bae Won-woo (A)
.
.
.
—Oh, the expected rankings are... the same as the current rankings. They predict no changes at all?
—Yes, that's right. It has been like this for the past two years as well.
'Familiar faces.'
"Team Leader, here you go."
"Ah, thank you."
Jung Bin and the team members started eating their energy bars while standing in front of the monitor. After checking the expected rankings, the team member asked,
"Do you think the rankings will stay the same, Team Leader?"
"Hmm... Yes."
For the past two years, the top 10 rankings hadn't changed. The higher-ranked hunters were more active, meaning their innate abilities had a greater impact, so as the panelists said, there would likely be no change in rankings this year.
The real shift happens in the mid-tier rankings. Everyone thought so, and Jung Bin agreed.
"Unless Honeybee obtains an S-grade weapon, it seems the rankings will stay the same this year."
Just as he finished folding the empty packaging into a note, there was a pop, like a firecracker going off in the air. Startled, Jung Bin looked up at the suddenly appearing white screen.
[RANKING CHANGE!]
[Would you like to check it right now?]
It was a sound he hadn't heard in nearly two years. The alert sound only played when there was a change in the rankings. Upon checking the new rankings, a slight crack appeared on Jung Bin's face.
Rank 4. He had been 2nd even when J was around. After J's death, he briefly rose to 1st, but with Lee Sa-young's arrival, he was pushed back to 2nd. The "eternal second place" title bothered him, but with the emergence of another S-grade, Matthew, he was pushed down another spot.
And now, he was pushed down to 4th. There were only two possibilities for this change:
A new 1st or 2nd place emerged, or the existing 1st and 2nd places died. Either scenario would have significant repercussions. And soon, Jung Bin faced an entirely unexpected third situation.
[Region: South Korea]
1. J
2. Lee Sa-young ▼1
3. Matthew ▼1
4. Jung Bin ▼1
5. Gyu-gyu ▼1
6. Honeybee ▼1
7. Doctor ▼1
8. I Am An Artisan ▼1
9. Ham Seok-jeong ▼1
10. Song Jo-heon ▼1
11. Shield Guy ▼1
Everyone dropped one rank in the expected ranking, with the new 1st place being...
A name everyone knew, J.
It had been eight years since that day, but his name could still be heard everywhere— in documentaries about the West Sea rift, in history books about the Day of the Rift, and even in childish internet arguments about who the world's strongest was.
He was believed to have died in the West Sea rift eight years ago. No one saw his body, but the rift closed, and his name disappeared from the hunter rankings. Since a closed rift never reopened, everyone assumed he was dead.
But now, J suddenly reappeared in the rankings.
What this meant was...
—Oh? Wait, what is this!
—Hold on. The 1st place...
—Has the 1st place changed?
—J?
J was alive.
And he was likely still in the West Sea rift.
'In the worst-case scenario... the West Sea rift might have reappeared.'
The smile vanished from Jung Bin's face. The team member, having checked the rankings, stuttered.
"T-T-Team Leader."
Jung Bin grabbed the suit jacket hanging on the chair and strode toward the door. The team member hastily followed.
"No, Team Leader! This... Did I see it right?"
"How many people can move right now?"
"Uh, excluding those on standby at the scene... about ten in total."
"Leave the minimum personnel and have everyone head to Incheon. Also, mobilize all standby personnel."
"Incheon?"
"Yes. To the West Sea rift."
"Understood!"
"The Director will issue guidelines for media response. Those remaining should respond accordingly..."
Before he could finish his instructions, his pager buzzed. He glanced to confirm understanding with a gesture and pressed the receive button.
[Director Ham Seok-jeong]
The calm voice of a middle-aged woman flowed through the speaker.
—Team Leader Jung.
"Yes, Director."
—Thank you for working late. Did you see the rankings?
"I did. We're about to depart for Incheon."
—Alright. I trust you know what to do.
"Yes. We will verify if the West Sea rift has reappeared, and if J and other hunters are still alive, we will conduct a search in the vicinity."
—If J is not in the West Sea. And if the rift hasn't reopened...
A brief silence followed. Ham Seok-jeong, the Director of the Awakened Management Bureau, spoke firmly.
—Find him at all costs.
"Understood."
—By any means necessary.
***
Incheon, in front of the memorial.
Jung Bin hurriedly fixed his tousled hair after jumping out of the helicopter. His target was the memorial.
There was already someone there, standing tall with a head much higher than others. Recognizing him from a distance wasn't difficult. Jung Bin paused for a moment to catch his breath and approached the dark figure.
"Lee Sa-young."
"..."
Lee Sa-young, hands in his pockets, stared intently at the top of the memorial. At a glance, he seemed calm, but Jung Bin sensed something.
'He's really lost it.'
The sinister aura, whether not yet subdued or intentionally left unchecked, was palpable. It was so overwhelming that a weak person might faint. Jung Bin signaled to his team members to prevent anyone from approaching.
The team spread out seamlessly. No journalists or regular hunters should approach someone in this state. The oppressive pressure, sharp enough to tear a person apart, weighed down the air. Jung Bin stood three steps back, watching Lee Sa-young. Eventually, Lee Sa-young spoke.
"Rift?"
He probably meant if they had come to check the rift. Jung Bin replied cautiously, not letting his guard down.
"Yes, that's correct."
"It's not open."
"..."
Lee Sa-young pointed to the calm sea with a defiant chin gesture. Under the moonlight, the waves gently broke. His gaze remained fixed on the topmost letter on the memorial.
Originally, the West Sea rift was managed jointly by the Rift Management Bureau and the Awakened Management Bureau. It was too large and left too many scars to be handed over to a single guild. Besides, no guild would bid for it. After the disaster in the West Sea, who would want to keep a ticking time bomb?
But one day, Lee Sa-young suddenly demanded ownership of the West Sea rift in exchange for sharing the research results from the Pado Guild's research lab. The government, already seeing it as a headache, handed over the bomb without hesitation.
Since then, Jung Bin had harbored a small question.
'Why did Lee Sa-young take ownership of the West Sea rift?'
And now. Why was Lee Sa-young here? Was it to check for anomalies in the guild's rift? Or was it because of the anger of losing the top spot to J?
"Once you confirm, go back and manage your hunters."
"..."
It was a clear dismissal. The gas mask's gaze shifted slightly from the memorial to the empty air. He must be seeing the same thing as Jung Bin.
+82 [CH.1]"J has entered the chat"
J had appeared on the channel.
Could he be nearby? Having confirmed the safety of the rift, it was time to carry out the second mission. Just as he moved his finger slightly to give the command,
"Stop before I break your fingers."
A languid voice murmured.
"Tell Ham Seok-jeong."
"..."
"The ownership of the West Sea rift belongs to the Pado Guild."
"..."
Lee Sa-young slowly turned to face Jung Bin. Ah, Jung Bin suddenly realized.
"Everything that comes out of the rift..."
Lee Sa-young said,
"Is mine."
For this day...

chapters.title: Chapter 28: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
chapters.content:
Chapter 28: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
[Remember This is for Recycling Sorting!]
Whoosh. The faded laminated paper stuck with blue tape fluttered in the cold wind. A thick, bug-like figure squatted busily in the alley.
Wearing a thick padded jacket, a toad apron, rubber gloves, track pants, and three-striped slippers, Cha Eui-jae was peacefully sorting recyclables in his winter house look. As he removed the label from a PET bottle, Cha Eui-jae muttered like a complaint.
"Why is there always so much trash, no matter how much I throw away..."
He gathered the labels and put them in a plastic bag, then stepped on the PET bottle to remove the air. This time, he picked up the sack full of soju bottles.
Bang!
At that moment, a sudden firecracker-like sound exploded from the empty air. Cha Eui-jae, thinking it was some kind of bad luck, looked up and was met with a familiar white screen.
[Congratulations, J!]
[You have become the new number 1 in 'Region: South Korea.']
"...What?"
Thud. The heavy sack fell to the ground. An empty soju bottle rolled out of the sack and clattered across the asphalt.
'What kind of bastard announces a number one rank while I'm sorting recyclables?'
Cha Eui-jae was so taken aback by the absurd system message that he didn't even think to question its validity.
Number one? Me? If there was someone to answer, Cha Eui-jae would have grabbed them by the collar and demanded an explanation. He couldn't understand why such news had suddenly intruded on what could have been an ordinary day.
Instead of asking the system for information, Cha Eui-jae hastily opened an internet app on his phone. Fortunately or unfortunately, breaking news about the Hunter rankings was plastered all over the portal site's main page.
[「Breaking News」South Korea's New Number 1, J]
[「Breaking News」Unshakeable Number 1 Lee Sa-young Falls to 2nd, Overtaken by J.]
[「Breaking News」Awakener Management Bureau: "There cannot be duplicate Hunter names, no identical names."]
[「Breaking News」Awakener Management Bureau: "Possibility of system error exists, verification in progress."]
[「Breaking News」Jung Bin Spotted Boarding a Helicopter... Heading to Incheon?]
The more he refreshed the page, the more articles popped up. The system, as if to be helpful, even displayed a new ranking window.
1. J
2. Lee Sa-young ▼1
3. Matthew ▼1
4. Jung Bin ▼1
5. Gyu-gyu ▼1
6. Honeybee ▼1
7. Doctor ▼1
8. I Am An Artisan ▼1
9. Ham Seok-jeong ▼1
10. Song Jo-heon ▼1
11. Shield Guy ▼1
Every name except J had a blue down arrow next to it. Just looking at it was destructive.
"Shit."
Cha Eui-jae couldn't help but recall a photo he'd seen on an internet post a long time ago.
Let's learn about things you shouldn't do at a funeral
That is...
(Raising Hand Emoji)
Resurrection!
Suddenly coming back to life would be shocking for everyone, right?
See you next time
Indeed, Cha Eui-jae had unintentionally... committed the ultimate faux pas.
J. As embarrassing as it was to say with his own mouth, during his time as a Hunter, he saved countless people and was famous enough to be portrayed as a hero in children's educational comics who sacrificed himself alongside the rift.
That such a person would resurrect after 8 years? And immediately reclaim the top spot upon his return?
'Of course, they'll be desperate to find me no matter what.
He could hear the sound of his peaceful, quiet life slowly slipping away. Cha Eui-jae finally realized. Oh, right. That firecracker sound he heard earlier wasn't anything else.
It was the sound of his small, precious, quiet life exploding...
Denial of reality made him mechanically refresh the screen, and with each increased refresh count in the corner, his chest filled with anger. He grabbed an empty soju bottle from the sack and, holding the mouth, started gesturing angrily at the status window.
"Hey, what did I do to deserve being number one?"
It made sense that he was number one in the past. J was strong and constantly sliced through all kinds of monsters. In terms of ability and achievements, he could confidently say he didn't fall short anywhere.
But Cha Eui-jae? After escaping the West Sea rift, all he did was clean, sort recyclables, do the dishes, make hangover soup, collect discount coupons, shop for groceries, take care of Park Ha-eun, donate to the West Sea rift Foundation, occasionally catch monsters that popped out while pretending to be an ordinary person and report them to the Rift Management Bureau. That was about it.
If he became number one just for doing that, then anyone could be number one.
[A special reward for being number one is given.]
[Claim]
'Bring me a reject button.'
Cha Eui-jae searched for a reject button somewhere. However, there was no reject button, not even a small X mark. Instead, the system emphasized the 'Claim' text in red.
Do you think I'll press that? Absolutely not. Cha Eui-jae intentionally looked away from the system. He planned to ignore it until it got tired and disappeared.
But the system, displaying a new window wherever he looked, this time provided different options instead of 'Claim.'
[ some of the previously deleted authorities are being restored.]
[Restoring authority...]
[Access to South Korea Channel 1 has been recreated.]
[Do you want to access South Korea Channel 1?]
[Yes]
[▷Yes]
It seemed to have increased the options in response to his opinion. The problem was that nothing had changed.
The Hunter Channel was a group messenger created by the system. It was a group messenger where they could share information, chat, and make announcements. Cha Eui-jae had always thought it was probably created because Hunters played solo too much.
Anyway, the channel had access criteria to match users' levels, and Channel 1 was accessible only to those ranked from 1 to 50.
In other words, Channel 1 had Jung Bin, Honeybee, and Bae Won-woo hanging out there. Of course, Lee Sa-young as well.
'Do you think I'll go there?'
He had tried to live quietly, but the world wouldn't leave him alone. Cha Eui-jae picked up the soju bottle that had rolled far away and separated the cap and the glass bottle.
"I'll never enter, so get rid of the window."
[...]
The system didn't respond.
'Finally, it's quiet.'
Cha Eui-jae let out a sigh of relief and began gathering the empty bottles and the sack on the ground.
[!!Error!!]
[Selection time has expired.]
[You will be automatically connected to Channel 1.]
"What?"
Cha Eui-jae was horrified. What the hell was this rude system saying now?
+82 [CH.1]"J has entered the chat"
'I'm fucked.'
This damn system didn't even have a nickname change function! Suddenly resurrected with the old name J and forcibly connected to Channel 1, Cha Eui-jae lost all will in an instant.
Even if it was absurd, he couldn't help but laugh helplessly.
"Ha, haha."
Whether the others knew his feelings or not, the temporarily frozen chat burst into a flurry of messages.
.
.
.
[50] Romantic Opener: Crazy
[50] Romantic Opener: Wow
[11] Shield Guy: Whoa
[6] Honeybee: ?
[6] Honeybee: Real?
[34] A Small Miracle Seo Min-gi: Isn't this a system error?
[50] Romantic Opener: No, wow
[50] Romantic Opener: Truly legendary continuous updates ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ
[8] I Am An Artisan: No way, haha
[8] I Am An Artisan: This must be a hidden camera, haha
[8] I Am An Artisan: System must be pranking us with this reaction, haha
[8] I Am An Artisan: This must be some reality show, haha
[8] I Am An Artisan: Like a hidden camera show, haha, got it
[6] Honeybee: Escaping reality is wild
[4] Jung Bin: Hong Ye-seong-ssi ^^
[4] Jung Bin: I'll temporarily disconnect the WiFi in Jang-in Village.
[4] Jung Bin: Please be careful not to leak any information.
[8] I Am An Artisan: (Crying Emoji)
[29] Marble Seller Boy: Isn't it possible someone else took the name?
[43] Ddeun: There's no way it's the real J, right;;
[4] Jung Bin: As you all know ^^; duplicate Hunter names are impossible.
[4] Jung Bin: I understand this is very confusing.
[4] Jung Bin: We are verifying it, so please wait a moment. ^^
[29] Marble Seller Boy: In online games, they periodically release names of long inactive users...
[15] No Nickname: But this isn't a game.
[3] Matthew: Jung Bin.
[3] Matthew: Could there be a possibility that the West Sea rift reopened...
At Matthew's cautious question, the chat window, which had been unreadably chaotic, froze. Cha Eui-jae also held his breath. If the West Sea rift had reopened, Cha Eui-jae had to go there.
He had to go back to that hell, find what he had left behind, and atone for his sins, as that was the price to be paid by the one who survived.
Crash!
Cha Eui-jae blinked. The soju bottle in his hand had shattered into pieces. His neck felt cold for a moment. He must have been sweating without realizing it. After letting out a long sigh, Cha Eui-jae tried to dismiss the annoying system window and looked up...
[2] Lee Sa-young: X
Cha Eui-jae saw the message from Lee Sa-young. He blinked slowly.
[11] Shield Guy: Excuse me, J?
[11] Shield Guy: hoxy... Could you send a message in the chat?
Even in this situation, Bae Won-woo was persistently clueless.
'Would you do it if you were me?'
Somehow, the tension eased. His chaotic mind began to calm down a bit. Squatting on the ground, Cha Eui-jae decided to use the power of artificial intelligence as a last resort.
"Hi, Nexby, find a way to leave the Hunter Channel."
—Searching for a way to leave the Hunter Channel.
—No results found.
Damn it.
***
"Huh? Why is this thing not working?"
In the hangover soup restaurant still crowded with hunters, one of them was fumbling with the remote control near the TV. No matter how much he pressed the buttons, the TV showed no signs of turning on. Scratching his head, he called out to Cha Eui-jae.
"Hey, why isn't the TV working? Is it broken?"
Cha Eui-jae replied while stacking a tray full of empty bowls.
"Yes. It was broken when I checked this morning. I'll call a repairman tomorrow."
Of course, it was a blatant lie. The TV was perfectly fine. The cord was just unplugged.
"Man, I wanted to watch 110-Minute Debate while eating."
As the man muttered in disappointment, other hunters began to chime in one by one.
"Is that on today? Whether to send a rescue team or not?"
"Oh, I wanted to watch that too."
"We'll just have to watch it on our phones."
"Can't we call a repairman now?"
"It's evening, so they probably won't come."
Disappointed voices echoed from various corners. But Cha Eui-jae pretended not to hear any of it. Everything was to prevent the catastrophe of watching this week's 110-Minute Debate together, which they so eagerly wanted to see.
Today, a week after J's name appeared on the Hunter rankings, a special live broadcast of 110-Minute Debate was set to air with the subtitle;
[J's Return: Should We Send a Rescue Team to the West Sea Rift?]
None of this reflected the opinion of the resurrected person himself, even a tiny bit, so Cha Eui-jae had unplugged the TV cord as soon as he woke up. He clenched his fist tightly.
'I'll make sure they can't watch it.'

chapters.title: Chapter 29: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
chapters.content:
Chapter 29: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
Title: [Anonymous] If J is alive
If there is a rift in the West Sea, shouldn't we send a rescue team?
He might be alive but unable to move.
Maybe his legs are cut off...
Comments (99+)
—Are there really no other survivors?
⤷ Yes, I compared the names on the memorial with the rankings, and J's name was newly added. It looks like only J survived.
—Do you know what it's like inside the rift? Do you know how many hunters have died there?
⤷ But are we just going to leave someone trapped in a rift?
⤷ Ha... They went in to save people like this, huh? ㅋㅋ Humanity is doomed.
⤷ Don't you remember when the West Sea rift was expanding rapidly? If we open it, the country could be doomed.
⤷ Is it the same now as it was back then? How much has our power increased? ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ this isn't the time when the entire nation had to risk their lives for one person, J.
⤷ Does it make sense to use all that power just to save one J??
—Nope~ you can't even open a closed rift, see ya.
At first, people didn't believe it. Even among the hunters, most thought it was just a temporary error that would soon be fixed. However, Channel 1, which had directly confirmed J's existence, remained silent, waiting for the official announcement from the Awakened Management Bureau.
—It's a lie~
—Sigh, why tell such lies?
—Even if there's an error, how can there be such an error? ㅋㅋ.
—The system can also break down sometimes.
.
.
.
—Why isn't the error being fixed?
—Could it be?
It didn't take long for people to attach a question mark, half doubting, behind the word 'could it be.' Days passed without the rankings changing, and people grew anxious.
As all sorts of media outlets began to spread baseless rumors, treating them as facts, the Awakened Management Bureau hurried to control the confusion. The press conference was scheduled for 3 PM, so Cha Eui-jae put up a "Ingredient Preparation Time" sign to watch the press conference alone.
When the time came, a woman appeared on the screen, dressed neatly in a short haircut and a smart suit, holding a cane. Apart from her pale complexion, she looked similar to how Cha Eui-jae remembered. She was Ham Seok-jeong, the head of the Awakened Management Bureau, who had avoided public appearances due to health reasons.
After a brief greeting, she spoke firmly.
—This ranking update is not a system error.
She took a moment to catch her breath before continuing.
—It's not a case of name duplication either. No one else has taken J's name... It's hard to believe, but according to our internal investigation, J is currently alive.
The murmuring and the sound of camera flashes grew louder. Journalists raised their hands one after another.
—How can you be so sure?
—Are there no other survivors besides J?
—Eight years ago, the Awakened Management Bureau confirmed the death of the hunters who entered the West Sea rift. Why is the story changing now?
—If J is alive, where is he now?
Despite the barrage of questions, Ham Seok-Jeong raised her hand slightly to call for attention and responded calmly.
—We are planning to dispatch a rescue team for a more accurate assessment of the situation. Please wait a little longer.
Ham Seok-Jeong and the hunters of the Awakened Management Bureau bowed.
Seeing Ham Seok-Jeong's face, Cha Eui-jae suddenly realized that eight years had passed. The Ham Seok-Jeong in his memory was young and passionate, neither using a cane nor limping. When did she hurt her leg?
And she...
'How can she be so sure?'
Today's press conference by the Awakened Management Bureau contradicted their previous statements. Given the attention, they couldn't have made such an announcement without irrefutable evidence.
Ham Seok-Jeong was that kind of person. Someone who moved only with undeniable proof and a clear justification, steady as a mountain. Cha Eui-jae stared at the still-bowing Ham Seok-Jeong for a while before turning off the TV.
After the Awakened Management Bureau's press conference, the topic of J was everywhere in South Korea. It was incomparable to the previous special broadcast of "110-Minute Debate."
Every day, breaking news and headlines were all about the West Sea Rift and J. Whether J should be rescued also split opinions sharply.
'They fight over everything.'
Whenever someone asked Cha Eui-jae what he thought about J's resurrection and rescue, he would brush it off with, 'Haha, I don't really know,' like a passive bystander— this had almost become his default response.
But all his attempts to avoid this topic eventually failed, because...
[Why the whole world is shocked by J's incredible abilities, why Japan is furious, and why Americans are desperate to see J!]
J had taken over the trending videos on YouTube.
***
The topics of conversation among the regular hunters at the hangover soup restaurant constantly changed, but the hot topic over the past few days was, of course, 'J.'
Ignoring the tables, the hunters ate hangover soup and debated everything from J's survival to the state of the rift. Since all the participants were active hunters, various opinions emerged.
"Isn't it a system error? That seems the most likely."
"The Bureau said it wasn't in the press conference. They said J is alive."
"Then how are they so sure? Did they talk directly to the system or something?"
"I don't know. But since Ham Seok-Jeong held the press conference herself, it must be certain."
"Anyway, there are some shady aspects to that place."
"Uncle, why are you saying that right in front of Jung Bin's autograph?"
"Crap, when did this autograph get put here?"
The most common but least credible theory was the system error theory.
Rankings are updated once a year, but usually, a hunter's name is immediately removed from the list upon death.
Since people often checked the ranking to confirm life or death when contact was lost inside the rift, the accuracy of this system was guaranteed. So, people would suspect the system and then quickly dismiss the idea.
Then, a new hunter, deftly chopping chili peppers, suggested an idea.
"Maybe he died and was recently resurrected?"
"Is there an item that can revive dead people?"
"With the world in this state, there could be one, right?"
"Some healer might have saved him..."
"Even Nam Woo-jin can't revive the dead."
"Maybe J had a unique resurrection item with an 8-year cooldown."
"This one sounds plausible."
'What sounds plausible.'
Cha Eui-jae was fed up with hearing the resurrection after death theory.
Logically, they were all dismissible nonsense, but J's return was bewildering enough. Naturally, not only at the hangover soup restaurant but also on the anonymous boards of the HunterNet, various theories emerged...
—I'd rather believe a necromancer revived him ㅋㅋㅋㅋㅋ
⤷ Is there a famous necromancer? Quick, find one.
⤷ Necromancers have a ban on reviving humans, they'd never do it. ㅠㅠ
Such as the illegal necromancer revival theory,
—He actually fought in another dimension for 8 years and returned, J the returnee.
⤷ Seems like you read too many fantasy novels...
⤷ Dude; since the Day of the Rift, fantasy novels = reality, didn't you know?
There were plenty of absurd theories like the returnee theory, but of course, no one got the right answer. The premise was wrong from the start. J had never died.
And those debating the 'how' eventually realized that without J speaking up, no answers would come, and they moved on to another question.
J is alive. So where is he?
The last known sighting of J was in the West Sea rift. He clearly hadn't escaped, and people thought he had closed the rift and died inside. But the truth they had believed for eight years might not be the real truth.
***
In the middle of the night.
Cha Eui-jae woke up suddenly. In the silence where even breathing couldn't be heard, he stayed still, holding his breath. His small room was quiet, but instinctively, he knew.
'There's an intruder outside this room.'
No guest would come at this late hour. No matter how much someone craved hangover soup, they wouldn't break in through a locked door.
The only weapons were in the kitchen, and all he had was a sturdy body. As quietly and slowly as possible, he raised his upper body and clenched and unclenched his fists a few times. Fortunately, he was skilled in hand-to-hand combat.
'Whoever this bastard is...'
He wanted to break every limb, but dealing with the aftermath would be a hassle. Breaking just enough to extract information before reporting would suffice.
Cha Eui-jae moved without a sound, opening the door to the small room and stepping onto the floor barefoot. After slipping out of the walls made of boxes, he saw the familiar hall. Dim streetlights faintly illuminated the dark restaurant, and in the middle,
A figure in a gas mask was sitting.

chapters.title: Chapter 30: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
chapters.content:
Chapter 30: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
...Why?
Cha Eui-jae stopped dead in his tracks, momentarily stunned at the sight of the dark figure trespassing in someone else's shop. How did that bastard open the closed door and get in, and why was he sitting in the middle of the hall as if staging a protest?
The number one, or rather, ex-number one hunter was committing all sorts of crimes, from obstructing business to trespassing. The gas mask-wearing figure, seated with legs crossed, slowly turned his head toward Cha Eui-jae. His eerie voice rumbled low.
"Did you sleep well?"
Despite the seemingly friendly question, his voice sounded like it came from the depths of hell. Waking someone up only to ask if they slept well— he had clearly given his conscience away to the dogs. Instead of answering, Cha Eui-jae countered with a question.
"What are you doing here?"
Though it was a reasonable question, the gas mask-wearing figure's aura became even more ominous. He seemed to be taking deep breaths to calm himself, but his purple eyes behind the lenses glinted fiercely as they stared at Cha Eui-jae.
"What am I doing?"
"..."
"That's what I should be asking you."
Could it be... has he found out something about me? Given his past actions and information-gathering abilities, it wasn't an entirely unreasonable suspicion. Cha Eui-jae slowly clenched his fist, waiting for the next words to come out of his mouth.
"Why didn't you contact me first?"
"..."
"I waited two weeks, damn it."
Cha Eui-jae felt utterly deflated. Was that what this was about?
Judging by the intense aura emanating from him, Cha Eui-jae guessed that Lee Sa-young was either angry or sulking like a child left out of something fun.
Though it wasn't the right thing to think in front of someone who had been waiting for contact, to be honest, it wasn't that he hadn't contacted him—
'I forgot...'
Cha Eui-jae had completely forgotten that he needed to respond to Lee Sa-young's business proposal.
Of course, Cha Eui-jae had his reasons. The problem was they were reasons he couldn't tell anyone. In any case, if he were to be honest and say he forgot, the deal would surely fall apart. So, Cha Eui-jae offered the best excuse he could come up with.
"Well, I've been busy."
"Ha."
Lee Sa-young snorted, but Cha Eui-jae continued steadfastly.
"I've also been thinking it over."
"Oh, you actually thought about it."
Lee Sa-young sarcastically retorted, resting his chin on his hand as if challenging him to continue. Cha Eui-jae felt a sudden urge to give him a good smack on the head. Why was his nature so twisted?
In that moment, a thought suddenly flashed through Cha Eui-jae's mind.
Ah, maybe...
'Because I took the number one spot from him?'
Though that gas mask-wearing bastard seemed nonchalant, he had held the number one rank for six years in a row. Having his position taken overnight by someone thought to be dead must have been quite a shock.
Cha Eui-jae's gaze softened with pity. Lee Sa-young grumbled in irritation.
"Why are you looking at me like that?"
"No, it's just... hang in there."
"Are you mocking me?"
"Mocking? I'm being more sincere than ever."
"Ugh, whatever. I even shot a commercial because of you, and you left me hanging for two weeks. Do you know you're a real jerk?"
Lee Sa-young waved his hand in disgust. But Cha Eui-jae also had his grievances about that public service announcement.
The so-called public service announcement that Lee Sa-young supposedly filmed because of Cha Eui-jae was inflicting mental agony on hunters who watched TV. Cha Eui-jae crossed his arms.
"What's with that commercial anyway? Why did you suddenly shoot it?"
"Because you only like people who shoot commercials. What else could I do?"
"What kind of nonsense is that?"
"Jung Bin, Honeybee..."
Cha Eui-jae couldn't keep up with Lee Sa-young's erratic train of thought.
The only commonality between Jung Bin and Honeybee was that he wanted to ban both of them from this shop. What was Lee Sa-young thinking when he did such a bizarre thing?
Lee Sa-young gestured towards the handwritten Honeybee poster.
"Is that your taste?"
"Honeybee just gave it to me."
"And Jung Bin's autograph?"
"He sent it by mail."
"Damn it, why not just sell that on Tomato Market?"
Cha Eui-jae tightly shut his mouth and got up to head towards the water dispenser. As he moved, eyes followed him. The gaze was persistent and unrelenting.
Unable to bear the staring, Cha Eui-jae finally turned around and asked, "What?"
Lee Sa-young pointed his chin at Cha Eui-jae's feet.
"Your feet."
"Huh?"
"Do you usually go around barefoot?"
Oh, right. Only then did Cha Eui-jae look down at his feet. He had come out to ambush silently, but seeing Lee Sa-young sitting comfortably in the hall had made him lose the will to ambush, so he had been walking around the shop barefoot.
Wiggling his toes, Cha Eui-jae shamelessly replied.
"I didn't wear socks on purpose to wake myself up."
"You should at least wear slippers."
Lee Sa-young seemed somewhat displeased. Who did he think had made him run out barefoot in the middle of the night?
"If you've been thinking for two weeks, you must have an answer."
"Yes."
"..."
"Let's make a deal. But I have a few conditions."
"Hold on."
Lee Sa-young took out a long, finger-length object from his inventory. It had a screen, buttons, and a blue magic stone embedded at the end. It was a magic stone recorder, something Cha Eui-jae had desperately tried to get, which had led to S-grade hunters flocking to Tomato Market and this restaurant.
"We should have solid evidence. It's better for both you and me."
"Recording, huh. What if the recording gets leaked?"
"I'll use it only to draft the contract and then dispose of it immediately."
"..."
Lee Sa-young showed off his gloved hand to Cha Eui-jae. He meant that he could melt the recorder like a ladle. For him, it was a disposable item.
Lee Sa-young pressed the button, and the recorder began to glow blue.
"Let's start."
He spoke as if familiar with such procedures. Cha Eui-jae nodded and raised a finger.
"First, no work during restaurant hours. Whatever you ask or demand, it has to be between 11 PM and 5 AM when the restaurant is closed."
"Aha."
After a brief pause, Lee Sa-young nodded readily.
"Alright. What's the second?"
"Help me register as a hunter."
"Huh? Didn't I tell you before?"
Lee Sa-young, tapping his arm with his palm, tilted his head and spoke dryly.
"I need someone unknown."
"I know. Just listen."
Although Cha Eui-jae had no intention of resuming his hunter activities, the situation had changed now that J's survival was known. It was better to create a completely new identity unconnected to J.
People are looking for J. Even the Awakened Management Bureau will form search teams to find J.
Considering J is S-grade, being an unregistered awakener could lead to misunderstandings. It would be safer to disguise himself as a newly awakened hunter with no ties to J. That way, he would avoid detection.
Cha Eui-jae calmly continued.
"You'd agree that the scope of what we can do changes depending on whether I'm registered as a hunter."
"..."
"My demand is for you to help me get the lowest possible rank."
"..."
"If I'm E or D rank, no one will pay attention to me. I'll blend in."
The ranks for awakeners are from S to A, B, C, D, E, and F. The closer to F, the lower the awakening ability and physical ability, with F being just a bit stronger than an average person. Lee Sa-young slowly rubbed his gas mask's cheek.
"So... you want help to hide your true strength when registering?"
"Yes."
"What else?"
"Help my grandmother with her treatment."
"We talked about that last time. Anything else?"
"No."
"Alright."
Lee Sa-young chuckled, pressing the recorder's button to stop it. The stone's glow gradually faded.
"Now it's my turn."
He took out a palm-sized dagger from his inventory and handed it to Cha Eui-jae. The blade was engraved with golden laurel leaves.
[Laurel Branch of Contract (S)]
[By drawing blood with this dagger, an unbreakable contract can be made.]
[Curses upon the one who breaks the contract.]
"Do you want to stab yourself, or should I do it?"
What an absurd and crude statement. Was he serious? Cha Eui-jae couldn't hide his incredulous expression as he stared at Lee Sa-young.
"Of course I'll do it myself. Why would you stab my hand?"
"Some people stab themselves in strange places. Someone even stabbed their thigh when I told them to cut their palm..."
Cha Eui-jae squinted at him, wondering if he thought he looked like such an idiot. Did people like that really exist? Did they attempt self-harm during a contract?
Though Cha Eui-jae thought it was ridiculous, Lee Sa-young's face was deadly serious. Lee Sa-young shrugged.
"It's more efficient if I do it. Less blood."
Efficiency might end up killing someone at this rate. Lee Sa-young, despite his supposedly kind explanations, persisted as Cha Eui-jae refused to let go of the dagger.
"Don't worry, I'm good at stabbing. It won't hurt much. Just a little prick."
"Bullshit."
"If I do it, it won't hurt as much for you."
It was better to get this over with quickly. Cha Eui-jae deftly adjusted his grip on the dagger and asked,
"How much blood do you need?"
"Just enough."
Without hesitation, Cha Eui-jae slashed his palm, allowing the crimson blood to drip down the thin line. Taking the dagger, Lee Sa-young asked,
"Do you have an antidote? Or any artifact for detoxification?"
As if.
Cha Eui-jae glanced around the shabby hangover soup restaurant. Though he had a detoxification ability, there was no need to reveal all his cards to this dubious character in front of him.
Lee Sa-young placed a small glass bottle filled with a purplish liquid on the table. The liquid was thick and slimy, occasionally bubbling like a concoction from a witch's cauldron.
"That's my personal antidote."
"Your personal antidote?"
"Can't have you dying on me during the contract. Drink it now."
"..."
Cha Eui-jae skeptically examined the bottle before reluctantly downing the antidote. Despite its appearance, the liquid went down surprisingly smoothly.
Lee Sa-young, now holding the dagger, spoke,
"I only have one condition."
Without hesitation, he slashed his palm. From the large wound, a dark liquid that barely resemble blood dripped down.
"Never betray me."
With his cold voice, the liquid burned through the table where it landed, leaving blackened, charred marks.

chapters.title: Chapter 31: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
chapters.content:
Chapter 31: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
Lee Sa-young grabbed Cha Eui-jae's hand tightly. The touch of their wounds felt like burning fire. It had been a while since he had felt pain.
Red blood mixed with black blood and flowed down their wrists. Around their joined hands, golden vines blossomed. Something sharp and piercing burrowed into Cha Eui-jae's body, crawling up his arm and settling near his heart.
At the same time, a hot lump rose up from his diaphragm. Cha Eui-jae bit his lip, stifling a groan. It was hard to hold back the urge to retch.
"...Ugh."
"Hold on."
[Trait: Basilisk's Venom (S+) activated.]
'Wait.'
Cha Eui-jae's eyes widened at the sudden system notification.
He had obtained the detoxification trait from capturing a basilisk in the West Sea Rift, but it had never actually activated before. It was a peculiar trait that didn't respond to weak poisons. So why now?
Cha Eui-jae coughed violently, unable to contain his bewilderment, and bright red blood spurted from his mouth. Amid the metallic taste of blood was a faint sweetness.
'Ah, this bastard.'
"...Fuck, Hyung. What's going on?"
Why are you swearing? I should be the one swearing. Cha Eui-jae struggled to keep his fading consciousness as he spat out blood between his teeth. He saw Lee Sa-young, who had frozen in shock.
"Hyung?"
'What kind of lunatic puts poison in someone's body?'
"Hyung, open your mouth quickly."
'I told you I'd kill you if you messed with me...'
"Hurry!"
Muttering anxiously, Lee Sa-young shoved his gloved thumb into Cha Eui-jae's mouth. Instinctively, Cha Eui-jae bit down on Lee Sa-young's thumb. He wanted to bite it off with his teeth, but his head was too hot.
Cha Eui-jae glared at the white system screen that filled his vision, bloodshot eyes burning.
'Why is an S+ grade trait so slow? Do you want me to die?'
[Trait: Basilisk's Venom (S+) activated.]
[Detoxifying.]
[Trait: Basilisk's Venom (S+) activated.]
[Detoxifying.]
[Trait: Basilisk's Venom (S+) activated.]
[Detoxifying.]
The system screen flickered as if protesting its innocence. It seemed to be trying to communicate that it was working hard, but Cha Eui-jae couldn't care less.
He disliked Lee Sa-young and the basilisk's venom both. What kind of bastard puts poison in someone's body? The antidote he was given seemed useless, so why make him drink it? What if he didn't have a detoxification trait?
Soon, a cool liquid flowed down Lee Sa-young's thumb into Cha Eui-jae's mouth. The heat subsided little by little wherever the liquid touched. At the same time, a system notification appeared.
[Detoxification complete.]
[According to the effect of Basilisk's Venom (S+), you have gained resistance to the poison once detoxified.]
Gasping for breath, Cha Eui-jae tried to remember the last time he had coughed up so much blood. As the heat subsided and sensation returned to his fingertips, he realized one of his hands was still held by Lee Sa-young.
"Hyung."
With his free hand, Cha Eui-jae touched his forehead. As his vision cleared, he saw the gas mask staring intently at him.
"...Hyung."
Lee Sa-young called Cha Eui-jae again. Cha Eui-jae slowly calmed his breathing. Whether it was due to his trait working hard or the mysterious liquid Lee Sa-young had given him, his recovery was fast.
'Alright, this much...'
There was still some lingering pain, but it was manageable.
As Lee Sa-young called him again, Cha Eui-jae was about to respond when the warm leather glove gently touched his cheek and jaw. The hand fumbled over his cheek before lifting his chin.
The black gas mask came into clearer view. Lee Sa-young whispered,
"Can you see me?"
Of course, he could see that black face clearly. Cha Eui-jae nodded quietly, his head fixed in place. Lee Sa-young muttered worriedly.
"Looks like you can hear too."
"..."
"What about talking? If you can't, at least blink."
Not trusting himself to speak without swearing, Cha Eui-jae blinked instead. He wasn't unable to speak, just choosing not to. He felt Lee Sa-young's grip on his cheek tighten slightly.
"...Did the poison damage your vocal cords?"
"..."
"What about other parts?"
What kind of poison does this guy have?
Cha Eui-jae couldn't believe what he was hearing. So, from what Lee Sa-young was saying, his poison could simultaneously damage vision, hearing, vocal cords, and internal organs? And it was strong enough to affect an S-grade Awakened?
'Can a simple poison be this potent?'
"Cha Eui-jae."
Lee Sa-young's anxious voice interrupted his thoughts. A cautious hand touched the back of his neck. Cha Eui-jae suddenly wondered what kind of expression Lee Sa-young was making right now. So he reached out with his free hand to...
"..."
"What are you—"
He grabbed the gas mask hard.
Crack. The front of the mask crumpled under his grip. As he twisted and yanked it off, a pale face appeared behind the torn mask. Wide, shocked violet eyes and slightly parted lips, with a few strands of hair stuck to his sweaty forehead.
'Those eyelashes are really long.'
Lee Sa-young's face, usually indifferent, now filled with surprise and confusion, was quite satisfying. After examining Lee Sa-young's face to his heart's content, Cha Eui-jae tossed aside the remains of the mask. Then he removed Lee Sa-young's hand from his neck.
Rubbing the blood off his lips with the back of his hand, Cha Eui-jae spoke,
"I'm fine. My vocal cords aren't damaged."
"..."
"This is the first time I've encountered such a strong poison... Do you have any conscience?"
"...Shit."
Lee Sa-young's pretty face twisted into a scowl. He threw the torn mask to the floor and glared at Cha Eui-jae.
"Why didn't you say anything? Are you joking?"
"I kept quiet because I knew I'd start swearing at you if I spoke, why."
"...Damn it, really. So frustrating..."
Lee Sa-young ran a hand through his hair irritably and turned away. Only then did Cha Eui-jae take a good look around.
The table, now stained with blood, was scorched in places, and the dagger he'd used to cut his palm lay discarded nearby, along with an unfamiliar bottle.
Cha Eui-jae picked up the bottle that had rolled close to him. As it wasn't an ordinary bottle, a system notification appeared.
[Golden Tree Nectar (S)]
[When consumed, it removes all status ailments and curses.]
'...No way.'
Just from the name, it was clearly something extraordinary.
Most status ailment treatments specify the type and grade they can cure. An item that unconditionally removes all status ailments and curses was incredibly rare and valuable. And that precious item was now...
[The bottle is now empty.]
...Rolling empty on the table of a hangover soup restaurant.
So, the cool liquid he'd tasted must have been this. The crazy guy gave him a useless antidote and then put poison in him? Cha Eui-jae's anger at Lee Sa-young for that lessened a bit. Lee Sa-young had seemed quite shocked too, after all.
'The nectar... What a waste.'
If he'd just waited a bit, his 'Basilisk's Venom' trait would have detoxified it on its own. Maybe he should have just mentioned his detoxification trait.
Cha Eui-jae, now holding an empty bottle, glanced sideways at Lee Sa-young, who was still turned away.
"...Hey, Lee Sa-young?"
"..."
"This nectar... Is it expensive?"
"Say one more word."
Lee Sa-young growled, and Cha Eui-jae pursed his lips and watched his tone. Understandably, Lee Sa-young must have been upset. Asking about the price probably felt like rubbing salt in a wound.
Cha Eui-jae reflected on his actions. He had always been bad at consoling others. After some thought, he offered the safest response he could think of.
"Thanks, anyway."
"Ha."
'Did I finally get it right?'
"Thanking someone who poisoned you. You're a saint..."
'You complain even when I thank you.'
Even after a polite thank you, there was no praise in this modern society, just sarcasm. It was more frustrating than eating dry chicken breast without water...
Seeing that continuing the conversation wouldn't yield any good, Cha Eui-jae carefully put down the empty nectar bottle and checked his palm. The wound from the dagger had already healed, but a faint golden chain-like scar lingered.
'Looks like the contract was completed.'
Cha Eui-jae flexed his hand before addressing Lee Sa-young again.
"Now that the contract is done, how about finishing the explanation you started earlier?"
"..."
Finally, Lee Sa-young turned back to him, his expression still slightly sullen. He slowly approached and sat across from Cha Eui-jae. After a moment of silence, he began to speak.
"There are people spreading drugs, and I'm looking for those people."
"..."
"I mentioned this much, right?"
When Cha Eui-jae nodded, Lee Sa-young continued slowly.
"The drugs are sold very cheaply. Easy to obtain anywhere. The easier they are to get, the quicker people get addicted, and the more they crave stronger doses."
Generally, Awakened individuals are more sensitive in every way compared to ordinary people. Their heightened senses mean more things to worry about. As a result, their lives are filled with more discomforts than joys.
To these awakened individuals, the stimulus of the drug was incredibly powerful. It was probably like a magical drug that eliminated the unpleasantness of everyday life and provided nothing but pure pleasure. It was understandable that they would fall for it, as it would be difficult to resist such a pleasure experienced for the first time in a long while.
"As they gradually increase their dosage, at some point, it won't be enough. That's when they seek out the suppliers themselves."
"..."
"Most of the ones who get to that point have either undergone physical mutations or are on the verge of it. The suppliers take in those who come crawling to them."
"To where?"
"To a laboratory."
A chilling light passed over Lee Sa-young's face.
"The drugs are merely bait to gather test subjects."

chapters.title: Chapter 32: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
chapters.content:
Chapter 32: Things Not to Do at a Funeral
A test subject? Cha Eui-jae slightly furrowed his brow at the unfamiliar term. No matter how suspicious the plan might be, the very fact that they chose awakened individuals as test subjects was puzzling.
It was obvious that it was much harder to attract or forcibly kidnap an awakened individual compared to a regular person. This meant there had to be something obtainable only from awakened individuals to make them worth the trouble of being used as test subjects. But even so, it seemed like an excessively laborious experiment. What were they trying to gain by going to such lengths?
Lee Sa-young, observing Cha Eui-jae's pensive face, spoke in a casual tone.
"Do you know how people awaken?"
"Being chosen by the system, right?"
Cha Eui-jae recalled the day the system appeared. Some scenes bring back other senses along with them. It could be the sounds heard, the smells, or the tactile sensations felt at the time. For Cha Eui-jae, the Day of the Rift was a memory that encompassed all of these.
In the chaos where everything was breaking and collapsing, Cha Eui-jae was crouched in the ruins of a building, clutching the bodies of his parents. The acrid smell of gunpowder and the stench of blood mixed into a foul odor. The cold, lifeless bodies. The sound of a monster's footsteps echoing through the ruins.
Lee Sa-young nodded.
"That's right. So, what criteria does the system use to choose the awakened?"
As Lee Sa-young touched the glass with his finger, the black blood pooled and formed into shapes of a person and a monster. The black monster pounced on the small black person.
"The system,"
A square window appeared above the small black person's head.
"responds to a desperate wish."
'I want to live.'
'I don't want to die.'
The small black person also lunged at the monster without dodging. After a long struggle, the monster returned to black blood.
"When a human has a desperate wish, the system is drawn to that energy and finds the human."
"..."
"This is common knowledge. That's why people caught in the rift have a higher chance of awakening than regular people. Because praying not to die is also a form of a wish."
Cha Eui-jae silently watched the lone black figure. Lee Sa-young moved his finger, and the black person turned into a small puddle.
"But there are people dissatisfied with this fact."
Cha Eui-jae slowly raised his head to meet Lee Sa-young's gaze.
"Do you understand what I'm saying?"
Currently, the system is an absolute, omnipotent entity. Most people live by accepting this, but those who feel the system's selection is unfair would think differently. Perhaps they believe humans should be able to awaken their abilities on their own.
Reading the increasingly serious expression on Cha Eui-jae's face, Lee Sa-young propped his chin up and asked,
"Do you think it's possible that said-people are the same group as the drug dealers?"
"Well, think more about it."
Lee Sa-young spoke with a hint of playful mischief in his voice.
"Do you think I told you all this just to ask that?"
For a moment, Cha Eui-jae contemplated grabbing the nearby table and teaching this guy some manners, but he restrained himself given the situation. Lee Sa-young, despite his questioning, didn't seem impatient, allowing Cha Eui-jae to delve deeper into thought.
"You mentioned dissatisfaction with the system's choice."
If, as he suspected, there were unknown individuals who wanted humans to awaken their abilities independently and were selling drugs to achieve this, and if they were using the drugs as bait to gather awakened individuals as test subjects...
"They're doing all this to create artificial awakened beings?"
"Correct."
This time, Lee Sa-young answered straightforwardly. Cha Eui-jae felt his skin prickling as if his hair was standing on end.
Creating awakened beings not subject to the system's whims, solely through human effort. It seemed like a plausible claim on the surface, but Cha Eui-jae had a gut feeling that there was a darker motive behind it.
And it was drugs. Drugs that, when addicted, explosively increased aggression, caused loss of reason, and ultimately led to death with human dignity desecrated. The purpose of those feeding such drugs to the awakened for experimentation couldn't be normal.
"Assuming they create artificial awakened beings, what then?"
What would they do with these awakened individuals? When Cha Eui-jae asked this while crossing his arms, Lee Sa-young shrugged.
"I don't remember well. Something about preventing the apocalypse, I think."
"The apocalypse?"
"I didn't listen to their nonsense in detail."
The term 'apocalypse' brought back memories of people claiming the end was near right after the Day of the Rift. But that was already 11 years ago. In this era, where people could predict when and where a gate would open, were there still such people left?
It seemed Lee Sa-young wasn't lying about not listening carefully, as he looked uninterested.
"Anyway, there's nothing to ask of you right now."
Lee Sa-young put the forlorn dagger and the empty holy water bottle into his inventory. He then stood up, fiddling with his clothes as if he were about to leave.
"Let's first take care of the Awakened registration. I'll send someone over to you tomorrow."
"Alright. Oh, and one more thing."
Raising an eyebrow as if to ask what else, Cha Eui-jae pointed to the blackened table.
"Take care of the table before you go."
"..."
He couldn't very well seat customers at a table that had been melted by poison. Lee Sa-young's purple eyes looked at Cha Eui-jae as if to ask, "Are you serious?" but Cha Eui-jae stubbornly pointed at the table, wearing an expression that said, "What's taking you so long?"
They say beautiful people leave behind beautiful spaces, but with Lee Sa-young's temperament being anything but beautiful, he should at least live up to his handsome face. In the end, Lee Sa-young grudgingly put the damaged table into his inventory before leaving.
Even after Lee Sa-young left, the hangover soup restaurant bustled with customers having their early morning meals before heading to work. Among them was Bae Won-woo.
Yawning loudly as he arrived at his second job, the hangover soup restaurant, Bae Won-woo blinked for a moment, standing by the entrance. The place seemed emptier than usual.
"Huh? Isn't there one less table?"
"Oh? You're right."
Another Hunter, passing by, glanced around and nodded in agreement, noting Bae Won-woo's sharp observation.
"No wonder it looks a bit empty. Hey, where did the table that was here go?"
"..."
'They only have sharp eyes for these things. If only they were like this all the time.'
Hunters were usually slow on the uptake when needed but had sharp eyes for trivial matters. Cha Eui-jae, looking wistfully at the empty center of the restaurant, replied,
"The table legs seemed about to break... so I put it away for now."
Working at a hangover soup restaurant honed one's skill at lying. But the Hunters saw Cha Eui-jae's wistful face and sensed there was more to the story. As they began to speculate, one Hunter cautiously asked,
"Did some bastard Hunter break the table?"
Yes, the former ranking No. 1 did. Though Cha Eui-jae didn't answer, his melancholic face was as good as an affirmation. Enraged, the Hunter almost slammed the table but quickly diverted his hand to his thigh, not wanting to stoop to the level of the suspected table-breaking bastard.
"Damn it, that's why Hunter abuse is a societal problem."
"Who did it? Do they know how fragile our hangover soup tables are?"
"We're already short on tables!"
"Just give us the initials, and we'll take care of it."
A barrage of criticism rained down on whoever had dared to mess with their beloved hangover soup restaurant. The last remark came from Bae Won-woo.
'How could you handle Lee Sa-young?'
Instead of retaliating, Lee Sa-young would likely strip Bae Won-woo down to his bones. Cha Eui-jae's sorrow deepened. While Bae Won-woo's gallant attempt to cheer him up was appreciated, it only made things worse. Especially today, having coughed up blood earlier, Cha Eui-jae's complexion was paler, and his sadness was doubled.
The Hunters, noticing this, began to comfort Cha Eui-jae.
"Don't be sad, part-timer."
"We'll ask our guild artisan to make a damn sturdy table."
"Let's replace all the tables and chairs while we're at it. We'll pool the money."
Their concern for the restaurant was touching. Or perhaps it was fear of fiercer seat competition. Cha Eui-jae smiled and declined their generous offers.
"Haha... it's not necessary."

chapters.title: Chapter 33: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
chapters.content:
Chapter 33: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
2:40 PM the next day. Cha Eui-jae was making the most of the broth-boiling time to clean the store, with a sign that read "Ingredient Preparation Time" hanging up.
A man in a suit approached the store and knocked on the iron door. Despite the sign indicating that ingredients were being prepared, he knocked anyway. Cha Eui-jae tightened his grip on the broom he was holding, but a voice suddenly flashed through his mind.
"I'll send someone over to you tomorrow."
Cha Eui-jae slightly loosened his grip on the broom and opened the door. The man in sunglasses bowed slightly upon seeing Cha Eui-jae.
"Hello, nice to meet you. Are you Cha Eui-jae-ssi?"
"Yes, that's me."
"Hello, I am 'A Small Miracle' Seo Min-gi. Guild Leader Lee Sa-young sent me."
'A Small Miracle' Seo Min-gi. It was such a long and strange name that, although I had only briefly seen it on the 1st Hunter Channel, it remained clearly in my memory. However, it wasn't polite to mention someone's unusual name upon first meeting, so Cha Eui-jae also bowed slightly.
"Hello."
"Yes, please accept my business card first."
Seo Min-gi politely handed over his business card with both hands. Cha Eui-jae, who had placed the broom under his arm, also politely received the small rectangular piece of paper. Pado Guild Combat Support Team 1, 'A Small Miracle' Seo Min-gi.
"Today, I will assist you with the ability measurement and registration process. Just a moment."
Seo Min-gi took out a tablet from his inventory and showed the screen.
[Operation Get a Low Rating!]
The explosive background image and the title written in red Gothic font immediately caught Cha Eui-jae's attention. Cha Eui-jae's expression became odd upon seeing the bizarre design template, but Seo Min-gi had a very serious face.
"The goal is to get a low rating without standing out, correct?"
"..."
"Oh, you don't have to answer verbally. Just answer this survey with sincerity."
As Seo Min-gi flipped the screen, a survey appeared. Cha Eui-jae began answering the survey with the tablet pen that Seo Min-gi had handed over.
[1. What rating would you like to receive upon Awakened registration? Please specify between S and F.]
He needed to receive a low and common rating. This was the condition Cha Eui-jae had proposed when accepting Lee Sa-young's offer, so he tapped the pen on his lips, contemplating for a moment.
Receiving an F-grade would be too unrealistic given his true S-grade abilities, and he thought it would bring about too many explanations, just like when he was hiding as a non-awakened person. It's not as if an F-grade could kill monsters with bare hands by sheer luck.
With a serious face, he wrote down;
E, D
[2. What is your system rank? If you don't want to reveal it, please choose one of the following options. (F~C: Weak. B~S: Strong.)]
The question showed consideration and detail. It perfectly grasped what the customer wanted to achieve through the rank manipulation. On the other hand, it was so on point that it made him wonder if they had done this kind of deal with others before.
Strong
Without much hesitation, Cha Eui-jae wrote the answer as per the example and looked down to check the final question.
[3. Do you agree to use drugs and curses to manipulate your rank?]
Wait. Something seemed off about this question. After filling in the previous questions diligently, Cha Eui-jae raised his hand to call Seo Min-gi.
"Excuse me, 'A Small Miracle' Seo Min-gi."
"Yes, sir."
"The third question seems a bit strange."
"Excuse me? Just a moment."
Seo Min-gi craned his neck to check the screen and tilted his head.
"The third question is standard. Is there an issue with it?"
"It mentions using drugs and curses. Is that correct?"
"Yes. In order to hide your abilities, you'll need to go that far."
Is this guy a fraud? Cha Eui-jae was ready to smack Seo Min-gi's head with the tablet if necessary. Sensing Cha Eui-jae's hostility, Seo Min-gi took a step back.
"Sir, do you know how the ability measurement process works for Awakened registration?"
Cha Eui-jae knew the method from eight years ago, but he wasn't aware of the latest methods. Just like the price of magic stones had risen, the measuring methods must have changed. Having had a bad experience before, he shook his head instead of pretending to know. Seo Min-gi seemed to have been waiting for this and began explaining.
"First, you fill out a form by hand. Then, you measure your abilities with a device developed by the Management Bureau. The grade assignment process includes a demonstration of a representative skill."
"..."
"Handwriting can include a few lies, which we recommend. For the representative skill, you just show one skill. Neither is that important. The most important thing is the measuring device."
"The measuring device?"
"Yes. It's quite accurate, so hiding your grade from the officials is more challenging than deceiving the machine. However!"
Seo Min-gi confidently raised his index finger.
"The measuring device uses magic stones as its energy source. It doesn't react to ordinary people, only to awakened ones. In other words, it operates according to the system's rules, separate from our scientific knowledge."
"..."
"So we follow the system's rules to trick the device. We use substances or curses from dungeons that lower an awakened person's grade."
Seo Min-gi looked satisfied, as if asking what he thought of his argument.
'Why does that sound convincing?'
