Upon hearing it, Cha Eui-jae also thought it made sense. Anyway, most drugs or curses wouldn't significantly harm his body, so it seemed like something he could endure with a bit of resolve. With only his sturdy body to rely on, he needed to make the most of it.
Cha Eui-jae, as if mesmerized, properly gripped the pen and wrote his answer to the last question.
[3. Do you agree to use drugs and curses to manipulate your rank?]
Yes
Seo Min-gi, satisfied, took back the tablet and spoke.
"Alright then... Oh, did you bring your ID card?"
Luckily, he had reissued his ID card after emerging from the rift. Cha Eui-jae pointed inside the store.
"It's in my wallet."
"Please grab it and join me in the car. Let's get going quickly."
He pointed to a blue cargo truck. Its appearance matched the alley so well that Cha Eui-jae couldn't imagine that was the vehicle they had brought. Cha Eui-jae alternated glances between Seo Min-gi in his neat suit and the dusty cargo truck.
'Does the Pado Guild not have money?'
"You're not mistakenly thinking our guild is poor, are you?"
Does this guy have mind-reading abilities? Cha Eui-jae quickly averted his gaze and shook his head.
"No, I didn't think that."
"Haha, I believe you didn't, but just for reference, this is a guild vehicle used for undercover operations."
"Oh, really?"
"Why do you sound so unenthusiastic?"
After fetching his wallet from the counter, Cha Eui-jae went into the kitchen to check the boiling broth. He needed to skim off the foam a bit later, but if he left it on low heat, it should be fine as long as he returned in time. Cha Eui-jae skimmed off the foam, reduced the heat, and hung up his apron.
Cha Eui-jae, who had grabbed his wallet, climbed into the passenger seat, and Seo Min-gi mimed fastening the seatbelt. After confirming the seatbelt was fastened, Seo Min-gi started the engine.
"We won't go to the official registration center at the Awakened Management Bureau, but to a temporary registration center in Gwangjin-gu. It's faster, less conspicuous, and doesn't have strong awakeners."
"Wouldn't a newly opened place be more vigilant?"
"That was true right after it opened, but the Gwangjin-gu center has been open for three months now, so it's a bit more relaxed. They're even more lenient now since the main building is almost complete."
Seo Min-gi glanced at Cha Eui-jae and gestured toward a black box next to him.
"Do you see that black box next to you?"
"Oh, yes."
"There should be a pair of bracelets inside. Could you put them on?"
Inside the box were two silver bracelets in the shape of a snake biting its own tail. As Cha Eui-jae took out the bracelets, item information appeared.
[Shackles of Ouroboros (A)]
[When one person wears a pair, it casts a weakening curse on the wearer.]
Is this why they mentioned drugs and curses in the survey? Holding the suddenly presented cursed item, Cha Eui-jae spoke reluctantly.
"It's a weakening curse... item."
Seo Min-gi nodded sincerely.
"Yes. To lower your rank, using a weakening curse item is the quickest and easiest method."
"Can this curse be lifted?"
"Of course. We have the curse removal scroll ready, so don't worry. We'll remove it right after the measurement."
It was tough to lie systematically. Cha Eui-jae put both bracelets on his left wrist. His whole body felt heavier, like he was wearing a sandbag centered around his left arm.
"How does it feel?"
"I do feel a bit heavier. But..."
Cha Eui-jae touched the rattling bracelet on his wrist.
"Won't they notice if I use something like this to fake my grade? It seems like they could easily catch it."
Seo Min-gi shrugged his shoulders.
"Ah, it's fine. They do inspect worn items, but that's only for hunters who are being re-evaluated."
"..."
"When a newly awakened person is being assessed, they don't check items. They don't even think to do it. How could someone who hasn't even registered as a hunter get their hands on items? Unregistered individuals can't use the hunter market, after all. Besides,"
Seo Min-gi said this as he leisurely made a left turn.
"Everyone wants to receive a higher grade, not a lower one."
"..."
"Ah, I'm not trying to single you out, sir."
Why bother saying that? Cha Eui-jae glanced at his profile briefly, feeling a bit uncomfortable, but he quickly accepted it since it wasn't wrong. The bracelets on his wrist clinked and rattled as they shook.

chapters.title: Chapter 34: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
chapters.content:
Chapter 34: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
"Ah, I'm not trying to single you out, sir."
"Yeah."
"Anyway, do you think your rating is low enough now? If not, you might need to drink the weakening potion too."
Cha Eui-jae moved his limbs slightly, assessing his own physical condition. It was far from sufficient. Even getting a B-grade would be a blessing at this rate. Cha Eui-jae shook his head.
"I think it's still not enough."
"That's what I thought. Just a moment."
Coincidentally, the light was red. Seo Min-gi took out a large cardboard box from his inventory and handed it over. When Cha Eui-jae opened the lid, there were ten glass bottles neatly lined up, filled with a hazy liquid.
"These are A-grade weakening potions. They're masterpieces made overnight by the potion makers of the Pado Guild."
"...Really?"
"Yes. The guild leader promised a 300% bonus, so everyone volunteered for overtime."
What a waste of money. But that thought was fleeting.
'It's not my money anyway.'
With a considerably lighter expression, he took out one of the bottles and held it up to the light. Seo Min-gi muttered with a determined look on his face.
"They're meant to be applied to weapons originally... but drinking them shouldn't cause any major issues. We conducted a perfect biological test yesterday."
Cha Eui-jae's head stiffened as he scrutinized the opaque liquid. Who on earth did they test it on? Cha Eui-jae glanced suspiciously at Seo Min-gi for a moment, then opened the lid and drank the potion without hesitation.
However, the sensation that came over Cha Eui-jae's body was somewhat different from what Seo Min-gi described.
'It doesn't seem any different.'
Unlike the bracelet, which showed immediate effects, the potion didn't seem to cause any change. For something created from ominous biological tests, it felt too anticlimactic. With a perplexed expression, Cha Eui-jae opened a second bottle.
"How do you feel?"
Without answering, Eui-jae drank the second bottle. But his condition remained unchanged.
'There's really no difference?'
Seo Min-gi cautiously asked.
"If it's not too much trouble, could you let me know? If you feel unwell, you should take the antidote immediately."
"Seo Min-gi."
"Yes, sir."
"Does it take time for the effect to show up?"
"No. According to our tests, the effect is immediate upon consumption. The potion is so well-made that even one bottle can lower physical abilities and rank. We even got a system warning."
The story was getting stranger. Did he test it on himself? Cha Eui-jae kept inspecting the empty bottle and asked again and again to confirm.
"You said it triggers a system warning?"
"Yes. Why do you ask?"
Cha Eui-jae opened the third bottle without saying anything. By now, Seo Min-gi had noticed something was off. Drumming his fingers on the steering wheel, he asked,
"Um, just in case. I mean, it's unlikely, but just in case."
"Is it having no effect at all?"
Gulp.
Despite drinking three bottles, Cha Eui-jae felt no change. Seo Min-gi was almost in tears at this point. Why wasn't it working? After a moment of contemplation, Cha Eui-jae suddenly looked up.
"Seo Min-gi."
"Yes."
"Is the weakening potion treated as a poison by the system?"
"Ah, yes. Our guild leader drank it yesterday too, but since he's immune to most poisons, the weakening potion had no effect... oh..."
Seo Min-gi's eyes began to tremble violently. Cha Eui-jae quietly closed the box lid. It seemed like the Basilisk's Venom trait was neutralizing the weakening potion as soon as he drank it. It was likely that the system didn't even deem it worth showing a notification.
"Are you resistant to poisons, sir? I was told to be very cautious since you're supposed to be highly susceptible to them..."
Seo Min-gi muttered nervously, almost talking to himself.
"Excuse me."
"Yes? Yes, sir?"
"Is there any other way to lower my rank?"
Seo Min-gi, deep in thought with his head down, suddenly looked up.
"...What if we go to the Hunter Market now and buy all the weakening curse items with the corporate card? I've always wanted to splurge like that once in my life."
"Rejected."
"...I thought so. Word would get out immediately."
Seo Min-gi sighed deeply, looking gloomy.
"I'm truly sorry, but we hadn't predicted this at all... Yes, right now, the bracelet is all we have."
The atmosphere in the van grew tense. Seo Min-gi, seemingly shocked that his plan had failed, kept muttering with a vacant look.
Cha Eui-jae felt a bit lost too, but seeing the person next to him overly depressed, he decided to try small talk he learned while working at the hangover soup restaurant.
"Are you Buddhist?"
"Uh, no? I'm non-religious."
Then what about that rosary hanging from the rearview mirror? Cha Eui-jae almost asked but held back, just rubbing his nose slightly. However, his trained conversation skills wouldn't falter here.
"I saw the rosary."
Seo Min-gi, only then realizing what it was, nodded with a small exclamation.
"I bought it for twenty thousand won at the souvenir shop in Bulguksa Temple. For the sake of realism. Doesn't it suit this vehicle perfectly?"
Realism, huh. Is that something a guy in a suit driving a van should say? Cha Eui-jae's eyes grew cold, but luckily, the small talk seemed to have worked. Seo Min-gi, a bit more animated, muttered excitedly.
"If I look Buddhist enough, it means it served its purpose. I'm glad I bought it and hung it up."
"Ah, yes."
Cha Eui-jae half-listened to Seo Min-gi's rapid speech and opened the glove compartment. Inside, it was filled with crude massage devices, foot massagers, and foldable fans. Taking out a fan and opening it, he was greeted by an image of Buddha with a serene smile amidst lotus flowers. Cha Eui-jae closed the glove compartment with a bang.
'Did this guy just get conned?'
While Cha Eui-jae's trust in Seo Min-gi plummeted, the van steadily made its way to the registration center. Seo Min-gi parked in a paid lot near the center.
The temporary registration center was a large container placed in the town hall parking lot. At the entrance stood life-sized cutouts of Jung Bin with a thumbs-up and Lee Sa-young with folded arms wearing a gas mask. A banner hung above the door.
[We support your Awakened registration! —Awakened Management Bureau]
It was an intimidating sight, as if meant to demoralize visitors. Lee Sa-young's cutout seemed more polished, probably put up after the public service announcement. Seo Min-gi averted his gaze, perhaps to avoid looking at his superior's cutout.
"Although we've arrived, sir, I think the weakening effect of just the bracelet might not be enough for a D-grade. What if we make a strategic retreat and come back later?"
"When?"
"...I have an overseas business trip scheduled, so it will be in about three weeks."
Are you serious? Cha Eui-jae glared coldly, needing to register as soon as possible to establish an alibi. Seo Min-gi bowed his head apologetically.
"I'm sorry."
"Any other options?"
"...Honestly, today is the best time. This container is only operating until the main building construction is complete... By the time I get back from the trip, it'll probably be..."
"So if we're going to rob an empty house, today is the day?"
"Your choice of words is alarming but yes, that's correct. And the bracelet too."
Cha Eui-jae rubbed his wrist. Seo Min-gi spoke sorrowfully.
"If you don't get tested today, you'll have to stay like this until the next test. It's actually a one-time use."
Living under a weakening curse permanently didn't bother him much. However, Cha Eui-jae sensed Seo Min-gi's underlying message.
"You want me to just go and get tested now."
"Honestly, yes."
"But you just suggested a strategic retreat."
"That was out of politeness."
"..."
"I believe in you, sir. You can do it."
Seo Min-gi clasped his hands in support. Cha Eui-jae was exasperated. What made this guy so optimistic? Seo Min-gi muttered resolutely again.
"Don't worry too much. If the worst comes to worst, we'll use the last resort."
'Just get me that D-grade without any drastic measures.'
"Come on, don't be stressed. I'll get some coffee and wait. Good luck!"
Should I hit him with that rosary? Cha Eui-jae glanced at the dangling rosary but decided to let it go. Leaving Seo Min-gi, who was enthusiastically cheering with clenched fists, he pulled up his hood and trudged towards the temporary center.

chapters.title: Chapter 35: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
chapters.content:
Chapter 35: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
Cha Eui-jae trudged towards the entrance of the temporary center, his hands deeply buried in his pockets.
'What is this?'
Cha Eui-jae pulled out something hard from his pocket to check. Then, making eye contact with the serene Buddha once again, he reflected on why he had stuffed it into his pocket instead of the glovebox. Sighing softly, Cha Eui-jae put the fan back into his pocket.
As he reached the entrance, an employee standing in front of the container greeted him kindly.
"Hello. What brings you here?"
"I'm here to register as an Awakener."
"Please take a number here and wait for a moment."
Surprisingly, Seo Min-gi's claim that there were no people seemed to be true. In the temporary center, there were only Cha Eui-jae and the affiliated public officials.
Cha Eui-jae took a number from the machine, sat on a plastic chair, and checked the digital clock on the wall. 3:02 PM. The examination itself wouldn't take long, so if he moved quickly, it wouldn't interfere with the evening business.
He'd certainly be taken back to the hangover soup restaurant... Closing his eyes and waiting for a while, Cha Eui-jae's number was called.
"Number 93."
Cha Eui-jae walked to the counter and handed over his number ticket. The staff placed the ticket into a plastic basket and asked,
"What brings you here?"
"I'm here to register as an Awakener."
"Congratulations on your awakening. How long has it been since you awakened?"
It had been 11 years. But knowing that if he spoke honestly, he would be detained, Cha Eui-jae had no choice but to lie.
"It's been 3 days."
"Please give me your ID card and your phone number."
Cha Eui-jae handed over his ID card and recited his phone number. As the staff entered the number, several sheets of paper were printed from the nearby printer. After verifying his identity, the staff handed him the documents and his ID card, explaining in a businesslike manner,
"Please fill out only the highlighted parts here. Write your name, social security number, phone number, and address. For the skill name and description section, please refer to your system information and fill it out. You don't need to list all your skills, but make sure to properly write down at least one skill that you will demonstrate during the ability assessment."
"Alright."
"There are pens over there. Once you've filled everything out, please bring it back to me."
Standing up from the counter, Cha Eui-jae found a spot in the corner and gripped a pen, deep in thought. He could write the hangover soup restaurant as his address... Personal information could be filled out without much difficulty. Thoroughly managing the personal information of Awakeners was not something that existed during J's active period, making this part relatively easy.
The problem was the next part. He summoned the information window that he had deliberately avoided for a while.
[Viewing Cha Eui-jae's information.]
[There is a lot of information. Summary function is supported.]
[Would you like to view the summarized content?]
[Summary will display up to 3 traits and skills with the highest proficiency.]
[Using the summary function.]
[Error!]
[Due to ■■, certain items are inaccessible.]
Cha Eui-jae slightly frowned but quickly relaxed as several overlapping system messages popped up. It wasn't that 8 years didn't exist just because he hadn't experienced them, so it was akin to collecting 11 years' worth of data.
After waiting a bit longer, a summarized white window appeared.
[Cha Eui-jae]
Hunter Name: J
Age: 2■
Gender: Male
Grade: A (Currently under a weakening curse.)
Traits: Basilisk's Venom (S+), Enhanced Strength (S+), Poker Face (B)
Unique Traits: Hands of a Master (S+), Omniscient (S+), ■■■ ■■■(?)
Title: ■■■ ■■■
Skills: Tracker's Eye (S+), Heart Piercer (S), Soundless Steps (S)
Cha Eui-jae quickly skimmed through the information, then stared into the void, feeling overwhelmed. So, what should he write...
Skills were a lifeline for Hunters; even a good skill at a low rank could allow one to be an active Hunter.
As society stabilized and Hunters' positions rose, the Hunters' association argued that disclosing all owned skills violated personal information protection laws. The Awakened Management Bureau vehemently opposed, but after a long battle, the Bureau eventually conceded. As a result, the requirement to register all skills during Awakened registration was changed.
Thanks to this, the skill section in the Awakened registration documents was reduced to a single field for the representative skill that would be demonstrated.
The one skill written would become the Hunter's signature. Though it wasn't particularly important for Eui-jae, who intended to hide his strength and identity. However, considering he had to demonstrate it, he couldn't just make up something that didn't exist. His eyes meticulously scanned the list.
[Tracker's Eye (S+)]
The ability to track and find others wasn't a common skill. Revealing that he possessed this would make things twice as troublesome. Excluded.
[Heart Piercer (S)]
Upon use, it would definitely pierce the heart. It was also J's representative skill. If he used this now, after J's return, he'd be immediately captured by the Awakened Management Bureau. Excluded.
[Soundless Steps (S)]
Perfectly conceals presence upon use. It was unlikely a low-grade Hunter would possess such a skill. Excluded.
The lower-ranked skills were also too ambiguous to use. At this point, the only option was to use his imagination to craft a suitable lie. The problem was that his imagination was terrible.
'...What's something inconspicuous and easy to fake?'
Cha Eui-jae was good at hitting and enduring. But claiming his representative skill involved beating people up wasn't an option... After pondering for a long time, Cha Eui-jae finally wrote down a skill.
Sturdy (D)
Strengthens the body to make it tough.
'Just get hit, then claim the toughness is due to the skill.'
With nothing but a sturdy body and resilience, he decided to switch to a tank role.
***
Choi Seok-yoon, a C-grade Hunter affiliated with the Awakened Management Bureau, was assigned to the temporary Awakened registration center in Gwangjin-gu due to his newbie status.
It was nice that there wasn't much work since it was a temporary center and they would soon move to the main building, but there was so little work that it was boring. Recently, he had binge-watched an entire season of a drama during work hours. If nothing special happened today, he might finish another season.
Ding-dong.
Choi Seok-yoon, who was yawning so wide his mouth might tear, quickly checked the monitor at the sound of the alarm. Someone was finally coming for an ability assessment. He cleared his throat and raised his voice.
"Come in."
The person who entered was a tall young man in a gray hoodie. The young man approached Seok-yoon without hesitation and handed over his documents. Choi Seok-yoon was slightly taken aback by the confident movement. He quickly checked the documents.
'Name: Cha Eui-jae. Age: 28. Skill is... Sturdy? What kind of skill name is that?'
Choi Seok-yoon couldn't help but chuckle. After all, there were quite a few people with quirky skill names on HunterNet. Scratching his temple with a pen, he asked,
"Judging by the description, it seems like a defensive tank skill. Is that correct?"
"Seems like it, but I'm not really sure."
The young man's voice trailed off, in stark contrast to his previously bold movements. Choi Seok-yoon glanced at him and then reviewed the documents again.
'Awakening date... 3 days ago? That makes sense.'
A self-enhancement buff would be hard to perceive on one's own, especially if it wasn't an attack skill. Choi Seok-yoon nodded and stood up.
"One moment."
He retrieved a dummy from the corner and turned it on. The wooden dummy creaked before standing upright. Choi Seok-yoon handed the dummy a wooden sword and gestured for Cha Eui-jae to approach.
"You'll be struck while in the skill's active state. The attack will be with the average strength of a D-grade Awakener. Is that alright?"
"Yes."
"If it hurts too much, make sure to let us know. We'll give you a recovery potion."
"Okay."
The young man's voice was still somewhat timid, but considering he was about to get hit, it was remarkably composed. Choi Seok-yoon was impressed.
'He has great composure... Tanks are rare, so a mid-sized guild might take him right away.'
Meanwhile, Cha Eui-jae was...
'Pretend the hit wasn't too bad, but act like it hurts because of the pain.'
He was preparing for a Hollywood-level performance.
"Have you activated your skill?"
"Yes."
"Alright, here we go."
When Choi Seok-yoon pressed the button, the dummy raised the wooden sword and turned towards Cha Eui-jae. To Cha Eui-jae's eyes, it moved excruciatingly slow, but he couldn't dodge. He tracked the sword's descending trajectory with his eyes. It was aiming for his shoulder. As expected, the wooden sword struck his left shoulder.
'Wait a second.'
Snap!!
Hearing the ominous sound, Cha Eui-jae instantly realized something had gone terribly wrong. He had expected a somewhat heavy strike, not this light one. His anxious eyes shifted to the void.
Sure enough, the wooden sword that should have stopped upon hitting his shoulder...
'Fuck.'
...had snapped in two and was flying through the air.

chapters.title: Chapter 36: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
chapters.content:
Chapter 36: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
Snap!!
Using his divine eyesight to locate the wooden sword, he fell into a brief dilemma. Should he catch it? No, if he catches it, it's all over.
Cha Eui-jae hoped his brain would work a little faster as he pondered. Or should he just pretend to be in pain? Yeah, that's better! After making a quick decision, Cha Eui-jae slightly leaned his body and grabbed his left shoulder. He didn't forget to let out a soft groan.
"Ugh, ouch."
"..."
"Oh, it hurts so much."
Of course, it didn't help much. His voice sounded very normal even to himself, and perhaps because he was flustered, he pretended to be in pain a bit too quickly. Cha Eui-jae closed his eyes tightly. What kind of durability does a wooden sword have to break like that? Even a soup ladle from a hangover soup restaurant would be sturdier!
The wooden sword, drawing a perfect parabola, landed with a thud among the stacked boxes.
"..."
"..."
"..."
"It... really hurts..."
Though Cha Eui-jae continued to feign pain soullessly, he couldn't stop the dreadful silence from filling the container.
Choi Seok-yoon looked back and forth between the broken wooden sword, the motionless wooden doll, and Cha Eui-jae holding his shoulder with a blank expression. Just as Choi Seok-yoon was about to say something, the right arm of the doll fell to the floor with a thud.
The dreadful silence now grew to a deafening level. Cha Eui-jae glanced at the doll's arm sprawled on the floor and gritted his teeth.
"Don't they check the equipment properly? Damn government employees, really slacking off..."
Cha Eui-jae snapped back to reality, realizing it was not the time to blame the worn-out doll and fragile wooden sword! He needed to fix this hopeless situation quickly. Choi Seok-yoon was beginning to come to his senses.
"Um, Cha Eui-jae?"
"...Yes."
"That skill you used just now, is it really a D-grade?"
A hint of doubt appeared on Choi Seok-yoon's face. After calming himself, Cha Eui-jae answered.
"Yes, it's definitely a D-grade skill."
"Then why did the doll and the wooden sword break..."
"That, I don't know..."
He lowered his head. Scraping the floor with his worn-out sneakers, he muttered.
"It does say it strengthens the body, but I don't really know how..."
Cha Eui-jae, who had been mumbling and scratching his neck, gloomily asked.
"Um... sir. Do I have to compensate for this doll?"
"What? Well, first..."
"Is it... very expensive?"
[Trait: Poker Face (B) activated.]
When Cha Eui-jae, with a distressed face, rubbed his shoulder that was hit by the wooden sword, Choi Seok-yoon started to panic.
'How could I say such things to someone who has just awakened!'
There's a joke in the hunter industry. New awakeners are extremely, very, exceptionally sensitive, and they should be handled delicately like dealing with a bomb!
Of course, it's something well known by the staff at the Awakened Registration Center. It's not entirely unfounded. The trainers for new public servants shout it until their throats burst.
"Newly awakened individuals are extremely sensitive as they adapt to their suddenly changed environment. A small stimulus can lead to a big problem, so careful consideration is required when dealing with them."
In short, new awakeners are as sensitive and emotionally volatile as someone who hasn't slept for 72 hours, so don't provoke them and register them smoothly.
Luckily for Cha Eui-jae, Choi Seok-yoon was a rookie. A rookie with fresh memories of the Awakened Special Law training, which emphasized and re-emphasized the need to handle new awakeners with care!
Had he been a bit more perceptive, he might have noticed Cha Eui-jae's expression, which seemed ready to thrash someone, but unfortunately, the brainwashing-like training from the Awakened Management Bureau clouded his eyes. Besides, the fleeting glimpse of Cha Eui-jae's handsome face, despite being partially hidden by the hood, added to the trust.
'Well, what would a newly awakened person who just awakened three days ago know?'
Choi Seok-yoon's thoughts leaned towards soothing the new awakener before he could cause a bigger accident, thinking he'd soon return to the management bureau anyway and didn't want any trouble. He cleared his throat, picked up the broken arm, and spoke.
"It's fine. This doll is quite old. We were planning to replace it when moving to the main building anyway."
"Oh... really?"
"Yes, don't worry too much. Let's wrap up the skill demonstration here and proceed with the ability measurement?"
Choi Seok-yoon pointed to the measuring machine with a gentle smile. Cha Eui-jae also smiled back, but inside, he thought that the real challenge was about to begin.
'Damn it, it's one thing after another.'
This damn measurement wouldn't end.
Choi Seok-yoon pointed to the platform.
"Please take off your shoes and step on here. The machine will verify the grade and abilities registered in the system and display them on the monitor. You just need to stand still. Easy, right?"
"Yeah."
It was so easy that it was a problem. Even if he assumed his actual grade would be one step lower, Cha Eui-jae's current grade was A. There was a vast difference between the A-grade he wanted and the D-grade.
Cha Eui-jae quickly scanned his surroundings. There was only one monitor connected to the machine, placed on the desk. If the results were unsatisfactory, he could just destroy that.
To do so, he needed to divert Choi Seok-yoon's attention or send him out of the room altogether. Cha Eui-jae raised his hand as he was about to take off his shoes.
"Um, sir."
"Yes, what is it?"
"My shoulder really hurts from the hit... could I maybe drink a potion?"
[Trait: Poker Face (B) activated.]
Cha Eui-jae made the saddest face he could. The potion given to awakeners registering was a cheap consumable, so it wouldn't be in the personal inventory. Personal potions were too expensive to give away... which meant he'd have to go to the storage.
As expected, Choi Seok-yoon glanced around and scratched the back of his head.
"Ah, the potion is in the storage... I'll have to go get it. Will you be okay?"
"Yes. I'll measure in the meantime. Since the machine does it anyway."
"Would you? Then I'll be quick! Just stand in the footprint marks. Try not to move too much. Once the bell rings, step down and check the results. I'll be right back!"
As Choi Seok-yoon quickly left the room, Cha Eui-jae agilely took off his shoes and stepped onto the platform. A blue light started scanning from his feet up to his entire body. Soon, the bell rang, and a red letter appeared on the monitor.
[Number 93, Cha Eui-jae's grade is A.]
'I knew it, damn it.'
Cha Eui-jae sighed, thinking of Seo Min-gi, who had cheered him on with a "Fighting!" He wanted to shake him by the collar, asking if today's measurement was really the best decision, but it wasn't something Seo Min-gi could have predicted. He couldn't have known the potion he tested on himself wouldn't work.
Since it's come to this, he'd have to mess with the computer a little. As Cha Eui-jae stepped off the platform and crumpled his shoes, the moment he was about to tamper with the machine...
Bang!
Suddenly, the world shook violently. After a moment, the ground and container trembled, and a strong wind blew like a typhoon. Despite being in a windowless container!
The fierce wind blew off Cha Eui-jae's hood, which he had pulled down tightly. Cha Eui-jae stepped back, barely keeping his balance, while covering his face with his arm.
"Awakener! Are you okay..."
Choi Seok-yoon appeared at the door, holding a bundle of potions. His hair was a mess, probably due to struggling against the wind to get here. While checking his condition, Cha Eui-jae widened his eyes at the scene behind him. A blue glowing vortex was unfolding behind Choi Seok-yoon.
A rift!
Cha Eui-jae urgently reached out to Choi Seok-yoon, shouting loudly.
"Grab my hand!"
"Huh? Uh, uh? Aah!"
Choi Seok-yoon, looking bewildered, screamed as he was sucked into the rift. Cha Eui-jae gritted his teeth. A cold sweat trickled down his temples. His stomach churned. He felt something rising in his throat.
What would happen if he was sucked into the rift as well? Cha Eui-jae began to breathe heavily as terrible scenes filled his mind.
Hands clinging, begging for life, corpses trampled by monsters beyond recognition, bloodstains left so heavily that it was impossible to tell whose blood it was. And left inside the rift...
'Oh, shit.'
A blue light surged over his head like a wave. Cha Eui-jae closed his eyes tightly.

chapters.title: Chapter 37: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
chapters.content:
Chapter 37: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
A franchise café in Gwangjin-gu, just a moment ago.
[As I reported yesterday, I'm in Gwangjin-gu. The weakening potion didn't work, so the bracelet is the only thing being worn. Currently, the ability measurement is in progress.]
Shall I send it? Yes.
Seo Min-gi sent a text message to the Guild Leader and adjusted his sunglasses as he looked around.
He had come to the café to keep his one-sided promise with Cha Eui-jae. As it was a weekday late afternoon, the franchise café was quiet, which was fortunate since the task needed to be discreet. Just then, his phone buzzed briefly.
Guild Leader Lee Sa-young: OK
Surprisingly, Lee Sa-young replied! Normally, he would have read the message and ignored it. Seizing the moment to send an additional report, Seo Min-gi was interrupted by a clear voice calling him.
"Coffee Saraminki-ssi, who ordered via Smart Order! Your Americano Grande and Java Chip, and Green Tea Frappuccino with an extra shot and extra whipped cream, are ready!"
"Thank you."
He decided he would make the additional report once back in the truck. Holding the coffee in both hands, he pushed open the café's glass door with his shoulder and quickly walked out. The measurement process wouldn't take long, so he had to hurry back to the truck to monitor the situation and be ready for any sudden developments.
Seo Min-gi sucked on the straw of the Green Tea Frappuccino loaded with whipped cream.
Would Cha Eui-jae get a D grade without any issues? Unfortunately, it seemed highly unlikely. Even drinking all the weakening potions wouldn't have been enough, let alone just wearing a bracelet. A look of resolve flashed across Seo Min-gi's face.
'I was sent for situations like this.'
Hunter name: A Small Miracle Seo Min-gi, real name: Seo Min-gi. Ranked 34th in South Korea, and the man who received a higher ranking than his superior, Lee Sa-young, in the annoyingly memorable Hunter Name Voting.
'Don't worry, Guild Leader.'
He was,
'I'll handle the manipulation perfectly.'
A pro in stealth and infiltration.
The long shadow behind him wavered.
There was a reason Lee Sa-young assigned the 34th ranked hunter in South Korea to Cha Eui-jae. The measurement device developed by top researchers worldwide had almost no errors. Even trying to deceive it with weakening curses had its limits.
'So, the only option is to manipulate the result itself.'
Seo Min-gi was dispatched under the assumption of this worst-case scenario.
It would take a great deal of effort to infiltrate a securely guarded awakening management center, but it was a different story for a temporary registration center. In such an environment, infiltrating and manipulating information would be a piece of cake for Seo Min-gi. Of course, if caught, he would face a severe punishment, so getting caught was not an option.
'Don't worry, Cha Eui-jae-ssi... Even if things go south, I can handle the cleanup.'
With a safety net in place, Seo Min-gi felt at ease. However, upon returning to the parking lot, he witnessed a shocking sight that made him doubt his own eyes. He even lowered his sunglasses to take a clearer look, but the sight remained unchanged.
The container meant for data manipulation was gone, and a blue rift was pulsating in its place...
'...Why?'
It was chilling.
Unconsciously, his hands trembled, causing hot coffee to spill, but that was the least of his worries. Fluorescent-vested Rift Management Bureau staff were running around, controlling the area near the rift.
Familiar faces appeared there. For instance, A-grade hunter Yang Hye-jin from the Rift Management Bureau was there, wearing a yellow safety helmet and a fluorescent vest, waving a safety baton.
"Move quickly!"
"A 5th-grade rift has emerged at the Gwangjin-gu temporary registration center!"
"I've contacted the management bureau!"
"The disaster message?"
"It will be sent soon."
"It might be an absorption-type rift, so make sure to control the surroundings."
"How many civilians were caught up in it..."
"Is there any hunter nearby who can support?"
"Ah, Matthew is nearby!"
"Lee Sa-young is also here, but..."
Yang Hye-jin's serious expression turned blank upon hearing that name.
"There's no way he'd come. Try contacting him, but don't expect much. Also, contact Matthew immediately!"
'...There's no way the center would have a rift. This isn't a movie.'
Seo Min-gi tried to ignore the urgent voices. He was sure he was seeing things.
It seemed the effect of the weakening potion he tested yesterday hadn't worn off. Well, I did drink quite a lot. The weakening potion might have even caused mental weakness. After rationalizing, Seo Min-gi opened the truck door.
Beeeep— The loud emergency alert tone shattered his escape from reality. He put the coffee on the car seat and hurriedly took out his phone.
[Rift Management Bureau]
[15:34 Seoul Gwangjin-gu Temporary Awakener Registration Center 5th-grade rift occurred, area under control, avoid approaching]
Wh... what the heck.
Seo Min-gi despaired. Then he mentally prepared a Q&A as if he were writing on a knowledge-sharing platform.
"JisikON"
Q. [Question] Hello, Guild Leader. While I was out buying coffee, the target got caught up in a rift. What should I do?
A. Die.
Seo Min-gi's legs gave out, and he collapsed in front of the truck door like a mermaid. After receiving a special assignment from Lee Sa-young, he had simulated every possible scenario... but never imagined a rift appearing at the measurement site!
Faced with a major crisis, his brain started spinning rapidly, leaning toward a rather extreme solution.
'Should I just jump into the rift?'
With Rift Management Bureau staff controlling the entrance and reporters rushing in, it was possible to ignore them all and jump in, but doing so would lead to tomorrow's headline: "A Brave Act by A Small Miracle Seo Min-gi (34th in South Korea)... as He Dives into a Rift," with his back featured prominently. The YouTube video of him diving into the rift would surely surpass a million views. He could already imagine the comments.
—Username: "The nickname is uniquely bad"
—Why is he being criticized? Isn't it good if a hunter jumps into a rift voluntarily?
⤷He was reported to have entered a dungeon in Jongno this morning and then dived into a rift in Gwangjin-gu in the afternoon, hence the criticism.
⤷?? How can someone who entered a dungeon also jump into a rift?
⤷I'm curious about that too ^^
'Absolutely not.'
Seo Min-gi shuddered at the mere thought. As someone who made a living off stealth, such exposure would be unbearable. Moreover, A Small Miracle Seo Min-gi was supposed to have entered a dungeon in Jongno 3-ga with Bae Won-woo this morning!
Who would have thought his well-prepared alibi would become a trap? Seo Min-gi was dismayed. The perception-disrupting effect of these sunglasses had its limits; getting publicly exposed would ruin his carefully crafted alibi.
Damn it! Seo Min-gi clutched his head. He should've just ordered an iced Americano instead of a Green Tea Frappuccino with extra shot, extra whipped cream, and half Java chips blended and half drizzled. If only he had come a bit earlier, he might have been able to enter before the Rift Management Bureau hunters arrived. As he lamented endlessly, his phone buzzed at the perfect moment, as if to tell him to snap out of it.
[Guild Leader Lee Sa-young]
Sensing his fate, Seo Min-gi stared into space for a moment.
If I answer this... I'm going to get scolded terribly. And if I don't, I'll get scolded five times worse and be made an example of in the meeting. Seo Min-gi respectfully pressed the call button with both hands.
"Yes, this is A Small Miracle Seo Min-gi..."
—You answered?
"Excuse me?"
—So, you're not inside the rift then.
Seo Min-gi swallowed hard. The low voice was gently coaxing him.
—What's the situation?
After a brief silence, Seo Min-gi answered.
"...First, the current situation is entirely my fault. I am truly sorry."
—Sorry?
"...The target seems to be inside the rift."
—Seems?
"Yes. The temporary center container and part of the district office parking lot were swallowed by the rift. The Rift Management Bureau is in place, controlling the rift entrance. As it's a registration center rift, the Awakened Management Bureau should send support soon."
—Should?
It was hard to tell if Lee Sa-young was nitpicking or agreeing. He had seemingly mastered the art of killing someone with words alone.
Seo Min-gi's future looked increasingly grim, and he banged his head against the truck's body repeatedly. The truck's body dented bit by bit.
"I'm sorry. Should I just end it?"
—Forget it.
Lee Sa-young cut him off indifferently.
—I'll be there soon, so wait.
"Excuse me?"
Click. The call ended abruptly. Soon? The Guild Leader? Here? Seo Min-gi wondered if he was hearing things wrong and rubbed his ears hard. Still dazed, he looked at his now-silent phone and asked again.
"Excuse me???"

chapters.title: Chapter 38: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
chapters.content:
Chapter 38: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
"Squawk!"
At the same time, inside the rift, a giant pterosaur, struck in the throat, flapped its wings frantically before going limp. Cha Eui-jae twisted the neck of the pterosaur, which resembled a bird but exuded an unpleasant aura, with the decisiveness of wringing a chicken's neck on a hot day.
Before entering the rift, he felt nauseous, but after fighting off a few monsters, he started to feel better. Since he didn't sense any more presence, it seemed he had dealt with most of the monsters around. After stacking the pterosaur corpses neatly in a corner, he dusted off his hands.
Whether fortunately or unfortunately, the people swept into the rift seemed to have scattered. Thanks to that, he could slaughter the attacking monsters without hesitation. He stood over the dead pterosaur, rubbing his chin.
"It doesn't seem like a particularly dangerous rift... but should I reduce the number of monsters?"
He had to keep his identity hidden, so he couldn't openly rescue people, but he could indirectly ensure their safety by killing the monsters. He couldn't let innocent people get hurt because he didn't do what he could. Cha Eui-jae adjusted his misaligned shoes and started walking.
After wandering around for a while and destroying 24 pterosaurs and three herds of horned buffalo, he found a half-buried office chair with two wheels missing, a broken desk, and a half-buried cutout of Lee Sa-young near a field of blue reeds.
With a puzzled expression, Cha Eui-jae inspected the cutout. Despite being a thick piece of wood, it hadn't broken.
"Should I throw this away or not..."
After a moment of contemplation, he decided to keep the cutout. Even though it was just a familiar face, or rather, a familiar gas mask, it had become somewhat endearing due to frequent appearances in public service announcements. Recently, Park Ha-eun had been mimicking Lee Sa-young's strange hand gestures, making Cha Eui-jae acutely aware of the impact media could have on children.
In the end, he yanked out the familiar cutout and tucked it under his arm. He then stood the dirt-covered cutout upright under a tree shade and sat down on the broken chair. Though his body wobbled, his face was seriously pensive.
"Will the rescue team... come?"
This rift occurred at a temporary registration center in the middle of the city. Logically, a rescue team should come. Probably.
Since he had dealt with most of the monsters, the safety of the other survivors was ensured, and he didn't need to clear the rift himself. He just had to wait quietly for the rescue team with the Lee Sa-young cutout.
However, waiting for the rescue team posed a significant problem for him.
"What about tonight's business?"
He had to open his hangover soup restaurant at 5 PM.
Moreover, he had a practical and crucial concern. To make clear broth, he had to keep skimming the foam off the top, and leaving it unattended for too long could affect the taste. He had also left the broth on low heat without turning off the stove...
What if a fire broke out due to neglect? The thought alone was terrifying.
Cha Eui-jae checked his phone. The clock had stopped at 3:25 since he entered the rift. With electronic devices out of order, he couldn't contact his grandmother or check the current time.
'...No way.'
If this continued, his pride in running the hangover soup restaurant without any incidents would be tarnished!
Stuck waiting for the rescue team, with his restaurant and possibly his heart at risk of burning down. Cha Eui-jae anxiously shook his legs.
Actually, the problem started with the possibility of meeting the rescue team. The plan agreed upon with Seo Min-gi was to minimize contact with other hunters and return under the guise of an ordinary hunter.
But being swept into a rift in the middle of Seoul, especially at a temporary registration center, had introduced a significant variable. The rescue team would likely include hunters from the Rift Management Bureau, the Awakened Management Bureau, and guild hunters responding to the support request.
The hangover soup restaurant was a popular spot among hunters, with all kinds of hunters frequenting it.
If a regular customer from the rescue team saw him, they would recognize him immediately.
'What brings the hangover soup restaurant's staff to this rift?'
'Right...'
Naturally, they would be curious and engage in various conversations, inevitably revealing that he got swept into the rift while registering as an awakener. All the regulars at the hangover soup restaurant would know. The mere thought sent chills down his spine.
He wanted to live quietly, but he kept bumping into hunters at the hangover soup restaurant, meeting Lee Sa-young, dealing with the aftermath of the magic stone, and now getting swept into a rift while registering as a hunter.
With so many misfortunes piling up, Cha Eui-jae recalled a superstition he had heard somewhere.
"Shit... could this year be my samjae1?"
He couldn't even ask Nexby about it due to being in the rift. His already messy life had become even more chaotic in the past few weeks. Something had undoubtedly gone wrong somewhere. He resolved to sprinkle salt around his shop once he got out of here.
Anyway, whether it was bad luck or not, he couldn't let his quiet life slip away. Even if it was already half ruined thanks to the magic stone and Lee Sa-young, and he might have to put up a sign saying 'We're still quietly open for business'... he had to protect whatever was left.
Cha Eui-jae stood up from the chair and cracked his neck.
'Time to make a plan.'
Hunters would come to rescue those trapped in the rift, but they weren't coming for him specifically. So, it was better to assume there would be no rescue team. Briefly, the faces of Mingi and Lee Sa-young flashed in his mind, but he shook them off.
'They won't come.'
It's best not to have even the slightest hope in such situations. Always assume the worst and plan accordingly to handle unexpected situations calmly. This was the truth Cha Eui-jae had learned from his experiences.
He exhaled deeply, rubbed his face, and drew a sketch on the ground with his sneaker. He had to make an efficient plan to escape this place.
To close the rift, he had to deal with its core entity. Rescue teams prioritize rescuing survivors, usually leaving the core entity for later. This meant he would be late opening his shop.
So, while the rescue team was rescuing survivors, he would avoid them and kill the core entity alone. Perfect.
Cha Eui-jae smudged the drawing on the ground with his sneaker. The rescue team would take time to locate the scattered survivors. If asked where he was after the rift closed, he could just say he was hiding in a corner.
'Kill the core entity as quickly as possible, escape, and return to the shop to manage the broth and open for evening business.'
Revisiting his plan mentally, Cha Eui-jae took out a fan with a Buddha print from his hoodie pocket. He had grabbed it from the glove compartment of the delivery truck earlier.
If he fought barehanded and got his clothes dirty, it would delay opening time. You have to make do with what you have. Cha Eui-jae closed his eyes.
'Please cooperate, Buddha.'
When he reopened his eyes, they glowed blue. Flames flickered on the flat ground map. Thanks to his earlier actions, the number of monsters seemed low. The human figures scattered around suggested the survivors were well-hidden.
After confirming the number and location of the survivors, he turned his gaze elsewhere. At the rift's center was a large, green, flickering flame.
'There it is.'
White wind wrapped around his feet, concealing his presence. Cha Eui-jae started running silently towards the flame.
***
Hunter Yang Hye-jin of the Rift Management Bureau, an A-grade hunter, stood in front of what used to be the Gwanggu Temporary Registration Center, her face marked by dark circles. The site where the container stood was now a rift-ridden ruin.
She had thought it would be a quiet day when she went to work this morning, but a major accident had happened.
'This is why you shouldn't say it's quiet... It jinxes things.'
Her fluorescent vest with "Safety" written on it flapped forlornly in the winter wind. She sniffled and muttered while lighting a cigarette.
"Sigh... Why did the rift have to appear here of all places? Our luck is terrible."
Another B-grade hunter, holding glowing safety wands in both hands, nodded as he glared at the rift's entrance.
"Yeah. Fortunately, most of those swept in are awakeners. We have some leeway."
"Leeway, my foot. Most of them are low-grade or administrative awakeners who can't fight properly. It'd be lucky if they're just hiding..."
"Senior! Senior!"
Their worried conversation was interrupted by a rookie, who had been controlling the surroundings, running up urgently. Yang Hye-jin exhaled a cloud of smoke.
"Did you come back? How many reporters showed up?"
"Oh... There were about six! More will likely come."
"It can't be helped. What about support personnel? I heard the Awakened Management Bureau was coming too."
"Uh, that's... I came to tell you this!"
The flustered rookie straightened up and shouted.
"L-Lee Sa-young is here! To raid the rift."
At the rookie's final words, Yang Hye-jin stopped halfway from lighting her cigarette. Despite her lack of response, the rookie continued to stand stiffly. Yang Hye-jin's face reflected more confusion than the rookie's anxious one.
'Have I been giving this kid too much work?'
She stared blankly at the rookie, cigarette in hand, unintentionally slipping into a moment of self-reflection.

chapters.title: Chapter 39: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
chapters.content:
Chapter 39: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
Right, it was clear that the rookie was seeing things due to being overworked. The idea of Lee Sa-young coming to a place like this was absurd. It was likely that he was so overwhelmed that he couldn't discern reality. There was no other explanation for such madness.
Yang Hye-jin looked at the rookie with pity. She thought of giving him a ginseng juice to revive him when they returned to the management office. Then she recited Lee Sa-young's profile in her head.
Lee Sa-young, who was dethroned from the top spot by J, a sudden newcomer or imposter, but had held the number one position for six years. Notable for... 'Ignoring most requests from the Awakened Management Bureau and the Rift Management Bureau.'
Since Yang Hye-jin started working at the Rift Management Bureau, Lee Sa-young had never responded to a support request. The B-grade hunter standing next to her seemed to share her thoughts as he laughed.
"Hey, why would Lee Sa-young come here? You must have seen it wrong."
"No, really, it's Lee Sa-young..."
"I've heard that more people have been dressing up in techwear with gas masks lately because of those public service ads. Could it be one of those posers?"
"That's possible."
"Right? I get chills just from seeing those ads."
As they laughed off the absurd joke, something that everyone was familiar with abruptly froze the cheerful atmosphere— a lazy voice.
"Are you here to perform a ritual... in front of the rift?"
"..."
"It looked like a family gathering."
The voice was too familiar, as it was one they regularly heard on weekend entertainment shows. Yang Hye-jin slowly turned her head. A figure in a black gas mask nonchalantly crossed the restricted line they had set up.
With such a build, wearing black techwear, a sarcastic tone, and a chillingly low voice, there was only one person it could be.
The B-grade hunter, sweating since hearing the voice, started making a cross shape with a safety bar, looking like he was trying to exorcize a demon. Yang Hye-jin dropped her cigarette. She quickly regained her composure and stamped it out with her foot.
In the midst of the confusion, everyone had the same thought in their minds.
'Why is this guy here?'
A grade 5 rift wasn't an easy one, but it also didn't require an S-grade hunter. They had requested support knowing he wouldn't come, so his actual arrival was baffling, akin to winning the lottery with a ticket bought just for fun.
Standing tall in front of the rift, Lee Sa-young tilted his head.
"What are you doing? Why aren't you going in?"
Yang Hye-jin swallowed hard and cautiously asked.
"Are you here for support?"
"Yeah."
"...What for?"
He nodded toward the swirling rift entrance.
"To get rid of this."
But why would the current number two come here for a mere grade 5 rift... Yang Hye-jin quickly gave up on getting a proper answer. Time was of the essence, and there was no time to argue with Lee Sa-young.
"Support staff from the Awakened Management Bureau are also on their way. Perhaps you should wait a bit and enter together..."
"I don't need them."
"What?"
Through the lenses of his gas mask, he glanced at the rookie, the B-grade hunter, and Yang Hye-jin in turn.
"Just take care of the survivors."
Before they could stop him, he strode into the rift. After the rift swallowed Lee Sa-young, the rookie looked between the rift and Yang Hye-jin, stomping his feet anxiously.
"Sen... Senior, what should we do?"
"Hah..."
Yang Hye-jin tossed her yellow safety helmet aside and ruffled her hair.
"What else? We need to follow him right away..."
"What? Oh, yes!"
"Lee Sa-young will handle the rift boss, so we focus on identifying and rescuing survivors. Move!"
"Yes, understood!"
"And... Rookie!"
"Yes?"
The rookie perked up. Yang Hye-jin, donning a thick bulletproof vest instead of her high-visibility jacket, pointed to the supply truck with her thumb.
"Bring more gas masks than the number of people, and grab all the antidotes and items with detox effects."
"Why...?"
Was there a monster using poison inside the rift? The rookie looked at Yang Hye-jin with a puzzled expression. She clicked her tongue and hurriedly motioned.
"If you don't want to die from Lee Sa-young's poison, hurry up!"
***
While the Rift Management Bureau hunters frantically rummaged through the supply truck, Lee Sa-young, the very reason for their rush, moved leisurely. Though he seemed ready to charge at the rift boss any moment, he paused to inspect a purple ivy vine wrapped around a tree.
After a few minutes, something round and black popped out of his shadow. It was the head of Seo Min-gi, wearing sunglasses.
"Guild Leader."
Seo Min-gi, who lived by hiding in shadows, could only hide in others' shadows. Unable to enter the rift alone, he had waited for Lee Sa-young to arrive. After his head bobbed up and down for a moment, Seo Min-gi crawled out of the shadow and stood on two feet.
Lee Sa-young spoke.
"It's quiet."
"Yes, indeed."
Usually, upon entering a rift, you'd make eye contact with monsters wandering about as if it were their backyard. But this rift had been eerily silent from the moment they stepped in, as if there were no living beings at all. Seo Min-gi pushed his sunglasses up and folded his arms behind his back.
Lee Sa-young picked up a red feather from the ground. It was glossy and free of dust. Seo Min-gi, after confirming the feather by lowering his sunglasses slightly, quickly muttered.
"It's a breast feather from a level 4 monster, the Red-breasted Pterosaur. They are ferocious, attacking anything in sight, whether human or other monsters, typically moving in packs of six or so. Judging by its condition, it seems to have fallen recently."
"Smart. You should handle the new recruit training next quarter."
"I'm sorry."
Feeling the sharp reprimand, Seo Min-gi shut his mouth. Lee Sa-young looked around after removing his gas mask.
When hunters move, they leave a distinctive scent. Whether it's their body odor, the residual scent from wielding weapons, the smell of monster blood, or the breath they exhale, or even... the scent of humans who fell to monsters. Lee Sa-young was especially adept at picking up such scents.
However, from the rift entrance to here, aside from the scent emitted by the rift's plants, there were no other scents in the rift.
'Not even a trace of blood.'
Despite being in the middle of the Red-breasted Pterosaur's territory, it was eerily quiet, suggesting that all the pterosaurs were dead. While monsters might have fought each other, such battles would leave traces.
"It's too clean."
"Do you think the rift master is a very strong entity that maintains strict control over the monsters, or someone has cleaned everything up?"
Some rifts were relatively quiet because the rift master managed the monsters well. But in such cases, the master's presence was immediately felt upon entry. This rift didn't feel like that.
"The latter."
Someone had killed all the monsters without leaving a trace.
Among those who were caught in this rift, the only one capable of that would be... Lee Sa-young thought of Cha Eui-jae, who had blocked his attack with a ladle and tore off his gas mask with bloodied hands. Yes, only Cha Eui-jae. Lee Sa-young started walking slowly.
"Seo Min-gi."
"Yes, Guild Leader."
"Where do you think my hyung would be?"
Hyung. It was a respectful term that seemed unfitting coming from Lee Sa-young. Seo Min-gi, surprised by the term, quickly composed himself after a cold stare and answered.
"Um... wouldn't he be hiding somewhere? He needs to conceal his power. There's no need to kill monsters and reveal his presence."
Seo Min-gi's opinion was plausible. Lee Sa-young's mind agreed with his reasoning. After all, Cha Eui-jae had strongly insisted on wanting to live quietly. Why would someone like that kill all the monsters? But the unnervingly quiet rift kept bothering him.
Suddenly, Lee Sa-young frowned. Come to think of it, although Cha Eui-jae had denied it, he had sold magic stones on the Tomato Market due to financial need.
'Could it be that he needed money...'
Had he killed all the monsters to collect their byproducts? That would explain the rift's suspiciously clean state. Lee Sa-young's delicate features contorted slightly as he clicked his tongue.
'Damn it, if he needed money, he could have said so.'
Cha Eui-jae was strange and suspicious. It was hard to understand what motivated him.
He claimed he wanted to live quietly but caused trouble here and there, and then suddenly accepted deals. Now, he had gotten caught in a rift but instead of staying put, he had wiped out all the monsters. It seemed he was born to attract chaos.
As they made their way through the blue reed field, they arrived at a clearing covered in grass. In the center of the clearing stood a dirt-covered life-size cutout of Lee Sa-Young and a broken office chair. Piled up in one corner were the bodies of dead pterodactyls, stacked like a tower. Seeing the cutout, Seo Min-gi was taken aback.
"Oh my god."
Lee Sa-Young approached the pile of pterodactyl corpses and picked up the one on top. The corpse was peculiarly clean, with no external injuries other than a twisted neck. He hadn't even plucked the feathers. Apparently, he wasn't after monster byproducts.
"What did you say earlier? He'd be hiding somewhere?"
"..."
Caught between the cardboard Lee Sa-Young and the real one, Seo Min-gi trembled in fear. How was he supposed to predict Cha Eui-Jae's movements when he kept defying expectations? Seo Min-gi, who operated strictly within the bounds of common sense, couldn't keep up with Cha Eui-Jae's actions. Lee Sa-Young tossed the pterodactyl aside and turned back to the cutout.
"When was this thing made?"
"Perhaps after the public service announcement aired? We'd need to ask the PR team for specifics."
"I'm not that curious..."
At Lee Sa-Young's gesture, Seo Min-gi understood and began searching the area. Meanwhile, Lee Sa-Young scrutinized the cutout. Judging by the dirt on its waist, it seemed to have been buried somewhere before someone unearthed it. Seo Min-gi, who had been surveying the surroundings, reported back.
"There are no footprints or any signs that someone passed through here."
"He didn't vanish into thin air or sink into the ground, right?"
"No, sir. It's possible he has skills to conceal his presence or traces."
"The more I know, the more entertaining it gets."
Lee Sa-Young, whose expression didn't look entertained in the least, felt a sudden burning sensation in his palm. He grimly removed his glove to inspect his hand.
The golden line, the mark of the contract inscribed with his blood, was charred black. Lee Sa-Young muttered coldly,
"What the hell is he up to, damn it."

chapters.title: Chapter 40: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
chapters.content:
Chapter 40: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
Meanwhile, Cha Eui-jae had arrived at the location of the rift's master. The arch, draped with long strands of purple wisteria flowers, was tightly sealed with massive tree trunks and vines, protecting itself with no gaps.
Cha Eui-jae punched one of the tree trunks. It made a solid sound, indicating it was densely packed. The master of the rift was inside, but even breaking through the entrance was not easy.
He cautiously surveyed the surroundings. Often, the rift's master is associated with the internal environment. Given this rift was a giant forest, the master was likely a plant-type monster.
'It would be easy to burn it.'
However, as a non-smoker, Cha Eui-jae didn't even have a small lighter. He used to carry a lighter and a torch in his inventory just in case, but not anymore. He scratched his head and sighed deeply.
"Well, it's not made of steel..."
In most cases like this, there was one solution.
"If you keep hitting it, it will break eventually!"
Bang! Bang! Bang! His ruthless fist pounded the trunk. The trunk started to dent where his fist landed. Soon, one tree cracked and broke. After breaking several more trees, he noticed a fragrant smell from a split in one of the trunks.
Cha Eui-jae tore apart the broken tree and checked inside.
[You have entered the master's lair, the 'Garden of Life.']
Amidst a garden filled with vibrant flowers, a giant deer was curled up, lying down. Cha Eui-jae stepped into the flower field. Sensing his presence, the deer lifted its head. Its blue eyes focused on Cha Eui-jae. Upon spotting the intruder, the deer roared ferociously.
Gooooo...
The entire garden began to resonate. Cha Eui-jae firmly grasped his Buddha fan. Monsters with flower heads and root bodies sprang up from the flower bed and surrounded him in dozens. The deer roared once more.
Gooooo...!
Bang! The roots lunged at Cha Eui-jae's limbs. Cha Eui-jae swiftly swung his fan, striking down the approaching roots. However, for every ten he cut down, sixteen more emerged. Likely, all the flowers in this garden were monsters.
Cha Eui-jae took a deep breath, planted his fan into the ground, and infused it with energy.
Uuuuu...
Kwooong!
A blue shockwave emanated from the fan, shaking the garden. The monsters screeched in incomprehensible agony and twisted. The emerging roots went limp, oozing green sap.
The deer shook its massive antlers in fury. Now, instead of small roots, the vines and thick tree trunks that sealed the archway surged from the ground.
Though he could eventually defeat them if he kept fighting, it would be a waste of time. For the safety of the hangover soup restaurant and its clean broth, he needed to finish quickly. His goal was to return to the shop swiftly, and closing the rift was just a means to that end.
Cha Eui-jae placed the battered Buddha fan into his hoodie pocket.
'Sorry, Buddha. I have no choice.'
He always fought relying on his own body. It was the most efficient way. Without the need for complex tactics, most problems could be solved with a sturdy and agile body.
But now, under the weakening curse, his body wasn't functioning properly. And when the body fails to perform?
'...I have to use other means.'
Cha Eui-jae pulled out a pitch-black sword from his inventory. The sword, black from blade to hilt, seemed to fit perfectly in his hand as if waiting for his touch.
'If the body doesn't work, use tools.'
[Basilisk's Fang (S)]
[A sword forged from the Basilisk's Fang by a recluse artisan living in . Only those deemed worthy are permitted to wield it.]
[Creator: ]
[Compatibility assessment in progress...]
Hissss, contrary to his expectation, as he held the sword, an ominous sound emerged from his hand along with a white system alert.
[Warning! Incompatible. Your body is being invaded by poison.]
His hand holding the sword turned black. Despite the urgent situation with the rift's master roaring ahead, Cha Eui-jae quickly shook his hand, holding the sword.
"Hey, are you crazy? Don't you remember me?"
[Issue detected! Would you like to hear the 'Basilisk's Fang' thoughts?]
For once, the system was being helpful. Cha Eui-jae evaded another root and responded quickly.
"Sure. Let's hear it!"
[Reading 'Basilisk's Fang' thoughts...]
[Fang's thoughts: I don't take orders from those weaker than me.]
This crazy sword was protesting, saying it was unfit for someone of his level to wield it. It was absurd since he was an A-grade, even with this level of equipment.
Cha Eui-jae leaped over a vine trying to wrap around his leg. The system continued its helpful guidance.
[Calculating remaining time for your body...]
[Error! Variable detected!]
[Trait: Basilisk's Venom (S+) activated.]
[Time remaining: 999:59:59]
['Basilisk's Fang' thoughts updated!]
[Updating...]
[Fang's thoughts: Why is the Venom Boss here?]
Perched on a tree trunk, Cha Eui-jae checked his arm. Almost up to his elbow, the arm that had turned black was returning to its original color, thanks to the 'Basilisk's Venom.' This crazy sword had failed to recognize its owner and was now treating the trait as its superior. Cha Eui-jae scrutinized the sword with a look of exasperation.
'Who does this insane sword's attitude resemble?'
At the West Sea rift, the 'Basilisk's Fang' had appeared out of nowhere in front of J after he lost his usual spear. In the middle of a stark white ruin, the weapon suddenly stood there, naturally arousing suspicion.
But there was no time for such thoughts there. To survive, one had to completely rely on instincts, wielding weapons and fists without any hesitation. Sharpened senses and a killer instinct were what kept him alive.
J grabbed the sword without hesitation. The handle felt warm.
[Compatibility assessment in progress...]
[Challenger of ,]
[I will lend you the power entrusted by .]
The sword tried to communicate something, but J didn't hear it. He merely needed power and grabbed the sword. The sword's energy enveloped his arm. J slaughtered the white monsters charging at him with the 'Basilisk's Fang.'
And yet now, Cha Eui-jae, wielding an S-grade weapon, was helplessly dodging tree roots.
Wherever he stepped, vines sprouted, and the deer relentlessly attacked the ground, giving him no time to rest. The fragrance of the flowers was so strong it made his head spin.
Cha Eui-jae frowned as he cut another vine aiming for his ankle.
'If I do this right, I could end it in one blow...'
However, sharp leaves were whirling near the deer. Approaching it seemed impossible, given the fierce defense. With his current physical state, getting close could result in his entire body being slashed.
Not that getting injured was an issue, but. The problem was he had no potions. Even if he relied on natural healing, there was no way all his wounds would heal before the shop opened.
'I can't cook hangover soup while bleeding...'
Moreover, hunters are extremely sensitive to the smell of blood. They would undoubtedly sniff around until they found the source. Balancing on a flying root, Cha Eui-jae looked down at the sword in his hand.
'Maybe I...'
['Basilisk's Fang' wants to speak!]
[Fang's thoughts: Don't even think about throwing me.]
It was incredibly perceptive. Cha Eui-jae ground his teeth and glared at the hilt. Even his one weapon wasn't cooperating today. He missed his broken spear more than ever.
Kugugung, the ground rumbled as a massive root shot up like a mountain. It cast a shadow over half the garden. The root swayed as if searching for its prey.
'I have no choice.'
A slight sacrifice was inevitable. When the root attacks, he would ride it straight to the deer... and pierce it in one blow. Cha Eui-jae shouted.
"Hey! Dumbass!"
The swaying root paused for a moment, and the deer roared, shaking the entire garden. The root lunged at Cha Eui-jae with ferocious speed.
At that moment.
A gloved hand appeared behind Cha Eui-jae, covering his mouth and nose, yet he made no effort to remove it. There was a sense of urgency. Simultaneously, a black hand touched the tree root aiming to pierce Cha Eui-jae.
The tree root froze. It began to rot black from the point of contact.

chapters.title: Chapter 41: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
chapters.content:
Chapter 41: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
The scent of fresh flowers that had filled the area was now overwhelmed by the sweet fragrance emanating from Lee Sa-young. The sound of his heart pounding as if it were about to explode gradually subsided.
When Lee Sa-young touched the root he was holding, the last remaining stem withered and became poisonous. Even though he had only used his ability once, the garden of life had turned into a pitch-black poisonous swamp. Only after confirming that there was nothing left alive did Lee Sa-young murmur.
"What were you thinking, challenging the master of the rift? ...You said he was under a weakening curse."
The latter part didn't seem to be directed at Cha Eui-jae.
"That's exactly my point, Guild Leader."
Seo Min-gi, who was standing behind for a while, quickly chimed in. He was wearing something that looked like an oxygen mask. Cha Eui-jae lightly slapped away Lee Sa-young's hand, which was covering his nose and mouth.
'Are you going to let go?'
With that intention, he glared at Lee Sa-young, who spoke without even turning around.
"Hey, give me that."
"Pardon?"
"You have a spare, right? Give it to me."
"..."
"I know you stockpiled."
"Yes."
A human-sized shadow appeared out of nowhere, carrying a small oxygen mask over its head, and wobbled over. Lee Sa-young nodded his head.
"Make it bigger."
The shadow quickly grew to the size of an adult man. It handed the oxygen mask to Cha Eui-jae before melting away.
[Artisan's Mass-Produced Oxygen Mask (A)]
[Wearing it in a poisoned area detoxifies a certain level of poison and helps with breathing. Better than nothing.]
[Creator: Hong Ye-seong]
Lee Sa-young whispered.
"Put it on as soon as I let go."
"..."
"Blink to answer."
This guy is full of commands. When Cha Eui-jae glared fiercely at him again, Lee Sa-young, annoyed, replied.
"If you don't want to cough up blood again, listen."
No, I have basilisk venom. Not mentioning one trait has come back as a huge burden on Cha Eui-jae.
Having no choice, Cha Eui-jae blinked. Lee Sa-young released his hand. Anyway, since he was given the item, it was only natural to use it, so Cha Eui-jae put the mask on his face. Thanks to the hard work of the basilisk venom, there wasn't much change whether he used it or not.
The surroundings became very quiet. Just when his heart seemed to calm down a bit, it started pounding loudly again. It was so loud that Lee Sa-young, standing right behind him, could hear it. A strange anxiety rose from his toes. Cha Eui-jae deliberately took a slightly deeper breath. Without even that sound, it felt like the recently disappeared anxiety would consume him.
Then a strong arm wrapped around Cha Eui-jae's shoulder and pulled him closer. With his head lowered, Lee Sa-young whispered in his ear.
"Take a deep breath."
"..."
"You're in shock right now, Hyung."
No, this isn't a shock. How many monsters have I seen? Cha Eui-jae was just...
Anxious.
Tap, tap, a small hand patted his shoulder in a steady rhythm. The faint noise penetrated the silence and his breathing. He felt his fiercely beating heart gradually calming down. Cha Eui-jae exhaled a long breath. As his mind started to clear a bit, Cha Eui-jae became curious.
'Why is Lee Sa-young here?'
Why would he come to a grade 5 rift? Even if he got a call, he could easily ignore it. No, he's the kind of guy who would ignore it, he's Lee Sa-young.
As the arm around his shoulder fell away, Cha Eui-jae turned to look at Lee Sa-young. Lee Sa-young was putting his gloves back on. He glanced at Cha Eui-jae's face and smirked as if he understood his thoughts.
"You look like you've seen a ghost."
"..."
"You didn't think I'd come?"
"Yeah."
"Why?"
"There's no reason for you to."
Lee Sa-young tilted his head slightly.
"Hyung, you really..."
"..."
"Have no faith in people."
Although his tone was as low as usual, it somehow felt mocking. Is this something to talk about trust? It was a rational conclusion. Feeling awkward, Cha Eui-jae rubbed the back of his neck.
"So why did you come?"
"I came to get you out."
Lee Sa-young answered and nodded towards the pitch-black poisonous swamp.
"But to think you were fighting the master of the rift."
Damn it. I should've killed it and escaped first, regardless of torn clothes. Just as Cha Eui-jae's face crumpled, Seo Min-gi shouted from afar.
"Guild Leader! It's good to take care of your customers, but there's something you need to consider!"
Lee Sa-young glanced back.
"What is it?"
"Since you melted the master of the rift instantly, there's a possibility that the rift stone it held also melted!"
As if waiting for that moment, the entire rift began to shake. The ground, the sky, even the air twisted. Seo Min-gi shrugged.
"It's already starting. Could I borrow your shadow?"
The rift stone is a type of magic stone cherished by the rift's master. Breaking it causes the rift to disappear. It's different from an exit appearing when the master dies. When a rift disappears, everyone inside is flung out to where the entrance was. Corpses and survivors alike.
Which means that survivors would see the corpses of other victims caught with them right in front of them. Bodies torn by monsters are horrifying, so rescue teams usually evacuate survivors before destroying the rift to minimize psychological trauma.
Fortunately, there shouldn't be any casualties this time... But Cha Eui-jae had another problem.
'If this continues, I'll run into the rescue team!'
Cha Eui-jae looked around in shock and made eye contact with Lee Sa-young. Lee Sa-young also shrugged.
"Unexpected situation. What do we do now?"
"What do you mean, what do we do?"
Cha Eui-jae grabbed Lee Sa-young by the collar. He looked straight into his violet eyes through the lenses and spoke word by word.
"You don't want them to catch you for destroying the rift stone, do you?"
"..."
"Memorize what I say next in one go. We need to get our stories straight."
Lee Sa-young's lips gradually curled into a smile as he listened to Cha Eui-jae's words.
***
Yang Hye-jin, who had been spat out of the rift as if ejected, kept blinking her blurry eyes, trying to focus. Her stomach churned as if she had ridden a roller coaster fifty times in a row, and her entire body ached as if she'd been beaten repeatedly with a bat. Amid the dizziness, she had only one thought.
'Lee Sa-young, that crazy bastard...'
Why on earth did he destroy the rift before the rescue operation was complete? With her face scrunched up, Yang Hye-jin barely managed to lift her upper body off the ground, using her hands for support. The forced ejection from the rift still felt awful. She could hear the busy footsteps of people around her.
"All hunters who entered the rift have returned!"
"The... The rift's disappearance has been confirmed!"
"Checking the survivors."
"How did they defeat the rift's master so quickly? They were in there for less than 30 minutes."
As she looked around amidst the commotion, Yang Hye-jin saw that the rift management office hunters who had entered with her were groaning and unconscious, unable to withstand the sudden ejection. Being an A-grade, Yang Hye-jin was the first to regain her senses.
As she leaned over, still feeling nauseous from the dizziness, a pair of black shoes stopped near her face. She frowned and looked up.
Jung Bin stood there with a gentle smile. Was Jung Bin the support staff from the Awakened Management Bureau? If she had known it was him, she would have held onto that rascal Lee Sa-young a bit longer before entering the rift.
"Are you alright? Yang Hye-jin-ssi."
"Yes... I feel like throwing up, but I'll be fine soon."
Jung Bin offered his hand to help her up. Yang Hye-jin grabbed his hand and stood up, looking around. Following her gaze, Jung Bin asked.
"Are you looking for someone?"
"Guild Leader Lee Sa-young... Where is he now?"
This couldn't be overlooked. It was against the hunter's code of conduct to destroy the rift before the rescue was complete. What if there had been casualties and the survivors were forced to see the dead bodies? Jung Bin, with an awkward smile, pointed behind him.
"He's over there. But..."
"Yes?"
"Well, I did question him once, but... it seems he had a reasonable reason for doing so. I think you'll understand once you see it."
Jung Bin stepped aside slightly. Several ambulances were lined up in the district office parking lot. Sitting at the very edge, with legs crossed, was a dark figure— clearly Lee Sa-young.
He was surprisingly neat for someone who had entered a rift, with a bright orange emergency blanket draped over his shoulder as a sign of the last bit of decency. Beside Lee Sa-young sat someone else.
The face looked oddly familiar.
'...Huh?'
The young man with a cool and neat appearance was huddled under an orange blanket, leaning on Lee Sa-young. His slightly sweaty bangs were disheveled and stuck to his forehead, and his face was particularly pale. Yang Hye-jin recognized the face well.
That's right... She had just eaten hangover soup made by that young man the night before! Yang Hye-jin cautiously asked,
"The one next to Lee Sa-young, isn't he the part-timer from the alley hangover soup restaurant?"
"Yes."
Jung Bin nodded.
"The part-timer awakened recently and came to get an inspection... and got caught up in this incident."
"Oh, my..."
Yang Hye-jin sincerely felt sorry as she checked her wristwatch. It was time for the hangover soup restaurant's ingredient preparation. Despite being busy, he had managed to make time to come for registration, only to end up in such a situation. Yang Hye-jin sighed deeply at the heartbreaking news of the kind and diligent young man. Jung Bin continued,
"According to Lee Sa-young, the rift's master this time had a power that attracted awakeners. Originally, we were supposed to stay near the master to buy time until the rescue was over, but when Lee Sa-young arrived, the part-timer, who had already been captivated, was right in front of the master..."
"Does that mean he killed it?"
"Yes."
An incident that happened while trying to save someone... Yang Hye-jin frowned and groaned, then let out another deep sigh.
"...Normally, this wouldn't just pass, but since it was done to save someone, there's not much to say."
"Haha, right? But rules are rules, so there will still be a fine."
Jung Bin said brightly, looking at the ambulance with warm eyes. Yang Hye-jin furrowed her brows after a moment of silence.
"But... is it okay to leave the part-timer next to Lee Sa-young like that? He must have used his ability to deal with the master. Couldn't it negatively affect the patient..."
"I don't know about that."
"Can you say that so casually?"
"I did bring it up, but Lee Sa-young glared at me as if he would kill me, so I ran away. Hahaha..."
Jung Bin shrugged and laughed. Yang Hye-jin stared at him with a sideways glance, then spotted a newbie retching and quickly ran over.
A little distance away, in the ambulance, Cha Eui-jae, leaning on Lee Sa-young's shoulder, was performing the trick of speaking without moving his lips.
"Did they buy it?"

chapters.title: Chapter 42: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
chapters.content:
Chapter 42: The Day You Go Is the Market Day
