Though it was merely a cover-up, it was good news for Cha Eui-jae. If Bae Won-woo had acknowledged Lee Sa-young, it would have been a headache. He was grateful to the super hamster who caused the chaos, whoever it was.
Inside the partition, which only allowed a view of the podium, was a two-person sofa and a table. Though spacious enough for two people to sit comfortably, Cha Eui-jae stood behind the sofa as it wasn't appropriate for an assistant to sit beside their boss. Lee Sa-young, sitting with crossed legs, muttered quietly without turning around.
"Why don't you sit next to me?"
"I'm comfortable here."
"The auction will take a while. A few hours."
"I'm fine."
"Ah..."
Lee Sa-young, resting his chin on his hand, let out a short laugh.
"You were sleeping so deeply that I thought you might be exhausted. But I guess that's not the case."
"..."
"If your legs get tired, let me know. I'll let you lie down."
'Damn.'
Cha Eui-jae grimaced. Lee Sa-young had been nagging him since he took a short nap in the waiting room. He himself had told him not to go anywhere and just sleep. But before he could retort, the auction began.
The auctioneer on the podium struck the gavel.
"Thank you, hunters, for attending. Now, let's start the Artisan Exhibition! The first item is an S-grade accessory, in the form of earrings. It has flame resistance, ice resistance, and mental strength increase options."
Hong Ye-seong, sitting in a plush chair on one side of the podium, had his arms crossed and was dozing off. When the bodyguard behind him whispered something in his ear, he finally came to his senses and took out the item from his inventory. It was a pair of earrings with red gemstones.
Hong Ye-seong opened his sleepy eyes. Golden patterns appeared over his pupils.
Without turning around, Lee Sa-young whispered.
"Hong Ye-seong is the only S-grade artisan in the world... It's not surprising he has the best stuff, even if it's favored by the system."
"..."
"Those are the Eyes of Appraisal."
When Hong Ye-seong brushed the earrings with his fingers, blue star-like characters appeared on the red gemstone. The same characters seen on the ticket.
[Yìxīng]
The hunter who received the earrings carefully placed them on the table. Hong Ye-seong, losing interest, closed his eyes and started dozing again. The auctioneer raised his voice.
"With the artisan's engraving confirmed, let's start the first auction. The starting price is 1 billion!"
Cha Eui-jae stared at Lee Sa-young's figure, who showed no intention of raising the paddle.
"3 billion is bid. It will now increase by 500 million. 3.5 billion!"
As items were gradually auctioned off and some time passed, Lee Sa-young still hadn't raised the paddle once. Whether there were no items he liked or he was waiting for something was unclear.
The auctioneer, who had been silent for a while, smiled mysteriously. His previously lively and firm voice lowered subtly.
"I'm sure everyone here knows about Hong Ye-seong's traits."
Deadline Finisher. A strange trait where work efficiency and speed increase as the deadline approaches. The people in the back started moving busily.
"Until now, the best equipment Hong Ye-seong made was S-grade, but..."
What he pulled out from his inventory was...
"Introducing the first S+ grade weapon made by human hands since the Day of the Rift!"
A giant spear.
One that is very similar to the one J used.
Cha Eui-jae's fingertips trembled slightly. It seemed Lee Sa-young glanced back briefly, but Cha Eui-jae couldn't take his eyes off the giant spear and Hong Ye-seong, who was hugging it.
After examining the weapon he made, Hong Ye-seong looked up and scanned the floor below with his appraisal eyes. It seemed like their eyes met for a moment because...
"Auction canceled!"
He suddenly threw the spear, stood up, snatched the auctioneer's gavel, and shouted. As the precious first S+ grade weapon rolled off the podium, people screamed. Ignoring them, Hong Ye-seong raised his voice.
"We'll restart in two hours! Wait in the waiting room! Take this!"
Then he took some powder out of his pocket and scattered it. The hall was quickly engulfed in thick black smoke, making it impossible to see ahead. The murmurs of the people also seemed swallowed by the smoke.
"..."
Only after being trapped in the silence did Cha Eui-jae come to his senses. He looked around but saw nothing but darkness. Anxiety crept up his neck. Where was Lee Sa-young? He needed to join him since he had the ticket to the waiting room...
At that moment.
"Bawk."
A strange sound came from the floor. Amid the black smoke where nothing could be seen, there stood something white and smooth... like a dumb-looking bird.
'What is this?'
As if answering Cha Eui-jae's thoughts, the bird spread its porcelain wings and crowed loudly.
"Cock-a-doodle-doo!"
'Crazy, it's a chicken?'
Before he knew it, he and the chicken had escaped the black smoke and were standing in front of a high stone wall gate. Beyond the wall, a tiled roof towered. It wasn't Jeonju Hanok Village or a folk village, so what was with the tiled house? As he looked around in a daze, Cha Eui-jae nudged the silly bird.
"Hey, what are you? Where is this?"
"Bawk."
The chicken, as if answering, pecked at the gate with its blunt beak. The gate opened wide, revealing a wide yard with grass and a grand tiled house. In one corner of the yard was a large kiln.
And on the main veranda of the tiled house visible straight through the gate, Hong Ye-seong was lying on his side, propping his head up with his arm, sucking on something flat and thin. Upon closer inspection, it was a ginseng stick. Their eyes met. Hong Ye-seong quickly sat up and tapped the spot beside him.
"You're here! Come here. Good job, Kkokko."
Despite having just caused a commotion by swinging the auction gavel like a madman, scattering powder to create smoke, and kidnapping someone with a dumb-looking porcelain chicken, the atmosphere was light.
This guy... is no ordinary lunatic.
'He's not just a little crazy.'
As Cha Eui-jae cautiously walked up and stood in front of him, Hong Ye-seong tapped the spot beside him again.
"Here, sit next to me."
"I'm fine. I'll stand."
"Quick, sit down."
The ceramic chicken waddled over, dragging a blue cushion. It then jumped off the porch and began pecking at Cha Eui-jae's ankle with its blunt beak. Cha Eui-jae, afraid the chicken's beak might break, sat down on the cushion. The wind chime at the end of the eaves rang with a clear sound.
Hong Ye-seong, sitting with one knee raised, spoke lightly.
"Sorry for bringing you here like this. But I'm in a bit of a hurry!"
"Isn't this kidnapping?"
"Hey, I'll send you back soon. Kidnapping sounds so harsh."
Hong Ye-seong laughed heartily as he threw the empty red ginseng stick wrapper behind him.
"What should I call you? Should I just call you secretary? We've met before, right?"
"We have, briefly in the restroom..."
"Yeah, yeah. You're Lee Sa-young's secretary, right?"
"Yes, that's correct. Just call me Secretary Kim."
"Okay, Secretary Kim."
Hong Ye-seong waved his hand nonchalantly, as if the name wasn't important.
"So, here's the thing. No one can enter here without my permission, so you can say anything comfortably. This is my precious house, which I made with care. Just relax. Okay? Relax."
"..."
It was chilling. Something about this setup seems fishy. Nam Woo-jin also lured him into a secluded forest under the pretense of a walk before dropping a bombshell. As Cha Eui-jae was mentally calculating the distance to the gate for a potential escape, he was startled by Hong Ye-seong suddenly thrusting his face forward.
Cha Eui-jae instinctively recoiled. Intricate golden patterns appeared over Hong Ye-seong's clear, almost crazy eyes. The patterns seemed to grow and shrink, with unreadable characters appearing and disappearing repeatedly.
The sensation was like a knife scraping his skin, sending chills down his spine. Cha Eui-jae gritted his teeth and was about to grab Hong Ye-seong by the neck when Hong Ye-seong, without blinking, said,
"It's in your inventory, isn't it?"
"..."
"The thing I made."

chapters.title: Chapter 72: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
chapters.content:
Chapter 72: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
"It's in your inventory, isn't it?"
"..."
"The thing I made."
Cha Eui-jae's breath caught in his throat. He grabbed his trembling right hand with his left. His eyes, glowing with golden patterns, scanned him thoroughly as if crushing him.
The terrible feeling of being observed beneath the shell of his body, down to the core of his existence. His stomach churned as if he might vomit any second. Gritting his teeth, Cha Eui-jae answered.
"I don't know what you're talking about."
The only thing in his inventory made by Hong Ye-seong was a ticket, which he had already given to Lee Sa-young before the auction began, so he had nothing right now. And there was nothing else that came to mind, so Cha Eui-jae asked a straightforward question.
"...Are you talking about the ticket?"
"Geez, if it was the ticket, I wouldn't have dragged you all the way here."
Hong Ye-seong muttered as if it was obvious.
"Oh, I forgot to mention this first."
Gone was his light-hearted demeanor; he now seemed slightly deranged.
"I didn't bring you here to argue with Secretary Kim. I brought you because I was sure. I saw with my own eyes that something I made is in your inventory..."
Cha Eui-jae glanced at the empty air. The only things in his inventory were potions, magic stones, and a Basilisk's Fang.
'Hong Ye-seong would likely be interested in the magic stones...'
The potions were mass-produced items, and if he were after the magic stones, he would have demanded them outright. Hong Ye-seong had been searching for magic stones more desperately than anyone.
The remaining item was the Basilisk's Fang, but there was no connection between that and Hong Ye-seong. The fang was something he retrieved from the West Sea Rift, and back when J entered the West Sea Rift, Hong Ye-seong was just an ordinary person who hadn't awakened yet.
While Cha Eui-jae was pondering, Hong Ye-seong spoke quickly.
"I'm sorry, but I don't have much time. There's no benefit in dragging this out. Lee Sa-young might come looking for you. Let's just get what we want and go our separate ways."
Only then did Hong Ye-seong's face come into view.
"I'll give you whatever you want, just take it out."
Behind the luminous, rotating golden patterns, his bloodshot eyes appeared.
Why had he kept his eyes closed throughout the auction? One would think he'd be curious about the process of his painstakingly crafted weapon finding a new owner. I thought it was simply because he was tired from an all-nighter, but there was another reason.
The system is generally generous to those it chooses to awaken. It grants new abilities and skills drawn by their earnest desires but rarely intervenes afterward. However, it mercilessly penalizes abilities that slightly infringe upon the system's rules, even if it grants those abilities.
Like how the space-moving ability of Romantic Opener is restricted, the ability to see into others' inventories, even if limited, likely infringes upon the system's rules.
If he could inspect with his Eyes of Appraisal, the ticket inspection would be over in a moment, but he went through the trouble of using a ticket detector, a subpar substitute, in the restroom...
'He must have some penalty that prevents him from using the Eyes of Appraisal for long.'
As the patterns rotated and the number of emerging letters increased, more blood vessels burst behind the golden light. Nevertheless, Hong Ye-seong did not close his Eyes of Appraisal.
"Hurry up and take it out."
Hong Ye-seong urged. As the patterns changed, a sensation like being flayed washed over Cha Eui-jae, and he had to bite the inside of his cheek to resist the urge to claw out his opponent's eyes. He tasted blood.
As this strange standoff continued,
Bzzz—
A phone in his pocket buzzed. The only people likely to call him were Park Ha-eun or Lee Sa-young. Either way, it was a call he had to answer. If it was from Lee Sa-young, the situation would be more serious. After all, he would have noticed his sudden disappearance.
'...He must be looking for me.'
His neck tingled. He had gone to great lengths to soothe his mood earlier, and he couldn't afford to upset him again. His "apologize at all costs" strategy might not work this time. That tactic should be used only once a day, as a last resort.
Ignoring the unpleasant sensation, Cha Eui-jae took his phone out of his pocket.
"Kkokko!"
"Cluck!"
As Hong Ye-seong closed and then opened his eyes, the golden patterns became even more distinct. The unwelcome sensation made Cha Eui-jae freeze. Seizing this moment, the ceramic rooster shot up like a streak of lightning and snatched the phone from his hand.
Startled by the quick theft of his phone, Cha Eui-jae stared in disbelief at the ceramic rooster, which just tilted its head quizzically while sitting calmly on top of the phone.
"Bawk."
'Damn, what kind of rooster is that agile?'
In the meantime, Hong Ye-seong groaned and covered his eyes. A thin stream of blood slowly trickled down from under his hands. As he covered his eyes, the flaying sensation ceased. Finally, Cha Eui-jae could breathe a bit easier.
"Oh dear... did you take it, Kkokko?"
"Cluck, cluck."
"Good job. I'm sorry! It's my first time kidnapping, so I forgot to take the phone first."
Bzzz, bzzz... The vibration showed no sign of stopping. The ceramic rooster shivered each time the phone buzzed beneath it.
A gentle breeze brushed past the pavilion, carrying the scent of blood. The blood flowing from Hong Ye-seong's eyes showed no signs of stopping. Putting aside his urge to argue, Cha Eui-jae first checked Hong Ye-seong's condition.
"Are your eyes okay?"
"Oh! It's because I've been using my Eyes of Appraisal for too long. I have something for this."
Hong Ye-seong cheerfully took a white bandage-like item from his inventory and wrapped it around his eyes. He quickly looked like a blind master living in seclusion in the mountains, speaking nonchalantly.
"Ta-da. It's something Nam Woo-jin made for me, and it helps a bit when I wear it."
"Then could you briefly return my phone? I need to make a call. You know how Guild Leader Lee Sa-young is."
"Nope. The phone is a hostage. If you cooperate, I'll help you smooth things over. I'll even make an excuse for you!"
"About that..."
Cha Eui-jae, rubbing his aching temples, took a deep breath and spoke honestly.
"I'm sorry, but I really don't know what you're talking about."
"..."
Hong Ye-seong stared at Cha Eui-jae despite being blindfolded. It was a piercing gaze, even through the gas mask. The buzzing resumed. The ceramic rooster yawned with its beak open. After a long pause, Hong Ye-seong muttered.
"You're not bluffing."
"Yes. I'm genuinely asking because I don't know."
"Hmm..."
Hong Ye-seong tilted his head, pondering, and then asked with a thoughtful expression.
"Don't you have a weapon in your inventory? Like a long sword. About this big."
He spread his arms wide. The description sounded familiar.
'...Could it be?'
Was he talking about the Basilisk's Fang? Did Hong Ye-seong make that? Cha Eui-jae's face filled with doubt.
The Basilisk's Fang had appeared in the West Sea Rift. The timing didn't match, but... if he showed it to Hong Ye-seong, he might learn something about the rift. It was a strange hunch, but he felt a strong conviction that he had to do it.
J had a duty to retrieve those buried there.
Ignoring the blood on his bitten lip, Cha Eui-jae spoke.
"...I do have one."
Hong Ye-seong leapt in place.
"See, I knew it! Show me."
"But this is probably not something you made, Hong Ye-seong-ssi."
"Hey, let me be the judge of that. Just show it to me. Quickly!"
Cha Eui-jae retrieved the Basilisk's Fang from his inventory. Thankfully, it didn't react violently like last time, complaining about how it was too powerful for him. Carefully, he handed the fang to Hong Ye-seong.
Hong Ye-seong cradled the sword, feeling the sheath and handle repeatedly. After a while, he muttered softly.
"...This isn't something I made."
It was a simple mistake. Cha Eui-jae bit his lip and clenched his fists.
At that moment, Hong Ye-seong gripped the handle and unsheathed the blade. He handled it like someone who had done it many times. As the jet-black obsidian-like blade was revealed, a white system window appeared before Cha Eui-jae's eyes.
[Assessing compatibility...]
Simultaneously, Hong Ye-seong murmured.
"But I did make it."
"Pardon?"
[Updating thoughts of 'Basilisk's Fang'!]
[Would you like to confirm?]
Startled, Cha Eui-jae nodded slightly.
[Updating...]
[Fang's thoughts: Father?]
'Father?'
What did that mean? Cha Eui-jae's eyes widened. Hong Ye-seong's fingertips began to glow blue. He ran his fingers along the blade. Tiny blue dots appeared on the black blade like stars. The dots soon formed letters, and the letters became a name.
[Yìxīng]
"Artistic Star."
"..."
"You know my name, right?"
Cha Eui-jae nodded silently. Hong Ye-seong caressed the blade gently as if stroking a child. His hand remained unscathed despite the sharp edge.
"I engrave my name on everything I make. So that its existence can only be confirmed by my touch. It's like a certification of authenticity..."
"..."
"My intel is really good, you know? Whenever there's good material or a strong monster, whether it's in Korea or overseas, I get DMs on InHeart asking if I can make something out of it. Why?"
Hong Ye-seong flicked the blade with his finger. A clear sound, like nothing heard before, resonated. It sounded almost like a child's laughter.
"Because I'm the only person in the world who can make equipment out of those things."
"..."
"But even I have never heard about a basilisk appearing. I've never heard of, seen, or touched any basilisk loot, so there's no way I made this sword."
Of course, he hadn't heard of it. The basilisk was the master of the West Sea rift, and J was the only one who had met the rift's master. Only J knew the truth.
"But this thing... it says I made it."
Why is there Hong Ye-seong's signature on a weapon found in the rift?
He had never entered the West Sea rift. None of the hunters who had entered the rift had possessed the Basilisk's Fang. These two facts were certain. No one knew the West Sea rift better than J.
As countless thoughts tangled messily in his head, his pulse quickened.
"Where did you get this?"
"..."
"...Ah~ come on, Secretary Kim. I'm just as shocked as you are right now. I had no idea something like this would pop up. I just thought one of my weapons might have ended up on the black market..."
Hong Ye-seong scratched his head roughly. It was more out of frustration than annoyance.
"Damn, even if I ask you, you probably won't tell me."
"..."
"I promise you this. I won't ask who you are, I won't dig into it, and I'll keep this meeting a secret. I'm not curious at all. If you need a weapon, I'll even make one for you."
"..."
"But let's at least be honest about this."
Hong Ye-seong carefully placed the fang down and grabbed Cha Eui-jae's arm firmly. Cha Eui-jae hesitated for a moment, then stopped. The loose bandages fell away, revealing bloodshot eyes that gleamed brightly.
"Where did you get this?"

chapters.title: Chapter 73: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
chapters.content:
Chapter 73: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
A Basilisk's Fang found in the West Sea rift. Although not made by Hong Ye-seong, it was said to be crafted by Hong Ye-seong.
Even without considering the engraving, Hong Ye-seong's claim had some credibility when thinking about the nature of the Basilisk's Fang. Children resemble their parents; beans grow where beans are sown, and red beans where red beans are sown.
When Cha Eui-jae fell silent, deep in thought, Hong Ye-seong began to whine.
"Hmm? Hmm? Oh, please tell me. I'm dying of curiosity."
He was just like the Basilisk's Fang, making claims of his own accord.
However, the "father" of the Basilisk's Fang, Hong Ye-seong, knew nothing about the rift in the West Sea. Simply thinking, it seemed that it was made by another Hong Ye-seong, not the one in front of him. A rift where time and space are twisted wasn't a mere wild fantasy now. Cha Eui-jae had already confirmed its possibility.
"There are many cases where they have the same names and faces but are different people."
Hong Ye-seong didn't appear in the fragments shown by Yoon Ga-eul. However, the fragments seen back then were part of the destroyed world that Yoon Ga-eul had pieced together, so somewhere, there would exist a fragment where he appeared. Cha Eui-jae gazed absentmindedly at the grass swaying with the wind.
'I need to meet Yoon Ga-eul again...'
If he could find out how the Basilisk's Fang made by the Hong Ye-seong in the fragments appeared in the West Sea rift... it might help rescue the people buried in it. He also needed to ask more about the apocalypse.
As Cha Eui-jae remained silent, Hong Ye-seong, waiting for him to speak, started tapping the floor with his foot.
"Hey? Secretary? You are listening to me, right? Are you thinking? I'll wait?"
Cha Eui-jae's gaze moved past Hong Ye-seong to a dozing ceramic chicken. The chicken, possibly disturbed by the continuous vibrations beneath it, had been shaking non-stop since it plopped down on the phone.
Someone persistent enough to call repeatedly like this could only be Lee Sa-young. Cha Eui-jae quietly looked away, watching the fluffy clouds drift across the blue sky. It was time to escape reality.
'Great, I'm fucked.'
"Secretary Kim!"
Cha Eui-jae's eyebrow twitched at the voice that sounded like it was three seconds away from turning into a roe deer. Not only was his thinking being interrupted, but now his escape from reality was being disturbed as well. Cha Eui-jae sighed deeply. He had held back three times already. Suddenly, an irritable thought popped up.
'...How can this guy be so brazen after kidnapping someone?'
Lee Sa-young's gas mask appeared in his mind, and Lee Sa-young's mocking voice began to play automatically.
'Didn't I tell you to avoid meeting others as much as possible... If you like socializing so much, why not join a mountaineering club?'
Just thinking about enduring Lee Sa-young's sarcasm made his fists clench. Overcoming one mountain only to find another taller one ahead, it seemed.
'Even if I escape, I'll have to listen to Sa-young's crap, huh?'
Cha Eui-jae quietly spoke to Hong Ye-seong, who was stomping his feet.
"You were asking where I got this from."
"Oh! You finally decided to answer. Yes, where did you get it?"
Cha Eui-jae looked at Hong Ye-seong, who was nodding enthusiastically. His upright posture on the cushion was gradually becoming skewed.
"Why are you curious?"
"Huh?"
Hong Ye-seong blinked, looking puzzled. By now, 'Secretary Kim' was slouching like the Leaning Tower of Pisa, one knee up, arm resting on it, leaning sideways. Cha Eui-jae responded bluntly.
"Why should I trust Hong Ye-seong and tell him anything?"
"Me?"
"No, really. Who would just talk based on a verbal promise? You should present a proper contract. Like, if I tell you, you'll do something for me. Shouldn't you first propose such conditions?"
"I said I'd keep it a secret and even make weapons for you!"
"Wouldn't it be suspicious if a hunter suddenly showed up with a weapon made by Hong Ye-seong?"
Initially planning to pass it off as a joke, Cha Eui-jae's words started to contain some truth, influenced by the turmoil he experienced from Lee Sa-young earlier.
"Moreover, if you demand I talk, do I have to comply? Isn't this an abuse of authority and power?"
"Wow... Huh, this is the first time I've heard something like this since my awakening. It's quite refreshing."
Caught in a sudden controversy over abuse of power, Hong Ye-seong pounded his chest.
"I'm Hong Ye-seong. And what's wrong with a parent asking where their lost child was found? Are you really not going to answer?"
Despite his emotional appeal, it unfortunately had no effect on Cha Eui-jae.
Revealing that he found it in the West Sea rift would be tantamount to declaring himself as J. What would be the benefit of divulging this information? None. Moreover, Hong Ye-seong had close ties with the Awakened Management Bureau, so even if he kept his mouth shut, there was a sufficient chance the information could leak.
With no more useful information to extract from him, and the certainty of Lee Sa-young's outburst, there was no reason to speak.
"You said earlier that you didn't make it, right? That wasn't too long ago. Are you really the parent?"
With no other choice but to mentally exhaust Hong Ye-seong, Cha Eui-jae, emboldened by having no retreat, began to mock him relentlessly, causing Hong Ye-seong to gape.
'They say he's Lee Sa-young's secretary, did he learn to be sarcastic from being around him?'
Unfortunately, the man in front of him was also wearing a gas mask, making it seem like Lee Sa-young was sitting right there.
"You also said you've never seen a basilisk. I'd like to share, but trust is lacking..."
The secretary shouldn't have seen one either. But Secretary Kim exuded the confidence of someone in the know. Hong Ye-seong, flustered, hit the black blade of the Basilisk's Fang. He waved his hand, showing it wasn't cut or injured.
"See? My name is on it, and this sharp thing doesn't harm me. The creator recognizes it."
"Let me see it."
Hong Ye-seong hesitantly handed the Basilisk's Fang over, his eyes filled with suspicion. The Basilisk's Fang, as if it missed its familiar, affectionate father's touch, struggled in the hands of this ruffian, but Cha Eui-jae grasped the handle firmly.
['Basilisk's Fang' thoughts updated!]
[Fang's thought: If you strike me, I'll cut your hand off.]
Although the Basilisk's Fang didn't recognize its master and became aggressive, Cha Eui-jae had his own plans.
[Trait: Basilisk's Venom (S+) activated.]
'Get a clue.'
['Basilisk's Fang' thoughts updated!]
[Fang's thought: Cancel the previous thought.]
Suppressing the Basilisk's Fang timid rebellion with the authority of basilisk's venom, Cha Eui-jae struck his hand against the blade without hesitation. Despite the direct hit, his hand remained unscathed. Hong Ye-seong's eyes widened. Cha Eui-jae shamelessly said.
"Maybe the blade just got dull? This doesn't seem like proof."
"Wait! I'll sharpen it. Then try again."
Somehow, the roles of the interrogator and the one being interrogated had naturally swapped. Hong Ye-seong, engrossed in proving he was the father of the Basilisk's Fang, suddenly seemed to have forgotten about his suspicions.
'It's fortunate that Hong Ye-seong is simple.'
Just as he felt a sigh of relief watching Hong Ye-seong jump up to find a whetstone, Hong Ye-seong murmured.
"...Something seems to be happening outside."
"Pardon?"
"..."
Without replying, Hong Ye-seong fiddled with his phone. Soon, a mechanical TTS voice began to play.
—Hong Ye-seong-ssi, could you possibly move up the auction restart time? ^^ There's a bit of an issue.
—Hong Ye-seong-ssi, please disregard the previous message.
—Do not come outside under any circumstances.
The messages sounded like the final words of a survivor in a horror story. Cha Eui-jae's expression turned sour, but Hong Ye-seong looked serious.
"If Jung Bin is saying things like this, it means the situation outside is seriously messed up."
"..."
"Gyu-Gyu will be cautious because of last time, and others will be wary of me. So, the only one who would do something..."
Their gazes met in mid-air. They both seemed to be thinking of the same person. As if confirming their speculation, the chicken's vibrations had also ceased. Cha Eui-jae closed his eyes tightly.
'Damn it, Sa-young. What are you up to now...'
***
"Ugh, ah..."
Messy white hair scattered in disarray. A black combat boot pressed down hard on the shoulder of the man lying on the ground. Gasping, struggling breaths escaped. Gyu-Gyu, coughing roughly, scratched at the boot with his hand, a twisted smile on his lips.
"Do you think pressing like that will break my shoulder?"
A head in a gas mask tilted slightly to the right, still holding a phone to their ear. A faint automated voice could be heard from the phone, announcing that the call couldn't be connected. A mocking voice asked.
"Who are you talking to? ...J?"
The moment the name "J" was mentioned, the foot pressing on the shoulder increased its force. A clear cracking sound of bones misaligning was heard, but despite this, Gyu-Gyu continued to observe the gas mask with a faint, mocking smile. Lee Sa-young muttered eerily.
"What makes you so confident to act this way?"
"
Cough
, fuck, this hurts..."
"You should pick your fights more wisely..."
Suddenly, a loud siren blared from somewhere. Gyu-Gyu glanced slightly, but the foot relentlessly grinding into his shoulder and moving toward his collarbone left him writhing helplessly.
"Trying to establish a pecking order here like you did with mercenaries, are you?"
Lee Sa-young tucked the phone between his ear and shoulder and was about to remove his gloves when it happened.
Swiish! A black chain shot toward Lee Sa-young. He clicked his tongue and stepped back. Gyu-Gyu clutched his shoulder and started coughing violently. The chain, unable to find its target, recoiled back into its owner's grasp. The sound of metal clanking and a deep sigh followed.
"Yes... Gyu-Gyu."
The siren sound accompanied the arrival of Jung Bin. Wrapping the black chain around his hand, he approached them. His face, usually adorned with a gentle smile, was now stern.
"I need an explanation of the situation."

chapters.title: Chapter 74: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
chapters.content:
Chapter 74: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
"An explanation..."
Lee Sa-young took the phone out from between his ear and shoulder, glanced at the screen, and replied indifferently.
"Is that necessary? You can see what's happening."
"Yes, an explanation is necessary."
The firm response came back. Lee Sa-young frowned irritably at the black chain wrapped around Jung Bin's hand. Gyu-Gyu, who had been coughing and catching his breath while lying on the ground, chuckled.
"If you answer wrong, you'll be taken away immediately... you better choose your words carefully, Lee Sa-young."
Lee Sa-young looked down at Gyu-Gyu coldly.
"Should've ripped your mouth open first..."
"Okay, okay. That's enough."
As Jung Bin sighed and swung the chain, a black iron cage sprang up between Lee Sa-young and Gyu-Gyu. Lee Sa-young shrugged and put his hands in his pockets. Gyu-Gyu also raised his hands in surrender and pressed his face to the ground.
Most combat-type Awakeners' abilities are specialized for fighting monsters. The system ranking includes contributions to dungeons and rifts, so those with specialized abilities generally rank high. However, Jung Bin, ranked 4th in Korea and an S-grade Hunter, had a slightly different ability.
His specialty was restraint. The target, however, was not monsters but other Awakeners.
With the two super hamsters isolated, Jung Bin finally smiled warmly.
"Understanding the situation precisely is necessary to decide whether to arrest you on the spot or give you some leeway."
As Jung Bin tightened his grip, the black chain wriggled like a living thing and wrapped around his arm. The end of the chain stood stiffly, as if threatening. Jung Bin clasped his hands behind his back.
"So, who threw the first punch?"
***
"What do you think Lee Sa-young did? They said not to come out at all, did he use poison? What do you think, Secretary?"
While Hong Ye-seong prattled on, making various guesses, Cha Eui-jae sat slouched, lost in thought.
'Jung Bin's ability is... restraint.'
Awakeners bound by his chain cannot use their abilities for a certain period. During the chaotic times, J had often witnessed Jung Bin dragging criminals around wrapped in chains. No matter how formidable Lee Sa-young was, if Jung Bin decided to restrain him, he wouldn't be able to do anything for a while.
If Lee Sa-young was captured by Jung Bin, would he be taken to the Awakened Management Bureau's interrogation room?
'It will be a hassle to go back to the hangover soup restaurant without him...'
To return comfortably to the hangover soup restaurant, he had to rescue the troublemaker who had caused a mess in the short time he looked away. Cha Eui-jae stood up, holding the Basilisk's Fang.
"I have to go."
"Where are you going? You can't just leave without explaining! No way!"
Hong Ye-seong spread his arms to block him, but it was laughable to Cha Eui-jae. He responded in a voice dripping with mock regret.
"I'm really sorry. But Hong Ye-seong-ssi, didn't you just engage in power abuse after kidnapping someone? If you had asked politely, I would have gladly explained, but..."
Cha Eui-jae clasped his hands together in a respectful gesture.
"I can't share the long story behind the Basilisk's Fang with someone who shows no basic manners. Sorry. Goodbye."
"No, Bunny! No, don't go!"
Hong Ye-seong reached out toward the Basilisk's Fang, almost in tears. How long had it been since they met, and he already had a nickname? The Basilisk's Fang also struggled in his hand, as if trying to escape.
[The 'Basilisk's Fang' wants to speak]
[Fang's thoughts: Father! Save me from this villain!]
'Damn...'
Playing the villain in a pathetic melodrama, Cha Eui-jae clicked his tongue.
If he left the overdramatic Hong Ye-seong alone, he'd likely be hunted for magic stones, and there was a high chance that the real Secretary Kim Seung-bin of the Pado Guild would also be added to the wanted list. Knowing Hong Ye-seong's tendencies from scrolling every day at InHeart, he'd do just that. It wasn't enough that he was robbed of his identity; now he was being chased by a madman. What had Kim Seung-bin done to deserve this?
Cha Eui-jae stared at the tearful Hong Ye-seong. He needed to shut him up somehow...
'I want to punch him just once.'
But Hong Ye-seong had to resume the auction in a couple of hours, so a physical altercation would cause chaos. Regrettably, violence was off the table. In that case...
Cha Eui-jae glanced at his inventory. A brilliant golden magic stone sparkled as if calling out to him.
'Since I can't sell it anywhere now.'
Goods are most useful when used appropriately. If you hoard them, they'll rot. Cha Eui-jae pulled the magic stone from his inventory without hesitation and called Hong Ye-seong.
"Hong Ye-seong-ssi."
"What, you villain... Huh?"
Ready to snap back, Hong Ye-seong's tone changed dramatically upon seeing the golden magic stone. His eyes widened as if they were about to pop out, and his mouth fell open. His lips trembled.
"Ma-ma-ma-ma-ma-ma-ma-ma..."
"Shh."
When Cha Eui-jae placed a finger over the filter of his gas mask, Hong Ye-seong clamped his hands over his mouth and nodded fervently. Cha Eui-jae slowly held the magic stone up to Hong Ye-seong's eyes. His once bloodshot eyes filled with tears, deeply moved.
Cha Eui-jae whispered softly.
"I heard you've been looking for this."
Nod, nod.
"You want it, right?"
Nod, nod, nod, nod, nod, nod, nod.
Hong Ye-seong nodded so enthusiastically that Cha Eui-jae worried his neck might snap. Cha Eui-jae lowered his voice, sounding regretful.
"But... I can't give such a precious thing for free."
"How much?"
"No, not money."
"Huh?"
"Do you have a contract certified by the system, with severe penalties for breach?"
Hong Ye-seong rummaged through the traditional Korean house with Kkokko and found a crisp piece of paper. It was an S-grade contract. Holding the Basilisk's Fang in one hand and the magic stone in the other, Cha Eui-jae spoke.
"Write this down."
"Yes."
Hong Ye-seong, now polite, picked up the brush and nodded eagerly. Cha Eui-jae adjusted his grip on the magic stone to catch the sunlight better and began.
"First, Awakened Hong Ye-seong will not inquire about or try to uncover anything about Secretary Kim from today onward. No attempts, no delegating to others."
"Nothing?"
"Hurry up and write. The magic stone is waiting."
"Ugh..."
Hong Ye-seong grumbled but scribbled with the brush. Cha Eui-jae waited for the dot to be placed before stating the second condition.
"Second, Awakened Hong Ye-seong will cooperate fully and sincerely with Secretary Kim's requests."
"What are you going to ask?"
"Something easy."
"Like borrowing money?"
"No, let's come up with an alibi for Jung Bin."
"Damn, that's a tough one."
Grumbling, Hong Ye-seong wrote down the second clause as instructed.
"Next?"
"Third, Awakened Hong Ye-seong will not pry into the history of the Basilisk's Fang."
"What? How could you!"
Hong Ye-seong protested, lifting his head sharply, but what he faced was...
'Oh, magic stone.'
The radiant golden magic stone glittered in the sunlight. It was what he had been searching for all this time. Tears welled up in Hong Ye-seong's eyes as he stared at it.
[The 'Basilisk's Fang' thoughts updated!]
[Fang's thoughts: Father?]
Regardless of whether the Basilisk's Fang was looking for its father, the brush unhesitatingly wrote down the third item. After a moment of silence, the Basilisk's Fang updated its thoughts again.
[Fang's thoughts: ...life is lonely.]
The handle felt unusually sharp in his hand, and the blade seemed darker. Was it going through puberty? Cha Eui-jae waved the Basilisk's Fang around, feeling a bit off. Hong Ye-seong obediently wrote down the third clause and stamped the contract with his seal.
"Give me the magic stone!"
"The magic stone."
Placing the contract into his inventory, Cha Eui-jae pointed to the traditional Korean house's gate with his thumb.
"I'll give it to you after you fulfill the contract. Let's get our story straight first."
Moments later, Cha Eui-jae, holding the smooth ceramic rooster, escaped the house with Hong Ye-seong's arm around his shoulders. The surroundings changed in an instant, as they had when they entered the waiting room. As soon as he left Hong Ye-seong's sweet home, he saw...
"..."
Lee Sa-young, sitting on the couch with his wrists bound by black chains.
'Fuck, how long has it been, and you're already caught?'
As soon as their eyes met, Lee Sa-young, gritting his teeth, glared at him. The ominous aura around Lee Sa-young flickered. Even through the clear lenses of the gas mask, the violet eyes shone ominously.
Hong Ye-seong, sensing the danger, whispered in Cha Eui-jae's ear.
"What's wrong with Lee Sa-young? Feels like I'll die if I get near him."
"Bawk."
Kkokko chirped softly, seemingly agreeing. The aura around Lee Sa-young intensified. Despite being bound by Jung Bin's chain, he radiated an impressive presence.
"Hyung..."
Lee Sa-young lifted his bound hands and removed the gas mask. His piercing gaze bore into Cha Eui-jae. He spat his words out with venom.
"I really need to lock you up somewhere."

chapters.title: Chapter 75: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
chapters.content:
Chapter 75: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
"Hyung..."
"..."
"I really need to lock you up somewhere."
'Even if you say that while being tied up...'
Cha Eui-jae gave Lee Sa-young a wary look, but Lee Sa-young continued to mumble ominously.
"Every time I take my eyes off you, something happens, and you suddenly disappear..."
Crumple, the gas mask in the black hand was crushed as if it were paper. Kkokko trembled, perhaps due to the menacing atmosphere. Cha Eui-jae stroked its smooth head. Lee Sa-young's purple eyes grew even sharper, his head tilted slightly, and his curly hair flowed gently down.
"So..."
"..."
"Do you have any plans to explain why you suddenly disappeared and then showed up with that guy?"
"That guy... Do you mean me?"
Hong Ye-seong cluelessly pointed to himself and tilted his head. 'Shut up.' Cha Eui-jae barely resisted the urge to gag Hong Ye-seong. Despite everything, Lee Sa-young didn't even glance at Hong Ye-seong and only stared at Cha Eui-jae. Cha Eui-jae blinked several times, trying to send a signal.
"Um, Guild Leader. I will explain everything."
"Yes... go on."
Lee Sa-young, seemingly annoyed to the limit, pretended not to know even while making eye contact through his lenses. He even blinked in sync with Cha Eui-jae's blinking!
'Damn it, I can't explain everything here in front of Hong Ye-seong, you idiot.'
"Should I just explain? Lee Sa-young! Secretary! Can I explain?"
"You shut up."
"..."
Hong Ye-seong sulkily lowered his head.
"And let go of that shoulder hug."
The arm draped over Cha Eui-jae's shoulder slowly came down. Making Hong Ye-seong shut up with a word, Lee Sa-young leaned back on the sofa and nodded toward Cha Eui-jae, seemingly ready to listen to something to appease his mood.
"Well, you see..."
Cha Eui-jae gritted his teeth and opened his mouth.
"Um? Hong Ye-seong-ssi. You've left the waiting room?"
A familiar voice was heard. With a puzzled expression, Jung Bin, a weary-looking Bae Won-woo, and a grumpy-looking Honeybee walked into the hall. It was a combination that gathered only those who had put up autographs on the wall of a hangover soup restaurant.
Cha Eui-jae quickly adopted the persona he had used in the morning, curling up and acting like a timid new secretary.
Honeybee, having spotted Hong Ye-seong, brushed her hair back irritably.
"You! Ugh... If you were going to postpone the auction, you should have just said so. Why did you have to sprinkle powder and cause trouble? Thanks to you, there was another incident."
"Incident? What incident?"
"Ask Jung Bin!"
Jung Bin, who had approached the three who were in a standoff, rubbed his chin.
"Um, I left a message asking Ye-seong-ssi not to come out, but it seems he didn't see it?"
"You're telling me not to come out, but everything looks fine? Nothing's broken. I even brought detox items thinking Lee Sa-young might have spread poison."
"Yes, luckily, we managed to stop him just before he used the poison. Thanks to Honeybee-ssi's quick action in hitting the alert bell, we were able to prevent it."
Jung Bin shrugged with a smiling face.
"Although Gyu-Gyu's shoulder was broken... Since the building wasn't destroyed, it's within acceptable limits, I suppose?"
"Oh, I'm truly sorry. Our guild leader is... always like this, but still. Please contact the Pado Guild if you need to."
Bae Won-woo bowed repeatedly. Lee Sa-young, watching them with an irritated face, spat out.
"He started it."
"Oh, Sa-young. Let's keep it down!"
"Haha, yes. Considering Gyu-Gyu-ssi started it, we only tied up his wrists, didn't we?"
Jung Bin's kind smile passed from Hong Ye-seong to the other gas mask beside him.
"Um, and who is this next to Hong Ye-seong-ssi?"
"Ah? This is the secretary from the Pado Guild."
"Ah, I see."
Jung Bin's soft eyes narrowed slightly.
"But why are the two of you together? Even if you were here when you entered, I didn't see you when I checked the hall right after the black powder disappeared."
"Because I kidnapped the secretary!"
"What?"
"Huh?"
At the sudden confession, both Jung Bin and Bae Won-woo widened their eyes. Lee Sa-young's gaze grew even more intense, but Cha Eui-jae ignored it and turned his head slightly, allowing Hong Ye-seong to excitedly continue as they had planned.
"No, I originally intended to kidnap Lee Sa-young. But since it was my first time using this powder, I couldn't tell what was what. So I told Kkokko to kidnap the gas mask, but it brought the secretary instead. Well, it's still young."
"Bawk?"
The longer he heard it, the longer he could understand Kkokko's cries. This time, the cry meant it was unfair. But Hong Ye-seong shamelessly continued.
"But I couldn't just kick him out right away. That would be too heartless! And I couldn't kidnap Lee Sa-young again. He'd get scolded by that tyrant boss if he went back out. So I was just offering him some tea. He looked so exhausted."
"..."
Jung Bin's gaze landed on Cha Eui-jae.
"May I ask your name?"
Deliberately making his voice tremble like a goat's, Cha Eui-jae answered in the highest, thinnest voice possible.
"Kim Seung-bin."
"Yes, Secretary Kim Seung-bin. Is everything Hong Ye-seong-ssi said true? Were you threatened or coerced in any way?"
"Yes, yes! The young master apologized for bringing me by mistake and served me green tea. He said I should stay for a while because he couldn't let me out immediately... And he introduced Kkokko to me."
Cha Eui-jae pushed Kkokko, whom he was holding, forward. Kkokko tilted its smooth head and let out a soft cry. Seeing the porcelain chicken, Jung Bin's gaze softened a bit. He poked Kkokko's blunt beak with his finger and asked.
"I see. May I ask one more thing?"
"Yes? Yes, of course."
"Where were you taken after being kidnapped?"
"Uh, it was a completely different place from here. It was a traditional house with a courtyard... Oh! There was also a kiln."
"I see..."
"Cluck! Bawk"
Jung Bin's eyes, which had been watching Cha Eui-jae, shifted to the chicken, which let out a long crow from his arms. Stroking the smooth chin of the chicken, Jung Bin smiled broadly.
"Thank you for your explanation. So, Hong Ye-seong-ssi, why did you intend to kidnap Lee Sa-young?"
"Huh? I had something to talk about with him!"
"Couldn't it have waited until after the Artisan Exhibition?"
"It couldn't, that's why. Anyway, I've explained my side, so explain your side now. What happened? What happened?"
As Hong Ye-seong urged for an explanation, Honeybee crossed her arms and sighed deeply.
"Well, you see..."
***
After the black powder that had obscured everyone's view disappeared, the hunters participating in the Artisan Exhibition found themselves facing the platform where only Hong Ye-seong's poster remained instead of the S+ grade weapon he had created.
"What's going on? Where did he go?"
"Is this a terror attack?"
"Kidnapping?"
"It can't be, Hong Ye-seong spread the powder himself."
"Are we really restarting in two hours?"
The sound of the hunters' murmuring filled the hall. The super hamsters, curious and sensitive, began to leave their partitions and look around.
Jung Bin, holding his forehead and groaning, directed the nearby Management Bureau hunters.
"Half of the staff should check the tickets of the hunters in the hall and guide them to wait in the waiting room. The other half will search the center with me to find Hong Ye-seong-ssi."
"Could he have gone to the waiting room?"
"That would be fortunate. But we must prepare for the possibility that he hasn't. Securing Hong Ye-seong-ssi's safety is our top priority."
After Jung Bin hurried off with the hunters, the remaining Management Bureau hunters started a ticket inspection one by one. However, because they worked in groups, their speed was slow, and unfortunately, they failed to notice the crucial encounter between super hamsters that needed to be avoided at all costs.
Gyu-Gyu strolled up to Lee Sa-young, who was standing and looking around. Leaning on the partition and smiling brightly, he spoke.
"Wow, it seems you have no intention of buying anything. Our second place, Lee Sa-young. The hornet has been holding a lot of paddles to get a weapon."
"..."
"You didn't touch the paddles at all? They're still in their original setup."
Lee Sa-young didn't even glance at him, taking out his phone and pressing a button to his ear. Gyu-Gyu, who had been watching him quietly, grabbed and released his half-tied hairband, letting the tousled hair scatter.
"You know~ I'm working on something right now? You probably know."
"..."
"It's a bit of a hassle, but it looked interesting, so I took it. It's fun to follow it precariously by a single thread."
The dial tone continues endlessly in Lee Sa-young's ear.
"But then...!"
Swish! A hairband turned into a sharp dagger, slicing through the air towards the pale neck under the gas mask. However,
"..."
Tuk! Lee Sa-young caught the knife with his hand without a hint of surprise, glancing sideways to identify its owner.
Gyu-Gyu shook his hand and smirked.
"Every time I tried to find something out, I kept getting blocked. It was starting to get really annoying, so I looked into it and found the Pado Guild's hand everywhere."
"..."
"I'm curious now. Why would the former number one refuse to cooperate when the country is looking for its national hero, and instead block everything tightly?"
Lee Sa-young responded coldly.
"It must be because you're not skilled enough."
"Sure, sure. Even with my lacking skills, I thought about it."
The smirk disappeared from Gyu-Gyu's face, replaced by a perfect poker face as he mouthed the words.
"Do you want J to stay dead forever?"
"..."
For a moment, the air around them went still. The hunters who had been listening to their conversation fell silent. Lee Sa-young slowly turned to face Ban Gyu-min. In his ear, the phone continued to emit an emotionless automated message.
—Unable to take your call, please leave a message...
"You want J to never appear again?"
"..."
Ban Gyu-min took a step closer, looking Lee Sa-young straight in the eye through the lenses, and spoke.
"J—"
***
"...After that, as you'd expect, Sa-young and Gyu-min had a huge fight. It looked like one of them was going to get killed, so I borrowed the call bell from the part-timer and pressed it."
"Thank you for acting quickly."
"Hmph, of course."
Honeybee snorted and fiddled with her hair, while Bae Won-woo covered his face with both hands and let out a long sigh.
"Oh dear, I'm so sorry... I should have been with him. But this time, Sa-young insisted on moving separately with his secretary."
"Haha, what can we do about what's already happened? I'm just grateful the building wasn't covered in poison."
"But I acted quickly. Don't I get a reward?"
"Well, how about some hangover soup?"
"Three bowls and I'll think about it."
"Let's meet at the hangover soup restaurant after the Artisan Exhibition then."
"Oh, me too!"
Listening to the regulars talk about hangover soup, Cha Eui-jae couldn't help but glance at Lee Sa-young. Sitting on the sofa with his hands tied, Lee Sa-young was looking at Cha Eui-jae...
and smiling.

chapters.title: Chapter 76: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
chapters.content:
Chapter 76: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
"What? Hangover soup? I want to go too!"
"Oh, don't come! Get lost!"
"Oh, that's great! Once you taste it, you won't be able to forget it."
"Haha, Ye-seong-nim, don't you have to go to Bukhansan this time? Will you have time to go to the hangover soup restaurant?"
As Hong Ye-seong tried to squeeze in between the regulars, the cartel of rankers quickly formed. And behind the firmly established hangover soup cartel, the strange standoff between Cha Eui-jae and Lee Sa-young showed no sign of ending.
The problem was that even though Lee Sa-young was smiling, it would have been better if he wasn't. Despite the twisted smile on his lips, his eyes weren't smiling at all, still glaring at Cha Eui-jae with lifeless purple eyes.
The ceramic chicken nestled in his arms made a soft peep and buried its head into Cha Eui-jae's chest. It seemed scared of Lee Sa-young. Cha Eui-jae sighed quietly, petting the chicken's head with his fingers. He thought Lee Sa-young's mood might have improved, but...
'As if that guy would.'
If anything, it probably got worse, not better. Cha Eui-jae narrowed his eyes at the smirking, pretty face. Just then, Bae Won-woo's face turned pale as he noticed Lee Sa-young.
"Sa, sa, sa, Sa-young."
"What? ...Oh, damn. Why did you take off your gas mask? Are you trying to kill someone?"
Honeybee, who had turned to look as well, shivered. As soon as Lee Sa-young noticed their gazes, he wiped the smile off his face and returned to his usual indifferent expression. He adjusted his posture, crossing his legs and resting his bound wrists on his crossed leg.
"What did I do?"
"What do you mean, 'what'? You looked like you were about to kill someone."
"Are you blind?"
"Oh, look at this rude jerk."
"Honeybee, let's just tolerate it this once, okay?"
"I missed seeing the fight earlier, so can you fight again?"
Honeybee raised her middle finger at Lee Sa-young, but Bae Won-woo quickly jumped in to block her, while Hong Ye-seong egged them on. In the midst of this chaos, Lee Sa-young, who had just taken his eyes off Cha Eui-jae, spoke leisurely.
"Jung Bin."
"Yes, Lee Sa-young-ssi."
Lee Sa-young lifted his bound wrists, making a distinct clinking sound.
"When are you going to untie this?"
"Well, I was planning to untie you after the auction. You can still use your paddle with your hands bound, and if necessary, Secretary Kim can do it for you."
"Yeah... really?"
Lee Sa-young replied in a monotone voice, giving Jung Bin a sidelong glance.
"I could destroy this place without my powers too, you know."
"Haha, are you threatening me?"
"Does it sound like a threat?"
"..."
The lively atmosphere created by the hangover soup cartel suddenly turned cold. Lee Sa-young was indeed a bloodless, tearless killer, capable of killing the mood with just a word. Jung Bin smiled with his hands behind his back.
"There should be no exceptions in the law. Even if Gyu-Gyu started the fight, didn't you break his shoulder? And you were about to use poison too."
"But I didn't use it in the end."
Bae Won-woo, who had been observing the situation, quickly intervened between them.
"It's okay. Just untie him after it's over! Haha, you're really working hard, thank you."
"What are you doing?"
Lee Sa-young asked irritably, but Bae Won-woo glanced at Cha Eui-jae and made a tearing motion. It seemed like he was telling him to tear the ticket and go to the waiting room. As much as Cha Eui-jae appreciated the thought...
'...But this guy has the ticket.'
Cha Eui-jae had to isolate this guy to avoid further trouble. He put the chicken on the floor and approached Lee Sa-young. The pretty face, now filled with irritation, looked up at him. Cha Eui-jae bent down slightly and whispered very softly.
"Let's go to the waiting room."
"..."
"I'll tell you everything there. Let's just go."
Lee Sa-young, who had been staring at Cha Eui-jae's gas mask, sighed deeply. Then he pulled out a ticket from his inventory and tore off a corner. With one last look at Honeybee's surprised face, Hong Ye-seong's intrigued expression, Jung Bin's unreadable face, and Bae Won-woo's thumbs-up, the scenery changed.
After experiencing so much in just a few hours, this quiet waiting room felt like a relief. Cha Eui-jae sighed as he took off his gas mask.
Lee Sa-young, still with his hands bound, walked briskly to the sofa and sat down. He tapped the floor with his foot and began to speak.
"So, I get that you went into Hong Ye-seong's space..."
The hearing began immediately. Cha Eui-jae pursed his lips with a sullen expression.
"Why did that guy suddenly drag you in there?"
"..."
"What did you talk about inside..."
"Well, um..."
"I want to hear it from you. In detail."
Lee Sa-young's sharp gaze swept over Cha Eui-jae, making him uncomfortable. Cha Eui-jae stood with his hands behind his back, and Lee Sa-young gestured to the seat beside him.
"Sit."
"I'll just talk standing."
"Sit down."
Sitting next to him might mean not having to face him directly. Cha Eui-jae sat a bit away from Lee Sa-young and began to think.
He couldn't tell Lee Sa-young everything about his conversation with Hong Ye-seong. Even though Lee Sa-young had seen the Basilisk's Fang in the Gwangjin-gu rift, possessing a weapon made by Hong Ye-seong carried different implications. He seemed to have more and more secrets he couldn't share with Lee Sa-young.
"Well... The chicken took me to Hong Ye-seong's space."
"Yeah."
"Hong Ye-seong was lying there eating red ginseng, then told me to sit, so I did."
"Mhm."
"..."
This was bad. Without mentioning the Basilisk's Fang, he had nothing to say. He had to twist the truth again. Staring blankly at the white wall, he continued.
"Then... Hong Ye-seong suddenly... activated his Eyes of Appraisal and said he knew everything."
"What exactly?"
"That I have the magic stone."
"The magic stone?"
"Yes... the one Hong Ye-seong was looking for."
"...How did that guy know?"
Sorry. I told him. Cha Eui-jae looked away from Lee Sa-young. But revealing the Basilisk's Fang would be like admitting he was J. Besides, from Honeybee's testimony earlier, it seemed Lee Sa-young didn't have a good opinion of J.
"Do you want J to stay dead forever?"
"You want J to never appear again?"
Cha Eui-jae bit his lip. Was it because he lost his top rank? No matter how much he thought, he couldn't figure out why Lee Sa-young disliked J, as he had never met someone like Lee Sa-young as J. In the glimpses of Lee Sa-young and J's fragments, they seemed close...
Just then, Lee Sa-young cursed under his breath.
"Ah... fuck."
"Hey, why are you swearing..."
"I can't think straight..."
He heard a short sigh, then felt soft hair brush against his shoulder and neck. Cha Eui-jae widened his eyes and looked sideways. Lee Sa-young had curled up and leaned against him. Cha Eui-jae froze in place, arms awkwardly raised.
'Why is he doing this?'
Was this a new type of attack? If the goal was to make him uncomfortable, it was a huge success. Cha Eui-jae was more flustered than ever.
But Lee Sa-young made no further moves, just soft breaths and the sound of chains clinking. And then Lee Sa-young's words made Cha Eui-jae doubt his ears.
"I'm tired..."
Did Lee Sa-young really just say that? It sounded almost like a complaint... As Cha Eui-jae stood stiffly, only his eyes moving, the muttering continued.
"You keep making me pry..."
"..."
"Making me care..."
"..."
"Annoying."
Ending with annoyance, it was definitely still Lee Sa-young. Cha Eui-jae tried to speak but then closed his mouth. The breathing near his neck seemed a bit faster.
'Ah.'
With a small clink of chains, Cha Eui-jae began to gently pat Lee Sa-young's shoulder. The shoulders, which had flinched, gradually relaxed.
Jung Bin's chains worked by suppressing the source of awakeners' powers, effectively binding them. Being used to his powers, suddenly losing them must have been disorienting. Even though only his wrists were bound, it probably felt like his entire body was tightly bound. The burden must have been immense, despite him not showing it.
Patting the firm shoulder, Cha Eui-jae clicked his tongue softly.
'It might be easier if he just raged.'
Lee Sa-young muttered again.
"So annoying..."
"Yeah, yeah. I get it. Just rest."
"..."
"Sleep if you can."
"..."
Lee Sa-young, who had clammed up, leaned in a bit more. It felt like comforting a child, making Cha Eui-jae stifle a laugh. He raised a hand to gently stroke Lee Sa-young's hair, feeling the tension drain from the body against his. The hair was softer than he had imagined.
Just then, a new message appeared on the wall.
[The Artisan Exhibition auction will resume in 30 minutes.]
[Hunters in the waiting room, please return to the hall when the timer ends.]
[Time remaining: 29:59...]
The numbers on the timer started to decrease. Cha Eui-jae watched it, wishing time would slow down, just this once.

chapters.title: Chapter 77: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
chapters.content:
Chapter 77: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
As Cha Eui-jae mechanically stroked the black hair leaning on him while staring at the white wall, he suddenly looked down at the head resting against him.
'...Huh?'
He felt a peculiar chill where their skin touched, he sensed something was off. Though he had seen many people chained while working with Jung Bin in the past, he had never seen it affect someone's body to this extent.
When Cha Eui-jae gently pushed Lee Sa-young to check his face, a slow hand grabbed his arm. However, the grip was weak, more like it was placed there than grasping firmly.
Lee Sa-young, lifting his head, slightly moved his lips.
"...Where."
"Yeah?"
"Where are you going again?"
Cha Eui-jae could feel more strength in the fingers touching his arm. Would his fingers break? Despite knowing it wouldn't happen, the rising anxiety was inevitable. Cha Eui-jae quickly patted the hand holding his arm, trying to soothe him.
"I'm not going anywhere, idiot. Where would I go?"
"..."
Facing eyes that had as much trust in him as a grain of pepper, Cha Eui-jae closed his mouth. Did we have such little trust between us? Why? Cha Eui-jae pursed his lips.
"Hey, seriously, I'm not going anywhere. I don't have anywhere to go."
"Then what is it?"
"Just want to see your face. Stay still."
"..."
Lee Sa-young pressed his lips together tightly. Cha Eui-jae turned his body towards Lee Sa-young, cupped his face with both hands, and examined it here and there. His already pale complexion had turned even whiter, he was sweating, and his violet eyes were slightly dazed and unfocused.
Seeing that he couldn't even pretend to be okay, it was clear his condition was bad. Were there any medical teams on standby around the venue? Cha Eui-jae frowned slightly and asked.
"Are you sick now?"
"..."
"If you're sick, you should say where it hurts. Enduring it won't make it go away."
"..."
J had seen countless hunters hide serious injuries and suddenly collapse, both in dungeons and rifts. There were always people who would endure without thinking about the ones who would have to carry their bodies, just to avoid worrying others.
As his mouth started to dry and his fingertips trembled, Cha Eui-jae released his hands from Lee Sa-young's face and stepped back.
'Ah, damn it.'
He didn't want Lee Sa-young to notice his shaking hands. Lee Sa-young, slowly lifting his head, looked puzzled.
"...Why?"
"Nothing. Just lie down for a bit. It's better to lie down fully."
Cha Eui-jae tried to push him away to get up, but his arm was grabbed again. As he stepped back, Lee Sa-young's face came closer again. His dazed eyes had turned fierce.
"Damn you, you said you weren't going anywhere."
"I'm just giving you space, I said."
Cha Eui-jae snapped irritably as he removed the hand holding his arm, but the other person had no intention of backing down. He needed time to calm his uneasy stomach, but this guy wouldn't even give him that brief moment.
"I'll just sit over there."
"Another lie..."
Does this guy have no trust in people? Who made Lee Sa-young lose all his trust?
Just as Cha Eui-jae was about to retort sharply, Lee Sa-young suddenly put his weight on Cha Eui-jae, slamming his head into Cha Eui-jae's shoulder.
He didn't know where the sudden strength came from in this sickly guy, but it didn't hurt much, just made him sway a little. Cha Eui-jae looked at the black crown of Lee Sa-young's head resting on his shoulder with an incredulous face.
"What are you doing?"
"...It hurts."
"What?"
"I said, I'm hurt."
"..."
The words "so what" were on the tip of his tongue, but the body temperature he felt was unnecessarily cold, and Lee Sa-young was still sweating. He could hear the irregular heartbeat. Thump, thump, thump...
'Ah.'
Cha Eui-jae looked at the ceiling, twisting his lips.
'Damn it...'
Was this the kind of irritation Les Sa-young felt? Cha Eui-jae stared at the large body leaning against him and then sighed deeply, relaxing his body. Unable to support the weight, he fell back. The soft cushion supported his head and back as Lee Sa-young collapsed on top of him. To be more accurate, he was squashed.
Mumbling under the heavy body, Cha Eui-jae spoke.
"Are you satisfied now?"
"..."
"I'm exhausted too, so let's not cause more trouble, okay?"
"Cha Eui-jae."
Lee Sa-young, who had been silent for a while, spat out the familiar three-letter name. Cha Eui-jae patted his broad back, responding indifferently.
"Your speech has been rude for a while now."
"..."
"I'm letting it slide because you're sick."
Cha Eui-jae rolled his eyes slightly. While he was wrestling with this guy, the auction was about to start.
If I stay down here for just a little longer... Cha Eui-jae, listening to the nearby breathing, closed his eyes but opened them again at the thought that crossed his mind.
'How is this guy planning to deal with the aftermath after his wrist is freed?'
At that moment, as the rapidly decreasing numbers changed to zero, a loud alarm sounded. It was similar to the siren he heard in the bathroom at dawn. Lee Sa-young, rubbing his forehead against his shoulder, muttered a curse.
"Ah... Damn it."
Cha Eui-jae patted his back.
"Time's up. Get up."
"..."
"Aren't you going to participate in the auction?"
Lee Sa-young, who had been lying still for a long time, wobbled up and leaned back against the sofa. As the heavy body moved away, Cha Eui-jae finally felt he could breathe. He also got up, straightened his crumpled clothes, and put on his gas mask again. During this time, Lee Sa-young was lying limp against the backrest, eyes closed.
'He looks like a piece of laundry.'
Being ready, Cha Eui-jae pointed to the door.
"Let's go."
"..."
Lee Sa-young let out a long sigh and got up, slowly walking out. As they opened the door, they felt numerous presence. It seemed they were the last to come out. Well, with an S+ grade weapon about to be auctioned, everyone must have been extremely anxious.
Lee Sa-young went to his designated sofa and sat deep into it, propping his arm on the armrest and holding his forehead. Maybe he had a headache, his eyes were tightly shut. Cha Eui-jae quietly took a seat behind him.
The auctioneer he had seen earlier climbed back onto the stage. He bowed his head.
"Thank you all for waiting. We will resume the auction now!"
Event staff brought up a massive spear onto the table set up on the stage.
"This is the first S+ grade equipment made by Hong Ye-seong's, the 'Giant's Spear'! The starting bid is..."
Lee Sa-young suddenly spoke.
"Raise the paddle for me."
"Huh? The auction hasn't started yet."
"Just raise it, hurry."
The moment Cha Eui-jae grabbed the paddle on the table and raised it, everyone's attention turned to them, making the hall silent. Lee Sa-young, opening his eyes slowly, spoke.
"No matter what the price is, I'm going to buy it... so back off."
His low voice swept through the hall clearly. The silence only lasted for a moment before the angry outcries of the super hamsters were heard, but Lee Sa-young had already closed his eyes again.
At that moment, with a sound like 'pop,' the walls around them turned into sand and dispersed. Someone seemed to have dismantled the walls. The hall, briefly silent again, became more chaotic.
Standing with the paddle, Cha Eui-jae looked to his left. Honeybee, sitting next to a man in a grey suit, was glaring at him. When he glanced to his right, Bae Won-woo was staring at him with his mouth open.
Instinctively, Cha Eui-jae looked towards the stage. Hong Ye-seong, sitting on the stage, had his neck stretched out like a turtle, watching Cha Eui-jae and Lee Sa-young with bright, amused eyes.
Cha Eui-jae realized instinctively. What Lee Sa-young just did was a declaration of war against the super hamsters, and at this moment, Cha Eui-jae was... the flag-bearer.
'Fuck.'
In other words, he was the foremost henchman of Lee Sa-young to be dealt with.
The auctioneer spoke in a trembling voice.
"W-we will begin the auction!"
***
The loud cheers felt like they were coming from a distance. Jung Bin slightly lifted his head but then shrugged and stared straight ahead. This place was completely separated, so there was no way he could hear the sounds from outside. He slowly walked and stood in front of a metal desk.
"Now then..."
Jung Bin, placing a file on the metal desk with a thud, pulled out a chair and sat down. The dark room, similar in structure to the interrogation rooms of the Awakened Management Bureau, was his private waiting room. Jung Bin clasped his hands together and looked at the man opposite him. Under the dim light, the yellow hair shone white.
"Isn't the auction starting? Don't you need to see it?"
"Well, what could possibly go wrong? This is more important right now."
"Oh... Are you going to release me?"
"No."
Bang Gyu-min, Gyu-Gyu, who was sitting on the chair, had his shoulders wrapped in bandages. He was tied to the chair with black chains but still wore a relaxed smile.
"We seem to have a lot to discuss, Gyu-Gyu-ssi."
Hearing his name, Gyu-Gyu smiled broadly.
"Well, I guess so. Did you release Lee Sa-young?"
"No, we plan to release him right before he goes home after the auction ends."
"Hey, just hand him over to the Awakened Management Bureau."
Gyu-Gyu wriggled his bound body and grumbled.
"Isn't that too lenient on him~? You've kept me tied up and locked in here all this time."
"Yes, yes, because you were the one who started the trouble first. And also..."
Jung Bin looked at Gyu-Gyu with a cold gaze.
"Although you were solely in charge of tracking J... you haven't reported much."
"Oh... that?"
"Yes. The director said to make sure to get it today."
"That's boring."
"I believe I have given you enough time. Now, it's time for your answer."
Jung Bin tapped his fingers on the desk and opened his mouth.
"Who is J?"

chapters.title: Chapter 78: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
chapters.content:
Chapter 78: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
"Who is J?"
"Hmm~"
As he stretched out his words, Gyu-Gyu grinned and swayed his upper body back and forth.
"What if I don't want to tell you?"
"You will have to."
When Jung Bin clenched his fist tightly, the black chain restraining Gyu-Gyu's upper body tightened further. Another chain had wrapped around his neck like a noose. Gyu-Gyu shrugged and sighed.
"Alright, alright. But! Answer one thing for me. Then I'll tell you right away."
"I'll decide after hearing it."
"Oh~ it's nothing much..."
Gyu-Gyu rotated his stiff neck.
"Why are you looking for J?"
"Because it's an order from above."
Jung Bin answered briefly and gestured for Gyu-Gyu to speak. Gyu-Gyu grimaced.
"Come on, think about it without the orders. Do we really need to find J?"
The light hanging overhead swayed precariously. Jung Bin coldly answered as he stared at Gyu-Gyu, who was still smiling.
"What is the point of your question? Just get to the point."
"It's funny, isn't it?"
Gyu-Gyu puffed his breath to lift his bangs, his brown eyes glinting under his messy, white-and-yellow hair.
"Do we really need to go to such lengths to find J like hunting a rat?"
"..."
"Take Ham Seok-jeong, for example. She couldn't even stop me from leaving the country and got reprimanded by the higher-ups... but she entrusted the task of finding J to someone like me? Does that make sense?"
Ban Gyu-min. South Korea's fifth S-grade awakened. Unlike the previous S-grades, who all chose to stay in the country, he declared that he would become a freelance hunter traveling the world. Naturally, the country was turned upside down, and Ham Seok-jeong visited him daily to persuade him.
In front of the silent Jung Bin, Gyu-Gyu continued talking as if he never expected an answer in the first place.
"It's also funny that we are searching for J because of the apocalypse. We are looking for J because of an apocalypse that we don't know when, where, or how it will come? Can't we stop it without J?"
"..."
"Why? To throw someone who barely survived the rift back in there?"
Gyu-Gyu smirked as he asked sarcastically. Jung Bin couldn't say anything. Ban Gyu-min's words were sharp as a serpent's.
"Hmm? You two are from the same era. The first S-grade and the second S-grade. Don't you know each other well?"
"..."
So deeply buried that it awakened firmly.
***
Nine years ago.
Jung Bin stood in front of the mirror, taking a deep breath. His neatly trimmed hair and spotless police academy uniform. As he checked for any wrinkles on his clothes again, the bathroom door suddenly swung open, and a middle-aged man with a sharp tiger-like look stuck his head in.
"Jung Bin, are you ready?"
"Yes, sir!"
"Good, you're very disciplined."
The man laughed heartily. He was Song Jo-heon, a well-known A-grade hunter. As Jung Bin nodded politely, Song Jo-heon opened the door wider, signaling him to follow.
"Let's go. He's a busy person, so we shouldn't keep him waiting."
"Yes, sir!"
"Remember what I told you? Don't stare too long, and don't pry too much."
"Yes, I remember."
"Good, good. He's not too difficult to deal with."
There was a hint of awkwardness in his words, but Jung Bin didn't show it and quietly followed him. After walking down a long corridor, they arrived at a door.
"We're here."
When Song Jo-heon opened the door, it revealed a spacious conference room. In the middle of the oval table, a young man was slouching, flipping through a thick file. His face was entirely covered by a mask, and his black combat suit was splattered with dried blood in places.
It was immediately obvious. He was J, the hero who saved the country.
J seemed entirely focused on what he was reading, showing no interest in who entered. Jung Bin stood straight and saluted, while Song Jo-heon bowed with a smile.
"J-nim! This is Jung Bin, the newly awakened S-grade. Please introduce yourself."
"Hmm?"
Only then did J turn his head toward Jung Bin. It felt like their eyes met through the mask. J put down the file he was reading and asked lightly.
"Oh... how old are you?"
"I'm twenty-one."
"You look younger than I thought."
His voice was oddly modulated, making it impossible to discern his age or gender. Was he just in a good mood? Jung Bin couldn't help but observe him closely.
On TV and radio, J was a reliable hero for the country. But in person, the masked youth...
'Can you even call him a youth?'
Jung Bin had always been observant. To him, J seemed far from being an adult. At most, he appeared to be a high school student, perhaps barely out of his teens. As he pondered this, J walked over to him.
When their eyes met at a slightly lower angle, J suddenly extended his hand.
"Hi, I'm J."
"Ah, I'm Jung Bin. Nice to meet you."
Jung Bin, lost in his observations, quickly shook hands after a nudge from Song Jo-heon. J's bony hand was firm but gentle. After a few shakes, J asked cheerfully.
"What's your ability?"
Jung Bin glanced at Song Jo-heon, who nodded slightly. Then he answered sincerely.
"Restraint. I can subdue my opponents."
"Monsters?"
"Awakened ones."
"Wow, that's great. There are so many awakened criminals these days, it's a headache."
"Right. Haha, he awakened at the perfect time."
Song Jo-heon patted Jung Bin on the back and urged him forward. J seemed to be pondering something.
"Alright. We should get going. Thank you for your time."
J waved and turned towards the window, jumping out. A cold wind rushed in through the open window. Song Jo-heon looked at Jung Bin, who was staring at the window, and patted him on the back.
"Hey, don't get too interested."
"Sorry?"
"Don't get too interested in J."
Seeing Jung Bin's puzzled face, Song Jo-heon shrugged.
"We need a hero right now. Knowing too much about J will only make things complicated. So I'm just giving you a heads up. Keep a proper distance. But don't make an enemy of him either."
"..."
Jung Bin probably wasn't able to hide his confusion. Clicking his tongue, Song Jo-heon left the conference room, muttering softly.
"We have no choice. Until things stabilize, the powerful ones have to sacrifice. The country is in such a state..."
Jung Bin glanced at the file left on the table. It was left open, revealing its contents.
[Swamp Toad: It's crucial to prevent it from vomiting. ★★★ Attack the head and mouth first.]
[Red-Tailed Dragon: It's troublesome if it joins its group! Pierce its throat to prevent it from calling its mates.]
J was reading a list of monster names and countermeasures written in firm, pressed handwriting. Suddenly, Jung Bin felt a tightness in his chest. He realized that if he read any more, he might start doubting things he shouldn't. He quietly turned around and followed Song Jo-heon out of the room.
***
Jung Bin stared at Gyu-Gyu. The light, which had been precariously swinging, was now completely still.
"We need to find him, even if it's not an order."
"Why?"
He remembered the back that used to leap alone into the cracks. The figure always heading into the rifts alone. The young version of himself who turned away from it. The strange discomfort he ignored back then was still vivid in his memory. He couldn't repeat the same mistake again now, after all these years.
"To protect him."
Jung Bin slammed the metal table and stood up, glaring down at Gyu-Gyu.
"So, answer me. Who is J?"
"Well, I don't know."
Even though Jung Bin had delved into his memories to give an answer, all he got in return was a lazy, half-hearted denial. He frowned and raised his index finger. The black chains tightened further around Gyu-Gyu's neck.
"You're really impatient. I've got the tail! ...But it's cut off."
Gyu-Gyu quickly added.
"Look into Lee Sa-young."
"Why?"
"I dug hard and shortlisted a few J candidates... But all information gets cut off at Lee Sa-young and the Pado Guild. That guy, he gives out misleading information and it's really annoying."
Upon hearing this, a memory flashed in Jung Bin's mind. On the day the rankings were updated, Lee Sa-young was staring at J's name on the memorial. He had claimed that anything coming out of the West Sea rift was his. Jung Bin scrutinized the singing Gyu-Gyu with suspicion.
"By the way... Why are you suddenly so cooperative?"
"Huh? You seem like a J ally."
The chain around his neck slowly slithered back onto Jung Bin's wrist. Gyu-Gyu must have awakened after J disappeared. Jung Bin asked curiously.
"Do you have a connection with J?"
"Ah, nothing special."
Gyu-Gyu smiled.
"One time, he killed a monster that was about to destroy our church."
"..."
"Well, I do repay favors~"
Gyu-Gyu closed his eyes and began to hum again. It was a song Jung Bin had never heard before.
The moments I walked through were not just ordinary, but grace...
Meanwhile, without Jung Bin, the hall full of hunters was like an 8-ton truck with a broken steering wheel.
"Number 7! Number 10! Number 2! Number 7! Number 11!"
Maybe even without brakes. The paddles were rising relentlessly, and the prices were skyrocketing.
"Hey, don't bid higher on the weapons I claimed. Aren't you putting your paddle down?"
"Huh~ So what?"
"I've cut the phone lines to prevent foreign guys from bidding."
"Good job. Kill them!"
In the middle of this battlefield, where super hamsters were charging at each other with weapons, Cha Eui-jae, who had unintentionally thrown a gas can into the fire,
"...This is fun."
He muttered while trembling with his legs, being used as a support for Lee Sa-young, who was sprawled out like a wet rag.
'Where the hell is that guy, Jung Bin, when we need him...'
He missed Jung Bin more than anyone else.

chapters.title: Chapter 79: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
chapters.content:
Chapter 79: Where Beans Are Planted, Beans Grow
Cha Eui-jae was in a relatively peaceful state for someone who had become the center of everyone's attention. That is, except for the heavy weight of Lee Sa-young's body leaning on him indiscriminately without considering his own weight.
Thunk! Thud!
"Sa-young, is this right?"
"Ah, Guild Leader! Just hang in there until the auction ends!"
"This is the right way, right?"
"Yeah. Just block, don't counterattack... we need an excuse."
Clang! Clang! Because the blades flying towards Lee Sa-young were hitting a huge wall and clattering to the ground, things were relatively peaceful beyond that.
As Lee Sa-young answered lazily with his eyes closed, Bae Won-woo let out a breath through his nose and adjusted his stance. He had been standing in front of the sofa blocking the pouring attacks since the moment Lee Sa-young made a small gesture.
"Guild Leader! Can I scream?"
"Yes."
"Okay."
Kang Ji-soo, a red-haired woman who Cha Eui-jae had seen a few times at the hangover soup restaurant, took a deep breath and then raised a paddle with the number 7 on it and shouted with a lion's roar.
"7-BID—!"
